description:
I like their Happy Hour (M-F 3-7 PM) because the cocktails are $7 and food is $7 or under.

PARKING -- literally nonexistent. It's across the street from ATT ballpark. Don't bring your car. 

AMBIANCE -- its a nice and roomy interior, lots of tables indoor and outdoors. 

SERVICE -- a little slow sometimes and hard to get staff attention but understandable because the area is large. 

FOOD AND DRINK -- really cheap during HH! And the $7 pizzas are more than enough for one person. Drinks are cheap for well drinks and house wines and cocktails.
author: RachEl L.

description:
Go Giants! The place is super packed during game days for people that want to grab a quick bite and drink up before heading to the stadium. It's literally right across the street which explains why the place is so popular. 

I was only here for drinks and they make a great Martini. I mean they should given that the logo of the restaurant is of an olive and if that's any indication of a good bar. They did a good gin based martini and I hung around long enough for a drink before splitting to the game. The place was way too crowded in my opinion and we didn't have any place to sit.
author: Tim G.

description:
This place is a 'fixture' right across from AT&T park.  Both indoor and outdoor seating (but outdoor has umbrella shades, fans all around you, and easy viewing of the stadium, trolley and crowds.)

We have been there twice when we had time to kill before the park opens (park entrances open 2 hours before the game), and grabbed a drink (they have full bar and some interesting cocktails) and salad (cobb and anjou pear/chicken).  

It always looks crowded on game day, but folks get seated within a few minutes.   There are plenty of great places to eat  amazing food inside the park, but you should experience the vibe here for at least 1 game.  

This place is pricey, food is ok, but the Giants baseball vibe is 5-stars!
author: Bill H.

description:
The staff is always friendly when we come for either HH or food. It's super close to our building so we're here often.

Lunch menu is solid and the food pretty good. I've had the salmon, and a couple salads here. You won't leave here feeling hungry.

As for drinks, they are pretty standard. Nice view of AT&T park.

The restaurant is big so there's hardly every a wait, that might be different when they're a game on.
author: Jerrica N.

description:
Momo's has always felt like a part of the day at AT&T Park. I don't go often, but I love walking by and seeing the fun going on inside before a game. The few times I've gone in, sat down, and eaten before a game I haven't been disappointed! I love being surrounded by Giants fans and a fun vibe, so the culture is great. The food is good, but not my favorite part of the experience. Last time I went I had the fish plate - sole with garlic mashed potatoes and spinach. The spinach was well cooked and the sole and potatoes were tasty, but nothing out of this world. I stole some French fries from my dad and best friends plate and was much more satisfied with that potato preparation than my own. We also had the artichoke dip, which was good but a small serving for the four of us at the table. 

Overall good! More of a place to go if you want a fun vibe rather than knock it out of the park food.
author: Dana S.

description:
stopped by for our annual boy's birthday baseball bash dodgers trip. great location right across from AT&T park. lively gameday crowd that had a very good showing of dodgers fans. probably a good 70/30 tipping to the giants fans. they were very cordial to me and my boy so kudos to them. service was fast and we got a seat for a late breakfast in about 15mins. pretty good for a sunday day game. 

prices were reasonable for being so close to the park. better than inside. menu is typical american faire with some creative options. there was  a game day beer special for domestics as well. my son ordered a pepperoni pizza and i got some thai honey wings. both were really good. server was friendly and prompt. 

we hung out for a bit afterward at the patio. great spot to chat it up with the "enemy" as well as fellow dodger cohorts. overall, great time at this great spot. if the boys in blue are here for our birthdays again, we'll definitely stop over first.
author: Rey L.

description: After finishing the Giants 5K run, a group of friends and I celebrated at Momo's. It was such a beautiful day in the city. This place is amazing. My fear was that it would have been extremely crowded after the run. There were some many participants from the race that were inside, we didn't think we would be seatedWe were seated within 5 minutes. Service was great. For starters, we devoured the baked Mac and cheese and hummus platter. I enjoyed the huevos rancheros while my friends enjoyed their salmon and beet salad. No dessert this time. We didn't want to pack on the calories that we burned from the run.
author: Arthur M.

description:
If you're a Giants fan and plan on getting F*cked up...then this is THEEEE spot for you. My friends and I, needed a full bar so MoMo's is what was nearby to us. Cool thing, is that we were seated right away.. we planned it right to come AFTER a Giants game because if it I was before a Giants game, there would have no seats available. 

The space is divided so that if you're a belligerent drunk, you will be on the right side; if you're coming for dinner with a date, then you'll be seated on the left side. As soon as you walk in, you are greeted with the bar area. This place is chill, but be prepared to see a lot of buzzed/drunk people.    

I can't speak for the food, since I've only been here for the speciality drinks and beer, but they have a pretty decent list of dinner options. I did see that they had a specialty Mac. Who doesn't love Mac n cheese when you're drunk?! Okay, well next time I will be sure to try the food food from the kitchen, so far the food lists looks promising..
author: Lene N.

description: Great offers on happy hour. $6 draft beers, $7 wine and $8 cocktails. I tried Moscone mule and it was pretty good. We ordered wood fired pizzas for $7 each. All them were good, but my favorite was the Margherita.
author: Tania C.

description: One of the more convenient places to grab a drink outdoors before a Giants game.  Naturally, it's always packed on nice days, so come early if you're trying to get a table.  Decent drink specials, including several different variations of the beer and a shot theme.  I highly recommend bringing cash if you're looking to take advantage of the outdoor bar; the lines can get very long.  Big shout out to Katie for the excellent Cadillac Margarita she made me!
author: Jeff H.

description: I came here before the Giants game. The service was okay. Our server kept walking away before we finished talking then didn't come back for awhile while we were done eating and I wanted another drink. Finally the bus boy came over and I was able to order with him. The food was pretty good. Drinks there are always good.
author: Raphael K.

description: Had a great experience here! I came here right before a giants game last week and loved it. Food and service was great. Cool atmosphere and of course right across from AT&T! I will be back here next time for sure. The pizza and calamari were tasty and this pomegranate tequila I tried for the first time was killer. Don't usually sip tequila but I recommend trying this one
author: Casey A.

description:
I have to say that MoMo's is a great little spot, especially before a game. We came here needing to get a bite before heading in and just arriving in SF. They seated us right away and were quite friendly. It was busy but of course it was the game crowd. One thing that brought this place to 4 stars is that it took quite a while to be acknowledged by our waitress. Another thing is that there were people selling Giants items right it the entrance which made it hard to get in. 
But the food was good and hearty- we ordered 2 pizzas and hummus and it was the perfect snack. The prices were normal for SF and the location was super convenient. I would recommend MoMo's for a pregame bite or drink.
author: Rachel O.

description:
Having been to AT&T park more times than I have fingers and running past it even more, I've been curious about Momo's, it seems like a old SOMA institution. My usual watering hole was packed and my friend who I was her "date" so to speak was hungry. 

We walk over, booked a table(next time, use Yelp to put your name in the hat), got drinks. I ordered the fried chicken, and my friend got the huevos rancheros. Since she was on a gluten-free diet, she didn't sample what I had. The chicken was good - the breading was crunchy and it was decently seasoned, better with the sauce. The mac & cheese was alright - it was starchy. It still made for a filling meal before walking into the ballpark. 

I can understand the draw of this place - the drinks are nice and stiff, my mimosa had me on a buzz pretty quickly. It's a long standing SOMA establishment that gets packed for Giants home games and be prepared to pay for the experience.
author: Navi T.

description:
Fun hang out spot before or even during Giants games! The food and drinks are pricey but the service is usually pretty good so I guess it's worth it. 

It gets pack on game day so be prepared! The outdoor seating is amazing (makes the prices worth it). It's just something about sitting down on Embacadero having a great cocktail watching the foot and street traffic while admiring the amazing baseball stadium.
author: Amber C.

description: I've only been here a few times because it's usually slam packed... But that's the fun of this place... Is the energy you get when you're going either to a game or a show at the AT&T Park. Service here is very nice dot-dot-dot in the prices are pretty reasonable for where you're at. The food was pretty good... And overall just a real nice place to come and hang out with friends. I would suggest never driving here... As parking can be terrible getting out after a game or show... That's the only complaint I have really of this place.
author: Joseph M.

description:
I would say A-OK because the location is definitely a plus if you're down by the stadium and the food wasn't bad.

It got two stars because the service wasn't great.  We sat at the bar and Melinda (I hope I got her name right) was the bartender.  She was sooo loud and she was cussing and discussing her flirtations, "whatever the f*ck she has going on with Charlie" and various other items and tidbits of her life with the other servers and it just took over the whole bar.

Now I know it was an odd time of the day, they weren't busy yet and maybe she just wasn't in work mode yet, but she just overwhelmed the bar with her personality.  Maybe that's a great thing when it's busy, but the trash mouth (for me) is never appreciated from someone working because it tells me they don't care about the customer.

Another reason I took a star away is because all we ordered was a chicken salad and a pepperoni pizza and it took a good 40 or so minutes to get that.  I thought my salad was being brought out about 15 minutes in but then the person bringing it must have realized the rest of the order wasn't with it and took it back to the window.  When I went to the bathroom about 30 minutes in it was sitting in the window still and then we asked if that was my salad and where the pizza was... so about 10 minutes later an underdone pizza was brought out with my chicken salad.  

Again, the food wasn't bad, but how can the Bartender/Server, Chef or Mgr be unaware or uncaring that food is undelivered/there's a salad is sitting in the window for 30 minutes without figuring out what's going on?  So it just turned into a poor experience.  

So, it was it was and seems OK for the most part by most people.  Just my experience I'm sharing.
author: Melanie E.

description:
Love momos. While I only have one check in it's because most of my momo experience has been grabbing drinks before giants games.

I came here for brunch and loved the breakfast Sandro. It's done up with very tasty ham, eggs, cheese and put on waffles. Goes perfect with a bloody. 

My buddy got the huevos rancheros though and I had serious food envy. While my sando was fantastic his rancheros looked phenomenal.
author: Jared M.

description:
We were meeting a friend for lunch during his work day and he suggested MoMo's. We were lucky and found a parking spot right beside this place so our lunch date started off nicely! The day was nice so we sat outside on their patio that was decorated with fat little succulents in footed pots. Some of the plants were beautifully red ones that matched the huge olive heart sculpture in front of the restaurant. 

I ordered a Cobb salad that was beautifully built with ample avocado, bacon, and chicken over mixed green along with cherry tomatoes and a sliced boiled egg. The red wine vinaigrette was served on the side. I also ordered some Brussels sprouts roasted with shallots, lemon, and olive oil instead of garlic butter since I am allergic to cow's milk. 

We ordered two of the wood-fired pizzas and both pizzas were beautifully made. The vegetarian pizza had grilled squash, peppers, olives, mozzarella, ricotta salata, and pesto. The other pizza had Prosciutto Di Parma, smoked gouda, Calabrian chiles, and arugula.

The complimentary bread and butter kept coming and by the time we were done, we were stuffed! I don't know what this place is like during games (busy, I imagine) or at night, but for a lunchtime destination, we were pleased with the prices and food quality.
author: Kristine H.

description:
Momo's. Any Giants baseball fan's favorite stop when catching a game at AT&T Park. Right across from the park itself. Good for libations before the game. Beers run from $7-$9 and mixed drinks run $12-$14. The food isn't bad either. The cheese burger with the awesome fries are good, my meatloaf with the broccoli and mashed potatoes was good as well. Drinks pour nonstop. Drink and eat inside or check out their outdoor patio with bartender, standing room and some bar tables and chairs. Tons of baseball fans having a great time.

A good stop to grab some drinks before, during and after a Giants game! The service isn't too shabby and the bouncers are always cool (especially if you're in your orange and black)!
author: Ticha B.

description:
I've heard MoMo's is packed on game nights, but on a regular weeknight, my best recommendation for this restaurant is that it's not crowded and has super cheap happy hour prices.  Neither food nor atmosphere is anything special, but if it were, the place would be packed more often.  When I planned to come, I didn't know it was part of a chain, but it definitely had that vibe. Sure enough, it is...

Along with the house wine, I tried their Fried Brussels Sprouts and French Onion Soup. My friend and I agreed that the Brussels Sprouts were too vinegary, while I found the soup just acceptable. 

I would come back for happy hour drinks, but not likely for anything else.
author: Sheri W.

description: Food  tasted great but the bartender needed an attitude adjustment. Seemed like she didn't want to take our order.  But one bad apple couldn't change my mind on the menu option... lots of options for vegetarians. I'm surprised being so close to the ball park.
author: Miguel A.

description:
Went here before a Giants game thinking brunch was available and it wasn't. But that wasn't the reason I gave it three stars. 
The food was just not "AMAZING" .. 
The service was really good.! 
and the price was actually reasonable. 
Would i go back , before a Giants game ? No. 
Would i go back to experience Brunch ? Yes.

I'll update it once i try out there brunch, cause it does look pretty poppin' =]
author: Silvia R.

description:
2 stars just for the customer service; my server was super attentive and overall sweet

I was walking by here and decided to pop in for a quick lunch since they were not super busy.. that was a mistake. I am going to guess I ordered the wrong meal because what I got was really bad.

I ordered the pasta pomodoro; basically, it was noodles, canned tomatoes, sliced garlic, and Texas toast. Seriously. 

I am not a pasta snob or a picky eater in general, but this pasta was so bland that I actually went across the street and got a sandwich after. 

I was disappointed bc this place looks upscale and a nice place to hang out with friends, but the food just didn't do it for me. Unfortunately I won't be back :(
author: S. P.

description:
Delicious food. Excellent drinks. Great atmosphere. I will come back again. 
Moscow mules were delicious. I loved looking out at The stadium.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Planned on having dinner at MOMO's before the Journey concert last night. Put our name and phone number in for a table of 4 at 3:59 pm. Was told the wait would be about 30 minutes and they would send a text to my cell phone when the table was ready. At 5:00 pm I inquired about our table and the manager said it should be ready in about another 10-15 minutes. We left MOMO's at 5:40 pm so that we would have time to get to our seats before the concert started. It is now 10:35 am Saturday morning and I still have not received a text stating that our table is ready.
author: Ann D.

description:
Great Location, but average food.  During my recent trip to SF, I spotted Momo's as it was near my hotel and the sign for Happy Hour.  I was fortunate enough to catch HH time and wandered inside.  The place was pretty big with patio and inside seating.  I decided for inside seating since it was a little chilly that day.  The hostess actually seated me right by the windows so I was also able to people watch. Since it was not game day, the restaurant was pretty empty (I am assuming that it gets pretty busy during game days since it is right across AT&T Park). 

Once I got seated, I decided to try a few menus off the HH menu.  I decided on the calamari and prosciutto pizza.  I also decided to have a mojito for my drink.  The waitress was super nice, bringing the menu and water promptly.  My drink came out first and yikes, it was very bad.  It was almost like rum with syrup.  I am not a drink connoisseur at all and even I knew it was bad.  After that, the calamari came out.  I was very disappointed in the calamari.  It was SUPER chewy and the calamari did not taste fresh.  I did enjoy the fried veggies that they had and I ended eating most of that.  Once, the calamari came out, I waited and waited and waited for the pizza. I was just going to follow up when the pizza came out.  I have to say that was the highlight of the meal.  The pizza was baked fresh (brick oven style).  The pizza had the right amount of toppings.  Too bad that was the last dish of my meal.  (I actually ended up taking it back to my hotel and had it as a late night snack). 

What a disappointing experience!  I loved the location, but did not enjoy my meal at all except for the pizza.  (Warning to people to want to have a quick bite before the game, I would make sure to order to pizza ASAP so you don't wait around forever for the pizza to come out).  I pushed this review up to 3 stars because I thought that the waitress was super nice and the restaurant itself was great.
author: Jane L.

description:
I don't even want to spend my time and effort explaining all of the things wrong with our experience here. Food was subpar but above the level of service we received, if you call it that. Worst experience dining in SF yet. Eat at the ball field you're much better off.

-- I was sent a msg from management to expand so here goes --

We arrived at the restaurant prior to a Giants/Cubs game. Although it was busy we were seated quickly. Our waitress came by and took our drink order. I asked if they had Pepsi or Coke and she said Pepsi. So we ordered our drinks. She came back later and slid a a Sprite in my direction. I said that I had ordered a MtDew with an attitude she said they didn't have that. Unsure why I wasn't told after ordering I said a water would be fine. 

As we waited for our food , due to the heat and walking all day I had finished my water pretty quickly. Multiple servers walked past with no refill. Luckily my wife had ordered tea so I was able to drink her water. It was a good 10min before we were even checked on. 

After our food came out the waitress stopped by quickly , asking about our food and before we could answer she was walking away. 

The food was not great my burger was basically raw and my wife's Salmon was fatty and not tasty. For $12 addition to her salad one would expect much better! 

We waited about 15minutes before I tracked our waitress down to ask for our bill. She came back about 5 min later with the bill, of course it had a $5 Sprite on it. I showed her the charge and she said she would get it removed. 

The charge was removed and we paid.

We receive better service and attention at the ballpark when ordering drinks and peanuts.
author: Christopher S.

description: VERY poor service. No one wiped down the table.  Had to go to bar to get drinks. Funny thing giants game was still on. So they were not that busy. Wouldn't come back here.
author: Jr L.

description:
I have been to Momo's many times but last visit/event compels me to write a review -  we were a large group hoping to watch the NBA Finals game (Warriors/Cavs) and enjoy some good food and lots of drinks.

Called  just days before and we were easily/painlessly set up for the Mayors Office (max 30 people) next to the bar.  From the beginning, we were treated professionally and efficiently by everyone - the private party specialist (Caitlyn) was great, a lot of attention from the manager to make sure we were happy, and, of course, our fantastic/attentive server (Lauren) and her army of folks seamlessly bringing in food/drinks and carrying away empty glasses/platters/plates.   Couldn't have gone better!!  We will be back!


Ken
author: Ken P.

description: Great food and fantastic service right across the street from the ballpark. We had a blast!
author: Brent P.

description: Very basic and bland food but the staff is super nice and accommodating. It gets crazy before a giants game, I wouldn't recommend coming then unless you just want a drink
author: Jerry M.

description:
Summary: Location, location, location. Food is inconsistent. So is the service.

Details: MoMo's is across the street from AT&T Park (home of SF Giants) so it's a popular destination if you're catching a game. Despite it's flaws, it's likely the best of the neighborhood restaurants/bars. And it's definitely better than the food in the ballpark (unless you're in club seats).

Brunch is only served on the weekend. If you want to get your drink on, the unlimited Mimosas are $20 - they aren't strong so you'll probably drink more than you expect. The huevos rancheros are pretty good but I'm underwhelmed by the eggs benedict. 

The spiced lamb burger is surprisingly tasty; it's spiced well and flavorful. I can't say the same buffalo chicken sandwich. The burger is just a burger but I've gotten it several times and enjoy it. If you're trying to eat healthy, the go-to salad is MoMo's crab & shrimp louie - it's generously portioned. You could also get a Caesar with salmon or chicken but I find it boring.

The dinner menu only has a few extra items from the lunch and brunch menu. On a recent visit, a friend enjoyed the grilled Ahi tuna. The same friend swears by the margarita pizza but I've had it several times and think it's uninspiring. 

There's a full bar with a decent selection of both wine and beer. Some of the cocktails are a bit surprising. I once ordered a moscow mule and it came in a highball rather than a copper mug. The jalapeno margarita isn't that spicy. But all of the alcohol is better priced than in the ball park so you might not be picky.

As you might expect from a place like this, it gets slammed on game day. Many of the servers handle the load well but some get overwhelmed. In general the staff is friendly, even when they are behind.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
Momos
Service was great. Friendly waitress. Great timing for seating, ordering and receiving my food.  

I ordered the shrimp appetizer which was very good.  The flavor of the buffalo sauce was just amazing.  Finger licking good. 

My main dish was the blackened salmon. 
1.salmon wasn't blackened just grilled. 
2. Looked almost at the peak of being cooked inside the center of the fish. It was still pink and a little fleshy. 
3. Lots of that brown under belly in the fish which made it kind of fishy
4. because the fish was fishy they put it on top of my mashed potatoes and spinach and it made the mashed potatoes and spinach taste fishy
5. Also the spinach was watery and so when my plate came there was a lot of water from the spinach surrounding the food gross
6. Unhappy with my meal I sent it back and ask for the veggie pizza which came in a great manner of time however there was a piece of sausage on the pizza in My First Slice and I'm a vegetarian so I wound up taking the food home and just giving it to my kids
author: Rachel D.

description: This is a pretty nice place, located just across the AT&T park. I reserved a room for s private meeting. The staff were super nice and helpful in arranging the whole event. Caitlyn from event management division was super helpful in emailing me the details and keeping my up to date with menu options etc. I would definitely come back again. The food was awesome and price was very very reasonable !
author: Anuran C.

description:
Delicious... calamari was awesome fried jalapeños where an added touch..
Pulled pork sandwich awesome.. service was great...
author: Patti B.

description: What a treat before going to the Giants game! The location is perfect, and the food was exceptional. We had margarita pizza, beet salad, wedge salad, Caesar salad, and shrimp cocktail. All was exceptional. The service was as good as the food!
author: Sarah W.

description:
Amazing! Nothing more needs to be said... 
Totally worth the wait, which wasn't that long. 
I had the TexMex. It was awesome ok me!
author: Kathie S.

description: Grabbed brunch before a Saturday ball game.  We made a reservation ahead of time and glad we did.  We enjoyed sitting on the patio but service was slow and not very attentive.  I thoroughly enjoyed the huevos rancheros, we also had the hummus which was tasty, the chicken wings, clam chowder and shrimp Louie salad.  The vodka strawberry smash was very tasty!!
author: Jacky S.

description: Good spot for sitting outdoors and if you go to an event at AT&T park. Food is good, we had fried calamari dish and sole with mashed potatoes and spinach. Bread pudding for dessert was ok. Good wines available.
author: Mucho Mas S.

description:
I come here a lot for happy hour but decided to try out the brunch for the first time on Saturday. I decided on the clam chowder and the asparagus and egg appetizer. The chowder was really good, creamy and filled with a lot of plump 
clams. I was having a tough time deciding what else to order and my server suggested the asparagus dish. Even though the egg was over cooked the dish was fantastic. It was served with two pieces of the best cheesy garlic bread I have ever eaten. The asparagus was sautéed with big chunks of pancetta and covered with an egg which should have been runny, but was still really good. I am so glad I listened to the server and tried something different. I will definitely be back again, not just for happy hour.
author: Nelly M.

description:
This is one of my favorite spots, mostly for their happy hour menu. This is where I come to spoil myself. Their flatbread pizzas are amazing. There's usually a good amount of space here. The staff isn't always the friendliest, but they're not rude either. 

The only problem I've ever had here is having waited 20 minutes to get a waiter's attention, to get my check. After 20-30 minutes of waiting, I just stood up to find someone to get us our check. They responded kindly and promptly. This has only happened once out of maybe 20 visits so far; not a common experience.

If there's anything I think could be improved, I'd say it's the dining area interior design. It's not falling apart or anything, but MoMo's could easily be a much more beautiful experience with a general visual refresh. With a fancier look, this place would easily be my go-to date spot. 

Watch out for nights when the Giants are playing at AT&T Park. They don't do happy hours then, and if you're caught off-guard, you could end up spending a lot more than you expected. That said, even without the happy hour prices, the food is worth it.
author: David S.

description: Busy place for a good ,but spendy food/beverage stop,prior to a Giants game across the street.
author: William D.

description:
Came here for brunch for my husbands 30th birthday and Juan who was working in the bar gave outstanding service. We were even sitting outside and he attended to us for our whole meal. We had a great time and will definitely be coming back to see Juan for his amazing service! 
Food was great and came out in a timely manor! 
We will be back!
author: Brittany N.

description: We went on a Sunday on a non-game day.  Everyone really enjoyed the food.  It was quiet enough that the chef actually delivered the food to the table!  My Filet was excellent for a reasonable price ($24).  Chef gets 5 stars!  Waitstaff was average...no issues.  We'll be back...
author: Yelper B.

description: Momo's only redeeming quality is the proximity to AT&T Park.  I wonder how the owner knew to buy the place BEFORE anyone knew AT&T Park was going in!  Hmmm.  The food is average. Nice people work there. The owner is a db. Go somewhere else. Not Pete's or Pedro's because it the same ownership group.
author: Paul M.

description:
Spring is upon us, and you know what that means! Giants baseball season is about to start!
And that also means that the crowd at Momo's on game days will be insane! I've got some great memories throughout the years of drinking on the patio with friends and making some new ones, too :-) and just soaking in the Giants game day vibe.

Recently, I met up with a friend on a surprisingly warm Spring day. We sat outside and caught up and took advantage of the Happy Hour from 3-7PM Monday-Friday *Cxcept on game days! Here's their insanely cheap Happy Hour:

-$5 Pizzas (from Margherita to Prosciutto Di Parma to Veggie)
-$5 Sliders (lamb, cheeseburger, and chicken), Fries, and Buffalo Chicken wings
-$1 Oysters (tend to run out fast, so best to go early and order lots)
-$5 Drinks (from Moscow Mules to Margaritas)

We had the prosciutto pizza and was really good. Total bargain for $5!
And we had the fries, and really hard to go wrong with those.
With a couple of round of drinks and food, the bill was roughly $30. You cannot beat that at all. You'll be hard pressed to find a better Happy Hour deal in SF!

Hit up Momo's on a game day, if you want to deal with the crowds and fun at full price.
If not, go enjoy their Happy Hour on non-game days!

Cheers! Let's go Gigantes! It may not be an even year, but I have high hopes for you this season! We trust in Madbum, Cueto, Posey, Crawford, Pence and Panik!
author: Gill C.

description:
I must admit, service can be slow even when there's no game going on here but the Happy Hour is one of the best deal in SF! $1 Oysters and $5 for Pizzas, Wings, Fries, Sliders, and my favorite Skinny Jalapeños Margarita.  3pm-7pm everyday in the bar or patio on the right.  

I was pleasantly surprised the oysters were so fresh!  The wood fire mushroom & sausage pizza has real chunks of garlic on there which elevated the pizza to a whole another level.  And you can't go wrong with the pepperoni pizza.  The garlic fries were hot, crispy & garlicky, just the way I like it.  The buffalo wings were juicy and tasty,  I didn't have a chance to try the sliders but will try them next time.  

I've also been here for work lunches and the Cioppino is chocked full of seafood in a savory tomato sauce.  Must order if you go here! 

The New York Steak was ok- portions were huge but it wasn't the most tender piece of meat.   The Calamari was good but kind of heavily battered. Stay away from the mussels as do not use PEI mussels and i didn't think this was fresh or tasty at all.

Will I be back?  Heck ya for Happy Hour and business lunches!
author: Melanie N.

description:
3.5 stars really

Overall, I ended up here on a NON GAME night and not for happy hour because I wanted to have dinner somewhere else but couldn't book there and ended up booking here after looking through a bunch of restaurants on Open Table.  As my friend put it, how I ended up here is a mystery.  Honestly, it was probably because it was still in the city but had reservations available.  

The place was pretty empty, and I could see why since there isn't much around here except AT&T park so if you aren't purposely coming to this restaurant, you will not go out of your way.

Overall, the restaurant is nice and the server was great.

I ended up with the chicken pot pie - which was pretty good. It has a cute chicken cut out of puff pastry for the top.  My friend got the cioppino which she enjoyed as well.  I ended up with her garlic cheese toast that was supposed to come with her cioppino.  I ordered the onion straws to start.  Those were quite yummy.

Was it spectacular? no.  Was it delicious and was the service good?  Yes.  Will I be back, maybe if I'm near by and there weren't other options.  There are so many places to eat in San Francisco that I have yet to tackle.
author: Grace C.

description: Went on vacation with my family and heard that this place has had a great happy hour menu. Us trying to save a lil on food so we decided to go here. The hostess at the front said their happy hour started at 3 so we had an hour to kill. Being right across AT&T park we thought it wouldn't be too bad. We walked around and when we went back we were told that in fact the weren't having happy hour that day because of a special event going on at the ballpark. I think that was extremely negligent and not very considerate of the inconvenience they caused us. The two stars are solely on our waitress she was very attentive and got our order correct. The food was subpare at best. Could I could have went anywhere else and spent over $90 on two pizzas and gotten something with some actual flavor in it. Very disappointing restaurant.
author: Sarah G.

description: Great atmosphere, food and drinks. I only gave it 4 stars due to the air conditioning not working very well and it was super hot inside, as worse outside, of course. Otherwise, this place is great!!!
author: Hannah H.

description: I received a prompt message from Scott the GM of MoMo's who not only acknowledged they could do better but offered a suggestion on what they plan to do with the menu. This is what I call genuine customer service and why I will be back to MoMo's
author: Joan R.

description: Horrible service. Sat us way back of the restaurant and had to ask the bus boys to get us a waiter/waitress. The waitress had to then flag down another waitresses to come.  Seriously? I probably should've went to the kitchen and placed the order myself!  More like we should've just left! I can't believe it. Not a place to go and even the front desk wasn't friendly- not smiling- didn't welcome us- we looked like we bothered them in their personal conversation.  Worst customer experience ever.
author: chinita g.

description:
Came in by chance walking by looking for a place for lunch. 

Service was great as it wasn't busy so I can't really tell what it would be like on Game night (location is across the street from AT&T Park).

Ordered the Reuben and it was very delicious. The only thing I have to complain about is the Corned Beef was shredded instead of sliced and made for a messy sandwich. Flavor was delicious though. 

My Diet Coke never went empty although I would have preferred a beer but I was working :(
author: Brandon K.

description: Great food ! Fried chicken delicious and Louie salad plentiful Amarilis our server was fast, attentive and had a fabulous personality to get us ready for the Giants game!
author: m a.

description:
So admittedly I showed up a bit of a lesser standard than I normally would do. The bouncer let me in no problem, but I showed up in a sweatshirt and a raiders sock hat and they immediately asked me to pay before I got anything. Sure, that is somewhat understandable considering my attire, maybe, bu then when I said can I pay on my Amex platinum, she looked at me and said did you steak someone's wallet.   I don't know if this was an a
testament to how how showed up or how poor the service it is next to the park. Absolutely unbelievable how I was treated. Terrible.
author: Herbie F.

description:
Came here on a Thursday afternoon for lunch when someone came to visit me by work since it seemed like a nice place to sit down at a table outside and enjoy the nice weather by the ball park.

MoMo's is certainly in a prime location, being directly across from AT&T Park with plenty of tables and nice outdoor seating. The service was very friendly overall, though it was a bit difficult to ask for some extra items. Apparently, there are no paper napkins here and it took multiple requests before I was able to convince the servers to provide an extra bowl to share some soup.

The first word that comes to mind when thinking about the food here is: sodium. The amount of salt in their dishes is through the roof! I got to try both the prosciutto pizza and the french onion soup. The prosciutto pizza had a nice light thin crust that made it feel less heavy than the typical pizza and also had pieces of arugula that added a freshness to the dish. They just need to chill with the salt a bit. The french onion soup would've also been a delightful treat if not for the kilograms of sodium within. It comes with a cheesy crust on top which was done beautifully for a chewy texture with a light outer crisp.

The third dish we ordered were the raw oysters which came at a high price tag of $3 each. They were by far the smallest pieces of oysters on the half shell I have ever seen, being the size of earbuds. I was quite disappointed looking at them when they came out, but I must say, there is something absurdly special about these oysters. They taste super fresh and are better than the ones I would find along the west coast from Seattle to Monterey. I can see myself slurping these lil oysters all day!
author: Joshua M.

description:
4 stars for the food this time around, minus 1 star for the $$prices$$. I know a lot of places around here are pricey but when you spend over $40 on lunch per person I'm thinking ehhhhh. Beer on draft is $8, ugh.

Regardless, the food was great. Calamari had fried lemons, artichokes and jalapeños which I love and the Crab and Shrimp Louie Salad was gigantic with what seemed like over a pound of seafood! Outside patio is a must on warm SF days. :)

I've been for Happy Hour and the prices are solid, so I'll stick to that unless I want a "treat yoself" lunch day!!
author: Heather H.

description: I'm just going to say one thing. There was too much orange juice in my $20 bottomless mimosa. Fail. And they couldn't fix it. Took away from my beloved Saturday brunch.
author: gina n.

description: I like this place, good food, great location, friendly service. I like to have lunch here on the outdoor patio on a warm sunny day - beautiful spot. The interior of the restaurant needs updating. Overall it's a good neighborhood spot across the street from the Ball Park.
author: Rimma K.

description:
Get down to MoMo's for their happy hour menu.  $5.00 pizzas?  Really?  They are so good, and big enough to share.  Or take leftovers home.  Mine was great the second night.  The whole happy hour menu features delicious food at amazing happy hour prices.  And don't forget a happy hour beverage (or two, no judgement...)  to go with all that great food.
Wait staff is fun and friendly, and management has this place running super smooth.  Not just a place for before Giants game or concerts.  It's one of my favorite neighborhood bars.
author: Sally M.

description: A friend and I came here for a late lunch on Saturday. It was such a nice day outside that we were able to sit on the patio. I got a Blueberry Mule which was good but didn't taste too strong for the price ($13). The food is a bit pricey as well but would be ideal during happy hour. For my meal, I got the Prosciutto di Parma pizza (FYI, there are about 8 slices per pizza). It's closer to thin crust than regular pizza so didn't feel too heavy but I ended up eating the entire thing because it was so delicious! The flavors were really on point and even had a little bit of a kick to it due to the diced red chilis on it. I'd probably come back during happy hour to get more of a deal on the food/drinks but overall it wasn't too bad for the portions.
author: Pooja C.

description:
Momo's has a crazy happy hour and is great for large groups after work. It's usually dead unless there is a game. If there is a game, just avoid this spot altogether. 

Nothing too stand out about the menu. Beer selection is super limited. Sometimes you'll stand at the bar when it's not busy and employees will make eye contact but still not service you or acknowledge that you're waiting and it's annoying. I feel like they act super busy and stressed out when there's not even a lot of business. I'm realizing now how hard this is to explain.

I'll definitely be back since it's in such a convenient spot and the happy hour is killer, even if the offerings are not. An undeniably good deal for food that may not be too special but hits the spot.
author: Sarah P.

description: Great happy hour. $5 drinks and $5 pizzas, can't beat it.
author: Chase C.

description: Excellent chicken panini; good chicken pot pie. Good service, although we are one of  two couples in the entire restaurant!  No Giants game today. I expect conditions to change markedly when the Dodgers hit town tomorrow.
author: Bill B.

description: The place was pretty empty when my 2 friends and I got here and the service was awful it took them for ever to even send someone to ask for our drinks, we had to wait easily 30 min to being seen and when we were about to leave the waitress came to take our drinks order. The food was good but seriously the service horrible I don't want to imagine how it is when is crow.
author: Klarisse V.

description: Great service and good food. Fun place to eat before a Giants game. If the weather is nice sitting outside is definitely a plus.
author: Sandra G.

description: If I could give momos 0 stars I would.  They advertise happy hour then charge full price-- that means $9 per 12 oz beer and $12 for fries. Classic bait and switch.
author: Mahesh C.

description: I only go because I like the mussels. The service is less than mediocre. The stale bread from today didn't help boost Momo's review. Can anyone recommend another restaurant that cooks mussels with a delicious white cream sauce? I'm sure there's many but a recommendation would be really helpful. It's a hit or miss every time I try somewhere new.
author: Briana W.

description: I don't know why this place has only three stars on Yelp. In my book it's a good restaurant. Great location, good service, good food. I really like their outdoor patio, especially on a warm sunny day , what a pleasant spot to have lunch! Interior of the restaurant needs updating, no doubt about that. Menu should have more full entree options, not just sandwich-like quick meal type of items.
author: Ynu G.

description:
Lazy staff - waiter will hesitate to show you the full cocktail/food menu just because they have the special happy hour menu available and it's probably more inconvenient for them. Got up and left the place without eating due to the rudeness/laziness.

Also the staff close the place whenever they feel like it. The owners should keep a closer eye on the staff that are running the show as they please, while customers leave disappointed.
author: Liam W.

description:
Well you absolutely can't beat the location if you are going to a Giants game! It's right across the street!  

Went to meet friends for a little pre game grub and drinks. Was actually a bit shocked we were able to get a table immediately but perhaps because it was Sunday? We scored a spot on the patio so we had a great spot overlooking the stadium with tons of great people watching. It was above average temperatures but it didn't feel so bad since there was plenty of shade.  Inside there were tons of TV's to catch scores of other games as well.

Menu wasn't anything out of the ordinary but everything we got was pretty solid. Started with some really tender calamari and a sausage/mushroom pizza with roasted garlic. Also got some yummy mussels in a white wine sauce. They had a really nice selection of beers as well as specialty cocktails. Prices were fair given the quality and location.

Bonus... If you don't have Giants gear they had a table out front selling all kinds of hats and shirts that appeared to be great quality!
author: Christine F.

description: We come to eat at Momo's all the time but this may be my last time there. I say this because I found hair in my food and a gnat in our water. I just wanted to gag! Our server was very apologetic and I'm sure it was ruff for him cuz it was second day there! Nothing against him but I was very disappointed. They replaced the pizza which I didn't eat cuz I had already lost my appetite but what bothered me was no supervisor, manager or chef came to reassure us or even offered us an apology or anything!
author: Angel G.

description:
Momo's is a great spot on a sunny afternoon (or morning) to grab a drink. 

In this case, my friend and I were desperately searching for a place to get a drink on the Saturday morning of Superbowl 50 weekend and we must have checked 6 different spots downtown and nothing was open. We finally walked past Momo's and decided to give it a try.

We both ordered the Cucumber Martini and it was exactly what I was in the mood for. if you like Hendricks and cucumber...this is the drink for you. So refreshing, so delicious, so good.
author: Ilana B.

description: Momo's has the best happy hour menu in San Francisco!! Wood fire pizzas are the bomb and only $5!!! The customer service is excellent, and the atmosphere is inviting for all!!!!
author: Brandi H.

description: We went before a giants game- always fun, if not a bit loud.  Service is very good- it wasn't too busy when we arrived, but filled up quickly. Even when busy the service is friendly and attentive.  Food is ok-  good calamari, good shrimp/crab louis, decent pulled pork.  A fun spot for a group.
author: Debra Z.

description: Great place,amazing music and we loved that we didn't feel rushed to leave once we were done eating. We will defiantly be returning !
author: J G.

description:
Food was good. Unfortunately the service wasn't. If you go at noon, I'd recommend you be in business attire, as everyone in suits or business casual got helped quickly, never had an empty drink, got bread without asking, etc... we had to ask for water/ice tea 3 times and a 2nd drink took almost 20mins
. 
The Manager on duty did help once I spoke with him, but it was at the very end for desert, which we did bring for a special event. 
Hoping our next visit is better, still like the location and food.
author: Josh D.

description: Wow what a difference! Loved my food and service was excellent. Food was tasty, service was fast but yet attentive.
author: Sandra T.

description:
I can't believe the Service I receive today. Usually my go to place but from the Looks of it NOT anymore. I ordered a Cadillac Margarita the bartender made my drink with 1 missing Ingredient and when I asked about it she says, "oh we ran out". So why make my drink and place it in front of me if you knew you were missing part of the receipe.... So I cancel my drink, but I also ordered Calamari along with my drink but that never came. So I left and went elsewhere. 

Female bartender, it seems as I'f she has an issue with women of color because the Eldery women sitting next to me mentioned her Rude, nonchalant, and unfriendly manner as well. Our money spends just the same. 

I can say so much more but it's so disappointing and upsetting to come into this so called upscale environment and experience poor Customer Service.
author: D D.

description: Came here on a very busy night for some food and drinks. We were pleasantly surprised by the amazing staff, particularly our bartender Gill! Despite the bar being packed he was super attentive to us and went above and beyond to make sure we were happy! Would definitely come here again and sit at Gill's bar!
author: Effy C.

description: This is a great spot to grab a drink after the 7th inning cut off. But The really cute thing is you claim to close at 11:30pm but yet "move" everyone to your patio at 10:50pm...and then kick everyone off your patio at 10:55 HMMMM? Let's just say the "bouncers" are not much help when it comes to any confederations around here. Only check this place out if you want to be treated like shit. OH they even serve shots, mixed drinks and beers in PLATIC CUPS! But then use paper straws for the environment hmmmmm? Ya doesn't make sense
author: Kelly B.

description: Right at the ATT  Park with nice food and elegant dining room- not busy on a Monday night with no stadium activities. Nice happy hour prices for drinks. I had the Jambalaya which was very good - solid. Not out of the ordinary though. Cesar Salad was excellent. We had plenty of room to dine and talk and catch up- not noisy at all that night.
author: Diane A.

description:
Hubby wanted me to show his clients around SF, as they flew in from Texas.  I brought them here for dinner.  Luckily, SF Giants were playing in Arizona, so it was a super chill night, and we can actually hear each other's conversations.  Out-of-towners wanted to see AT&T Park and what better place to see it from the 2nd Street entrance across from MoMo's.  

I wouldn't frequent this restaurant, as I know how crazy busy it gets on game days/nights and how touristy it is.  IMHO, there are many other restaurants/pubs to choose from in SOMA, unlike Candlestick days.  I prefer to kick it at Tres Agave and share pitchers of margaritas with friends and family, now we're talking (salud)!  

As long as my husband's clients were happy and had a great time, then I've done my job.  Btw, husbands don't pay overtime - don't work for family lol.  They ordered steak, and I had the gumbo.  Their gumbo is not up to par like New Orleans, but what the heck.  Our waitress made up for it with her positive attitude and continuously checked on our table.  There's no kids' menu, so our son had to starve (j/k).  They accommodated him by bringing out small portions on anything he liked on their menu.  He really enjoyed his dessert, as did I.  I'd probably come back for their happy hour on non-game days.
author: Christine R.

description: This place is great for groups. They have a large interior as well as nice outdoor seating. Its right across from the ball park and right in front of public transit so its pretty central. My only issue is that it's pricey. I had a $20 shrimp salad which doesn't include Tax, SF health tax, and Tip. After all of that it was right around $30.
author: V I P.

description: This review is for a private event we had at MoMo's to celebrate the launch of Jack Daniel's Rye. I was put in charge of finding a location with a relatively short lead time. I chose MoMo's as they have been a great supporter of Jack Daniel's and their facilities support our 50 person dinner / cocktail hour. The private event coordinator Caitlyn Zucca did an amazing job with our countless emails and updates. Thank you Caitlyn and MoMo's staff!
author: Rodney D.

description: Service was pretty bad (messed up both mine and my friend's order), but our waiter was still very nice. The food was so-so
author: Molly O.

description:
Went to MoMos for the first time and I must say, I wasn't as satisfied as I thought. I really do enjoy that they offer outdoor seatings, especially on a nice day out. The food was tasty and gives out pretty big portions. It can be a bit over priced. 

During off season for baseball, they offer bottomless mimosas for $20. I wouldn't come back here for bottomless mimosas because it literally tasted like orange juice. After 4 mimosas, still nothing. I even ask the server to add less of the OJ but the server mentioned they were not able to.  

It was nice of them to take it off the bill and just charged us one mimosas. I would recommend getting their bloody mary instead. Great hint of spice and tasted really good. MoMo's isn't bad but this wouldn't be a great brunch spot to go to.
author: Jenn L.

description:
We came before a Giants game (brunch) and would recommend reservations. Even though they were busy, we had quick service. The food was as I would expect given the location- simple, good, but not incredible. 

Tips: Their menu changes on game day. Get reservations. Good spot for a group going to the game. Nice outdoor patio.
author: Paige D.

description: Went there before the game. Obviously this place was super packed, but Juan, Josh and all the bartenders were awesome. Still able to engage and feel like your hometown joint while mixing drinks at a fast pace. The pesto pizza was also phenomenal! So for years we always skipped this place cause of the crowds but now a must before the games!
author: Shawn O.

description: We were there before a Giants game for brunch. The menu is limited but the food is good. We were surprised to learn the $20 bottomless mimosas no longer exists. When we got our bill my husband questioned the $11 per mimosa. Our wonderful sever apologized and said they really don't keep up with the IT stuff. She took off the price for one of them. I had three!  It was close to the advertised price. We were happy. Change your menu MoMo's.  We will be back!  No more bottomless mimosas.
author: Annice P.

description: If i could give zero i would. I walked in was super polite and wanted to have a few drinks in the main dinning area because the bar is freezing. The hostess told me sorry you cant sit there we are almost closing when i looked on the web site it said it closes at 9pm we got there at 720 to be exact. I was then told i can sit in the bar. I explained to her it was so cold over there and she simply shrugged her shoulders. I then asked for a manager which was also NEVER brought to me. I never am rude nor do i complain but this place is a JOKE. Momo u need to get better help at the front. Its a shame
author: Zarina K.

description:
The ahi appetizer was good

Other dishes were ok, but disappointing considering the price point. The chicken panini looked like a chicken sandwich on toasted bread.  The gumbo was like something I make, missing complexity but not bad.  However I use larger shrimp!  

Lunch, with one appetizer, one small bottle of pelligrino and 4 main courses, was about $125 before tip. Pretty pricey with no alcohol for a Monday lunch.

When there is a ball game, the place can be packed so it's location guarantees a crowd many days.
author: Joanna S.

description: Stopped at Momo'S to get something to eat before the Giants game. I asked for a burger cooked medium well and it came RAW.  How do they make that mistake!!
author: Paul D.

description: Went in for a burger & a few beers before a Giants game on a Monday night. We'd made reservations and arrived about 10-15 minutes early; we were seated immediately with a choice of inside or on the patio. We requested patio seating and were brought out to a perfect table with a great view for people watching. Both of us ordered the house burger with bacon & provolone. The burgers were cooked well, as ordered, but still juicy with lots of flavor and the fries were great - crisp on the outside but not the least bit dry inside. Our waitress was friendly and attentive without being intrusive and the draft beers were ice cold. The location, the food (including coldness of the beer!), the staff and the atmosphere of the patio make Momo's a perfect choice, with or without a Giants game on the day's roster.
author: B D.

description: No way you will ever try another spot for mac and cheese. #godno just stop eating until you go otherwise you can't have enough room for it.
author: Antigone S.

description: Momo's is our FAVORITE go-to restaurant in San Francisco. Whether going before or after a ball game, during off season lunches or dinner...we always have awesome service and food!!!
author: Dianne M.

description: My first time to MoMo's before the Dodger-Giant game. I will definitely be back. The atmosphere is friendly, fun and appropriate for families as well as groups of friends. Great vibe with three distinct area. Bar is relaxed and fun. Dining room is classy and perfect for date night. Patio/deck area is great for people watching and fun discussions. The food is excellent with a variety of choices. Patio staff was fun and knew the menu well. Scott, the manager, provided excellent customer service!
author: Wayne S.

description: Horrible service and horrible food. We had to keep having other servers find our server. We had to hunt down our waitress in order for us to make our dinner order, took about 20 minutes to get our first drink. Then when we tried to order a second round it never came. All of our food was terrible. I ordered a MEDIUM RARE steak and it was more on the well side, and kinda burnt. Overall horrible experience. I will NEVER return and make sure that anyone who comes into town steers clear of this place. Having a great location shouldn't be what you're known for, your service and quality of food should sell itself! Jose the manager didn't even really care when I told him about our horrible experience, bad team leader for sure.....  Sorry MoMo's....
author: Samantha J.

description:
There are few folks happier for #OrangeOctober than MoMo's. 

Because seriously there are little reasons to come here. 
Loud, overpriced, douchey, and you're sardined in there with the best of them. Which technically isn't the best. 

Let's keep it moving folks. If you're gonna spend $7 on a beer, I know much better places down the street with better ambience, friendlier service, and definitely way better crowd. Its location across from AT&T Park is all MoMo's got. 

But Go Giants!
author: Jon L.

description:
Good, slightly upscale food in a comfortable restaurant, with great service, in a great location (right across the street from AT&T Park, and next to my office.)  This is my default "go out with a candidate for lunch interview" spot, and I'll go on my own sometimes.

It's a bit pricey -- $25-45/person easily at lunch -- but worth it.  There are what I'd consider "San Francisco" or "California" or just "American" classics -- great burgers, crab cioppino, great gumbo, solid French dip, etc.  Good NY Strip steak too.  

Quiet-ish dining room, and a bar.  There's a nice patio as well.
author: Ryan L.

description: Dude. Tone down the friggin' wasabi in your mashed potatoes that come with the grilled ahi. The tuna isn't bad, but I can't stomach the potatoes without my face melting off. Also, your service is hella slow even when you're not that busy.
author: Rachael H.

description:
I came here on a Sunday before attending the Giants game across the street at AT&T stadium. It was so packed you would have thought it was a Saturday night! The atmosphere was great. At first, we thought we were only going to stop in for some drinks. I had a specialty drink out on the patio, and then switched over to beers.The drink prices are on par with cocktail prices elsewhere in the city.

After a couple of drinks, the group I was with decided to have a quick bite before going into the game. We all shared the watermelon gazpacho, which was a new thing for me. Cold soup was not something I thought I would ever want to try, and it certainly had an interesting taste to it! I am not sure I would be able to eat a whole bowl of it, but it is nice to be able to say I have tried it.

As my entree, I ordered the Parma Prosciutto pizza. It came with prosciutto, spicy calabrian chillies, broccolini, smoked gouda, red sauce, and it seemed like there was mozzarella cheese on the pizza as well. I surprisingly ate the entire pizza by myself. It was very large, so it could be split between two people. However, I had yet to eat breakfast at this point, so I was starving. 

I definitely recommend stopping in here before a weekend game at the stadium. Great atmosphere, great drinks, and great food!
author: Amanda E.

description: Went here with the family at 4:30 before a Friday night Giants game. We had a reservation. Service was unbearably slow. We ended up getting our own drinks from the bar. The food was simply sub par. For the premium price they charge I would expect decent food. We will not be back.
author: Jamie V.

description: How can you go to a baseball game and not go to MoMo's?! Solid food, great atmosphere, and friendly staff. All you need for a good time.
author: Monique H.

description: Came here right before a Giants game for drinks and absolutely loved the atmosphere. It's right across the street from AT&T park so it's super convenient for a drink or bite to eat before heading over. It does get crowded, but it's so fun and casual, you end up making friends and talking to everyone. The bartenders were extremely efficient and quick and drinks were good. I haven't been here on a regular day (always on game days) so I don't know how it is otherwise, but great place to come before a game.
author: Kristine L.

description: Excellent food and location.  Service is wonderful.  Great fire pizza and blood orange mimosas!!
author: Shelly H.

description:
Great place for happy hour, we LOVED Lamb sliders 
ALL Pizzas great from the regular are $5.00 
& can't beat the $1. Oysters!
Friendly Bartenders like Malinda & Dwight  make the best mixed drinks :)
author: FeriDon D.

description:
My son and I came here before a Giants game to enjoy some downtime. 
 
Did not receive a greeting from a sever for 5 minutes, although she turned out to be ok, not really a server but an order taker. 

I ordered the Caprese salad, which you would assume would have luscious rounds of buffalo mozzarella. You know. A typical traditional Caprese. It came to me with 4, literal crumbs of mozzarella. I was pissed. 

Flagged a floor manager over, he took it away and brought back a plate of 8 crumble sized mozzarella pieces. 

Yeah. NO! Unacceptable. 

Whatever. If you're wary to a game and want to sit and chat before a game, come for drinks and have a burger. For the same price you get more.
author: Yvonne K.

description: This place sucks!! $9 for a tiny drink with no vodka. I'm heated!! . Stay away from this trap. Horrible rude service!!
author: Randi S.

description:
Lol. Yeah, fuck this place. Walked in for some change to feed the meter. Was completely ignored because both bartenders were too busy flirting with the 3 "woo" girls. This place was dead so it's not like I had to wait in line. Two other dudes roll in and they are immediately acknowledged. Gill, the bartender, tells them they are closed!?? But then gives them drinks anyway... this is happening right in my face after I sat there, ignored. Finally I just stare at him until he asks what I need.

He gets me my change but doesn't even put it in my hands, just dumps it on the bar and goes back to the girls. 

Dude, that's just unnecessary, rude, shit service.
author: Gina S.

description: Came here before a Giant's game.  Great location and nice patio.  We ordered 3 pizzas, pepperoni, mushroom and garlic and margherita.  They were average but the margherita pizza was too salty.
author: Amy J.

description: Truly enjoyed the calamari frito misto, HH $7. Hubs liked his big beef slider. I had the mussels (main menu) on my first visit and came back because of them but decided to change it up. Can't go wrong with either. Just remember that if you are aiming for Happy Hour, there is not one on game days
author: Linda W.

description:
(This review is only for the happy hour)

Cuz dat happy hour doe...ahhhmazing :O

The $5 personal pizzas are filling and shareable! It's such a good deal, it feels like it's legal theft.

Got the veggie pesto pizza and it changed my life forever. For such a sweet deal and delicious taste, it made me question if heaven could just be on Earth at Momo's.

It's an awesome place with an outdoor patio and TV's to watch sports games. 

I will definitely be back!
author: Karen M.

description:
We stopped in for a pre Giants game drink and dinner on a Tuesday night. The wait was only 30 minutes which wasn't that bad, so we grabbed a couple beers while we waited. There were probably some of the nicest people who go to this place. We had an older couple offer up 2 extra stools on the patio since they weren't using them. It was a nice conversation while we waited. 

We got a table outside right under the heater so it was perfect since it was freezing outside. Being that it was completely packed the service was quick. I ordered the pepperoni pizza and my friend ordered the burger. I didn't get to try the burger because he swallowed it, I guess it was good. But I did get to try his fries which were super good! 

My pizza was well pizza, but a good pizza. I asked for cheese and they brought fresh Parmesan which tasted fantastic on the pizza. Never had that before so I totally recommend it. It was a little greasy but I didn't expect any less from pepperoni pizza. 

Overall I liked this place, but I had 2 issues. 1st was my biggest issue and that was the bathroom. I thought it would be cleaner than the stadium but I was completely wrong. No toilet paper, no toilet seat covers and trash all over the floor. I went to the bathroom when I got there and it was the same time as one of the hostesses. I figured she would have someone clean it up. But when I went back before I left it was in the same condition. 2nd was the 5% charge added on top of tax. I understand it's game day, but seriously it's just irritating. We pretty much ate and left. Didn't sit around and hangout. But I can see why they would add it for people who just want to sit and take up room. So I'm warning you, don't be surprised when you see it on your bill.
author: Erica C.

description:
We ate here for Mother's Day after a train ride to the city. The restaurant is child-friendly (ours are over 9years old) and they have a great selection on the menu.  The mac and cheese was AMAZING! We still talk about it.

Nice, large, clean restaurant with super friendly staff.  

Right across the street from AT&T Park.  I'm sure it can get crazy and busy during, before and after a game!
author: Sandra P.

description:
My boyfriend and I tried this place before we went to the Giants game and I'm glad we did.  When you first walk in, a security guard will check for id to make sure you're over 21 (since there is a bar outside and the main bar inside) and you can go inside or stay outside to drink. 

The wall on the inside by the bar is pretty cool because it's covered in baseball cards, almost like a collage.  I find it very unique and never seen anything like it.  Very nice and pretty bar tenders whom to be very fast on making our drinks.  I will be coming back here before or after watching the Giants games.
author: Christina M.

description: Great spot to grab a drink before a Giants game! It's fun when weather is nice and patio is open! They usually have great music and a crowd.
author: Danielle C.

description:
This is mostly for drink before the game... Their draft system was down or something (wasn't quite sure with the noise) so we were left with what ever bottles they had on hand. A lot of us ended up with Lagunitas IPA, which was fine... But I really wanted a Blue Moon (I like orange when I drink, it's my thing). 

That said their shots were ginormous and overflowing. And to top it off Their staff was very friendly and accommodating
Really couldn't have asked for a nicer staff, you all were awesome. Part of the reason for the high rating.
author: Em C.

description:
Food here is ok! Price is ok... ! Wait is not so long and it has a good location.
The pizza is ok. Fancy salad
author: Diem H.

description: I love the Momo's in Walnut Creek. Unfortunately this one is very high on itself and my friends didn't even want to go. Well, that was not a problem because the guy at the door refused us entry because he thought I was intoxicated. Well, the Giants just won and we were at the game but drinking ceased at 7th inning (actually we were in Audi suite so it didn't but I'm not that big of a drinker). I realize my eyes were red- I just had my lashes done and the glue is very irritating - duh. It is outrageous to judge me on the way I look and not on my behavior.
author: Sharon S.

description: MoMo's is very large so it's easy to reserve a table with a larger group. However, the food/flavor is seriously lacking. Even though it gets lots of foot traffic during the week since it's in the heart of SOMA, it's pretty empty during the weekends - my guess would be because of the quality of the menu. I hope there are improvements made to the meals!
author: Emmy Q.

description: This review is for the happy hour menu that is going on now during the winter months.  The selection, quality, and price cannot be beat anywhere in the neighborhood.  The service is great and the staff is very welcoming.  The $5 pizza is the Best Buy in South Beach.
author: Jim E.

description:
I'm sure everyone in San Francisco has seen this place. Its usually packed to the brim on game day but was almost dead the Saturday night I dined here. It was my neighbors idea and I think they wanted to take advantage of the Dine About Town steak special.

I wasn't hungry and was going to order something small but of course my fatass saw the crab cakes on the menu and I had to get it. Its a huge portion with mashed potatoes and spinach and I ate every bite of it! I think I ended up ordering the best thing at the table because two of my friends who ordered the steak hated it. They said its as "Denny's quality" Two of my friends shared the shrimp ceviche that didn't get finished and another got the burger.

This place is way too overpriced for the quality. I always thought this place was a tourist trap to be honest. I ended up spending over $50 for an entree and two mojitos. Money better spent elsewhere. 

Service was horrendous. They forgot the desserts that came with the steak dinner until reminded. We paid with a combination of cash and card and when the waitress returned she was all "Did you guys include the tip because the cash wasn't enough for the tip." WTF! What a crazy thing to say. Who does this?! We weren't even done paying yet. They hadn't even brought out the desserts and the waitress asks for more money for tip? Dafuq.
author: Tiffany V.

description: The reason for the two star rating wasn't about the food or service but more about how they host families with kids.  Families who come to Momos to eat will have problems if they need to change a diaper.  Hopefully if this happens to you, your already at the end of your meal.  They don't have a changing table in the women's or men's restroom.  We had to pack everything up to go home to change a diaper.  Our Saturday out was cut short because a neighborhood restaurant doesn't have a simple easy to install changing table.  They have the space for it and it's not a big expense.  It's the little things that make a big difference.
author: Mariana V.

description:
Love the excitement near the Giants stadium, this place is right on the strip, across from the park, you can sit on the street side patio, under heat lamps, have a cocktail and enjoy the whole experience! This is pretty much what you are paying for. I felt that it was way overpriced because it's at AT&T park and because they can. 
We ordered the burger, which came with an over easy egg and bacon on it, for $2 more, making it $21. It was good but not a $21 burger. We also ordered a pepperoni pizza and the onion rings (or strings) .. The pizza was very good! The onion strings weren't what I expected, I think I misread the menu, thinking I was ordering onion rings. They were thin strings breaded and fried. Added to the burger, they were quite tasty, just too much of them!
Servers were good and attentive, and helped us move to a heated table as it was freezing out. Loved sitting outdoors and people watching until the game started. I'd return for the pizza and entertainment!
author: Cali M.

description:
I came here with a few friends after the Giants game as we wanted a few drinks while we waited for the CalTrain. 

We found a table but after waiting 15min for someone to clean it up, my buddy got a few napkins and cleaned the table himself. When we ordered our drinks, they served the beer in a small plastic cup while they watered down the Grande Marina and were very stingy with the portion.

Overall, I'll just buy a few more drinks at the stadium next time.
author: Stan R.

description: I was in today at 5:45 for happy hour and was totally ignored by the bar staff.  I know the staff was busy but I was never acknowledge by the staff.  I decided to split up and have my co worker wait in one line and I at the other end of the bar.  After waiting for 35 to 40 minutes I decided to take my business elsewhere.  It's a shame because my last experience was good.
author: Tom T.

description:
We ate on a Saturday night and it wasn't crowded at all. There was no game going on though either. We had a wide variety of foods. The garlic sausage pizza is delicious. The tuna tar-tar was very good. I also had the rock shrimp and was very disappointed. It was so chewy and overcooked. It really was like eating rubber and I couldn't finish it. My husband had the gumbo and enjoyed it. 

The drinks were very overpriced and weren't very good. I had a blueberry Moscow mule that came in a clear baller glass. I was expecting a copper mule mug. It was a little weird to call it that and bring it in a clear baller I thought. Overall, it was good, but not fantastic by any means.
author: Heather R.

description:
K
The best happy hour ever. Full sized pizza for $5 and a superb burger with seasoned fries for only . Highly recommend it.
author: Beer T.

description: Game Day:  Not bad, not bad at all. I was expecting a long wait to be seated-was seated immediately, expected a long wait to be served-served immediately, expected long wait for food to arrive-arrived on a timely manner, and expected service to be lousy-excellent service. WOW and food was pretty good too along with our bill. Double WOW
author: Daisy P.

description: Horrible! Less Than Mediocre! As many patrons, we decided to stop on for a snack after the baseball game. Big mistake!!! We had stopped in at a few other establishments, but they were packed. When we walked up to the hostess, we were quoted 25 mins. This should have been a sign. We were seated within five minutes. We ordered two orders of the macaroni and cheese, order of wings, and an order of calamari. Sadly, I can't say anything was decent. The macaroni and cheese was runny and lacked flavor. The chicken wings were nothing spectacular and the calamari was the worst. The calamari was beyond greasy and was clumped together in a giant ball. There was very few tentacles and a lot of just fried batter. We ate what we could and left annoyed and disappointed. Especially when the bill is $68!
author: Stella K.

description:
My family and I were headed to a SF Giants game at 1 PM but we were there early and decided to grab brunch before the game.  The restaurant itself is perfectly located across from AT&T park.  Yelp stated that they opened at 11 AM and low and behold we arrived at 11 AM only to find out that there were already a ton of people already seating, eating and ordering!  The staff were great and seated the four of us (including two children) outside looking out at AT&T park.

My husband and I ordered a chicken salad and a breakfast croissant sandwich to share.  The food was pretty decent and the breakfast croissant was on point.  I would definitely recommend sharing. We even replaced the potatoes for vegetables for a more healthy option.

Overall pretty good. The only thing I would note is that we waited a while to get our check and to check out. The place was busy but I wish that we could have had an easier and faster service without having to flag down the waiter.
author: Darina H.

description: Love to come before the game, great atmosphere and great food. Wasn't too happy with my service this past trip, waiter took really long to take our orders, bring refills, didn't check on us during the meal and didn't offer coffee or dessert before bringing the check. Just seemed pretty rushed to get us out the door after forgetting us our whole meal.
author: Kim S.

description:
We came to MoMo's after checking out Super Bowl city on Friday night 2/5. I'd heard about this place on KNBR etc and decided to check it out. I came with 2 of my cousins and we didn't want anything to swanky so we settled on 2 pizzas for the 3 of us. 

We sat down and ordered relatively quickly. Needless to say, after walking amongst the mob at Super Bowl City about 2 miles north, we were hungry... 15 minutes pass, nothing.... 30 minutes pass.... nothing... maybe 40 mins after we order the waitress comes by and says she'll check on the pizza's.I was thinking to myself "my local Pizza Hut has a delivery cycle from order to door of less time than that so I don't understand what the holdup was." I looked around and the restaurant wasn't that busy (maybe 50-60% full) so I don't know how they couldve justified it. 

 When they brought out the pizza's, one of them was the WRONG PIZZA! Seriously after 45 minutes they couldn't get it right? We had to wait another 10 minutes for them to get the right pizza (wow it only took em 10 mins to fix their problem?! where was that speed initially).

Given that we were relatively young guys, we scarfed the first pizza down in a few minutes, waited awkwardly for the 2nd one etc and ate in a staggered manner... The pizza's weren't all that for the price.

To be fair, they didn't charge us for the 2nd pizza, so I guess that salvages something about their service. 

We missed our intended Caltrain back down to the South Bay, and had to take one an hour later and got back to SJ past midnight. Thanks MoMo's... This place is seriously overratted. Honestly I shouldv'e kept walking to the other places on the street rather than giving in to they hype...
author: Ashraf C.

description: Momo's meatloaf was average but not amazing. The clam chowder was really good and I highly recommend it. My daughter had the Mac n Cheese and it was amazing. The Caesar Salad was nothing special, so I would recommend another type of salad. The pizza is good but be careful that the bottom of the dough is not burnt as half of ours was and it ruins the taste.  The service was great! Prompt greeting and we were seated immediately. We sat outside to enjoy the beautiful summer SF evening before the 7:15pm Giants game.  We will return to try other dishes.
author: Brian W.
