description: I attended MoMo's in October of 2014. At first I was really enjoying our experience. My sister happened to ask the host to move us since they sat the 3 of us in a very small corner. She refused and our service got worse after that. This was during the 2014 World Series and the Giants were playing the Royals. The place was packed. But the worst part of this experience is that I found hair in the pizza we ordered. Not just a strand but deliberate chunks of hair. We had brought the pizza home to give to kids and that is when I discovered the nasty hair. I am so glad I caught it before I gave it to the kids. My sister called and complained the next day and they removed the charge of the pizza from her bill. I will never ever go to MoMo's again. I only gave them 2 stars because it looks like they have the ability to hide their one stars~!
author: Margarita M.

description:
We chose MoMo's because of it's location right across from ATT Park. My hubby and son ordered much better than I did, so I'm happy to raise them up a star based on their choices.

What they do well = bar food. What they don't do well = fancier cuisine.

Our table ordered a bunch of food, and the favorites were absolutely the pub style standards:

- Macaroni & Cheese w/ham: Super creamy, bubbly & smooth. We licked the skillet clean. Nice cheddar flavor.

- Potstickers: Very dense, yet tasty. The wrappers were pretty doughy.

- Beet salad: a TOTAL miss. Basically a plate of greens (not micro mach as I had hoped) with some squared beets around the edges. Major disappointment, the crostini was chewy & didn't integrate with the salad.

- Burger: Fine - but they brought the wrong fries.

- Teriyaki Skirt Steak Skewers: Chewy & bland

- Ahi Tuna Tartar: Yuck. Served 1990s style on individual wontons. The Ahi had lots of veiny stuff that kept it from being individual chunks. I only ate 2 of the 5. Also a whimpy portion, very little ahi for $17.00

- Crab cakes: Very good flavor. Much better value for $17 than the tar tar, however still seems steep.

Nobody bothered to ask why we didn't eat the beet salad, the steak skewers or the ahi. If you go stick with the mac & cheese, onion soup (it looked good) and a burger. Fill your tummy for a reasonable price. Stay away from the fancier items.
author: Maureen B.

description: Great happy hour! $5 pizzas and drinks right next to the park. The sausage and mushroom pizza was the best!
author: Nicole Y.

description: This is a great place to go whether you're going to the Giants game or not. They have a nice menu different varieties for all including kids.
author: Tom S.

description:
The signs say try our artisan pizzas! Ok, sure, let's do.

Wah?

Are they sharing ovens between pizza and other cooking? This looks like it was cooked at 350 degrees, not a high-fire artisanal anything.

The crust was perfectly smooth and blonde, like android skin. No sign of blister or char, top or bottom. No sign of any hardship at all. I think this crust had helicopter parents. It is soft, and is not gonna make it in the real world. Please say nice, affirming things to it, even if you are inwardly repulsed.

Prices for other items are generally a buck or five higher than they oughta be (and beer is $8). But $17 for that pizza was complete robbery.
author: bobo n.

description: I brought my nephew there for dinner and ball game. We arrived promptly at 545, and ordered our beers. We ordered starters and main course at the same time, but we got our main courses at 705pm....We missed the first pitch. We were given a complimentary beer as an apology. A beer we would not have ordered if our food had arrived on time  I spoke to the manager, and asked for a discount based on the unacceptable wait. This was not forthcoming....I would expect MoMos to be able to handle heavy volume, yet it was actually quiet that night. Bottom line...They are living on their reputation I will not be gong there again
author: Victor T.

description: I see this place packed like sardines during Giants games so I assume the fans know what's up. Honestly, it's a lot smaller than o thought it would be and I'll say the same for the menu. Sub par food but the drinks are stiff and tasty. Our waitress was very sweet and patient as we were a large indecisive group. They do take reservations which is mainly why we went there before seeing Kurios. They do earn a 4th star for serving Coke products
author: Jen O.

description:
Dayyyyyyyyyyum MoMo's.......

Your prices can really break a person if you aren't a half way decent looking girl, the Birthday Boy or someone who "Accidentally" forgot their wallet in the car. But all in all, its actually the best place to go around the Ballpark. 

The establishment itself its quite nice, and has a great ambiance and vibe. There are people of all ages here that all have a majority commonality. GIANTS FANS! WooHoo :) 

This particular time around, I had the gumbo with a regular(not the skinny they offer) margarita. I must say the gumbo more than surprised me with the unique flavoring and consistency. It was pleasure in my mouth. I'd have to rate this an A++. 

Must check out if you are near AT&T and looking to grab a few brews before watching the boys in Orange & Black swing the bat around!
author: Hillary H.

description:
Upon reading other reviews, wasn't too sure about this place, but went in on a friend's recommendation. I actually thought it was pretty good!

First, the bad... Price. Very expensive for what you get. Had two drinks and a burger -- bill was $50. They automatically added grat (probably because we were a party of 6), which was fine, but also added a 4% service charge on top of that. Huh?

Other than price, though, I thought it was pretty good. Our service wasn't exceptional, but it wasn't horrible. Atmosphere was nice -- we went on a Friday evening looking for somewhere a bit laid back, and this place definitely was (although I'm sure that's much different on game days). Food was excellent. I got the lamb burger and have absolutely no complaints. It came with a salad that was also very delicious!

I recommend trying it out. If you like lamb and burgers, I highly doubt you'll be disappointed by the lamb burger!
author: Derrick S.

description:
I came here to celebrate my wedding with my new wife and my friends.. The food was stunning and the service exceeded my expectations..
The owner "Peter" walked over to our table to welcome and congratulate us! He was lovely! I find it very intriguing and his appreciation and dedication to his business is fantastic..
We started with verve champagne and black Beans soup as a starter and It was absolutely delicious! 
I had the salmon plate, it came with quinoa, fresh vegetables with a special dressing so delicious..
Our waiter was very professional and on top of his game.. 
I'll definitely make this place my new destination for days to come.....
author: Pedro D.

description:
7/19/14  Dinner

In the neighborhood so we stopped by for dinner. I can tell this is sports bar/restaurant that would be packed to the gunwales on game nights since it's right across the street from AT&T Park. On the evening of 7/19 it was very slow and the menu is limited compared to what they post on their website. Menu offers mostly small plates and pizzas, with a few entrees.

*Shrimp Po'Boy ($12): three mini po'boys served in gargantuanHawaiian rolls (in comparison to the portion of shrimps). Tasty deep-fried shrimps with spicy crema sauce. It's the best item of the evening. 

*Margherita Pizza ($14): is soggy despite generous portions of tomato and basil. I like my pizza thin-crusted. Momo's is thin enough except it is only crusty on the crust.

French fries was a  little side order for $7. A Moscow Mule and a glass of Pinot. The check came to $65. Pretty steeped for bar food. There's better food for less in the neighborhood. All in all, the menu was obviously designed to provide the least amount of value for the most price.

Service is good and friendly.
author: Matt Y.

description: This place has horrible service! We waited 10 min to be greeted, another 15 min for the drink to come, 45 min for mac and cheese, and another 30 for our food.  I would not recommend this place to anyone! And they charhe an extra 5% for who knows what. Oh, and iy was a SLOW  Saturday afternoon.
author: Colleen C.

description:
Drinks and beer are ridiculously overpriced, but everywhere by the ballpark is going to be that way.  Nice patio and bar setup to hang out before the Giants game.  Wood fired pizza is rustic and good.

Would not go there unless there was a game or concert, but for that purpose MoMo's delivers.
author: David S.

description:
Welp, it's a restaurant/bar next to the home field of the Giants. And since I've only visited on a game day, I can't say I could even tell you what the place looks like, it was so packed.

But! Major props to them for being that much of a mad house, and still having very good service, decent drinks, and friendly staff. When you're mobbed with lunatic fans about to watch a game, that is not easy.

Worth the stop!
author: Noah H.

description: Loved the burgers and salads and the fries were awesome . Great location near the ATT park and happy hour $5 draft beer and wine . Great ambience and service and family friendly comfortable atmosphere inside . Only bad part was he high taxes and surcharges imposed by San Francisco .
author: Kaushik G.

description:
MoMo's is all about the location (it's right across the AT&T park) and drinks. I went here with my team for dinner and happy hour specials before heading off to see a Cirque du Soleil show. 

Dinner - Food was okay - I had pesto veggie pizza (grilled squash, olive, mozzarella) -since it's a sports bar, I really didn't have high expectations on their main dishes but looked forward to their drinks and bar food. I ordered chicken wings and "skinny jalapeño" margarita. The jalapeño and lime were very refreshing!
author: Jasmin H.

description:
I'm very certain that the only reason this place stays busy is due to the location.

I came here for a business dinner last week prior to the Giants game. As we entered, we were greeted and "pointed" to our table by the hostess. Once seated, we were told by the server that we were not allowed to order drinks a separate times as "the bar is too far away." So we all waited and ordered food/drinks at once.

One friend ordered a second drink -- it came out different in taste and color, so it was assumed it was the wrong drink. The server told her that it was the same drink and she must be mistaken. When my friend pointed out the color difference, the server came back with cranberry juice and poured it in, making it a more similar color. Yeah, because cranberry juice was the miss on this...

The food was OK.
author: Chelsea A.

description: I came here on a non-game night and my experience was extraordinarily awesome!! The bartender was attentive and even Chef Juan ran my food out to me personally.  The oysters "miyagi" came out so quickly and came with limon and mignonette sauce which really highlighted the saltiness of the oysters.  Hummus seemed a little over portioned for an appetizer but who cares it's to share and more food for me when I wake up! The flat bread has herbs and really has a nice touch with the raw veggies combined. The hericot vertes were perfectly blanched. The caponata was delicious and savory and nicely seasoned. Great experience here at Momos! Thank you Sofia who personally made my food that night, she executed perfectly and the presentation was on par! The team at momos is doing a great job! - Chef Marck
author: Marck C.

description:
NEVER AGAIN will I come here!!

My Girlfriend's and I came here last Saturday night for catch up dinner and drinks, mind you it was the night of the LA and Giants game so figured it was going to be busy but around 6pm it wasn't bad.. to make a long story short we were seated at a table our waitress seemed OK in the beginning there was a table of guys sat after us and a family as well.. they were served water immediately while we were not.. both tables had their orders taken for food and drinks AFTER us and got served FIRST and then to top it off our waitress was taking shots with the table of guys next to us.. since when is it ok to get drunk on the clock?? I then asked her how long it would be for our food and she said "what was it you ordered again?" really? After we got our food I was super annoyed because we had plans to go elsewhere to meet other friends and we were so late due to MOMO's mess up.. I then ask to speak to the manager JOSE and he was completely UNapologetic and rude. Don't waste your time eating or drinking here while there are SO many other great places in SF-the food was horrible and drinks were not even strong totally ruined our girls night!
author: Rebecca C.

description: Food was decently good. Our party liked the mussel and fries more so than the cioppino dishes. Although a bit on the steep side for lunch, this place has a nice ambiance and while we came on a non-Giants game day, there were plenty of flatscreen tvs with various football games on. Free parking was also relatively easy to find. Happy hour might be a good time to visit this place for better deals!
author: W A.

description:
I had a burger - average, highly overpriced food. I won't be coming here again, since there's better food at half the price within the same block.

The atmosphere is nice, so I wouldn't mind having a lunch meeting here.
author: Brian C.

description:
I had heard so much hype about this place from TV and radio about it being THE spot to hit up before Giants homes, but after visiting, it was just OK and left not knowing why so much hype as there are many other restaurants and bars on this street right across from AT&T Park.

We were going to the A's v Giants game and got to the stadium 3 hours before gametime.  We made a beeline to this place because of the hype.  Walked up to the restaurant at 4:15pm, and they were already checking ID's just to get into this place.  So apparently it's not family friendly because they have a bar inside and outside. We told the front desk we had a party of 7 and he said, "We have a table for you now, but we need the table at 5pm."  umm OK, so we felt rushed the whole time which was weird because the restaurant wasn't even half full the whole time we were eating! 
 
A few of us got meals but some of us stuck with appetizers because we were gonna drink at the bar before going into the park.  So I tried the mac n cheese appetizer which was alright, nothing special.  We also ordered the calamari which was pretty average, nothing special there either.  I had a slice of my friend's bbq pizza.  Again, mediocre, nothing special.

The food here is pretty mediocre and nothing special which deserves 3 stars, but had to move it down to 2 because they told us we had to be done by 5pm because the table was reserved.  And when we were done eating, there were still plenty of tables that could have fit 7!  So completely unnecessary to give us a time limit in my opinion.
author: Michelle L.

description:
Came before La Traviata at the ballpark for dinner. The hostess wasn't at the front so we had to flag down a waitress to get seated.

The burger was over cooked and dry (I asked for medium). The brioche bun fell apart. One of the worst burgers I've ever had.  The fries were the frozen kind. Sub par for the price. I know they have prime location near ballpark but must do better!
author: Semuteh F.

description:
Ugh. I must say the only reason we walked in this place was because I hadn't pre-selected somewhere for dinner! I should have definitely looked into other places in the area, because I am very disappointed we selected this as our dinner location. 

The restaurant itself is nice, it has a great patio. It was too windy on Saturday, so we sat inside instead. We chose the bar, because we were just going to grab a drink, some quick food, and get on with our night. The bartender was really friendly and nice, and took our orders right away. We ordered a pepperoni pizza and an order of calamari to share. 

The calamari came and was alright. Nothing spectacular, really it was just "okay." The sauce it was served with was almost like a tangy mayo, which was again, just okay. The pepperoni pizza wasn't even good in my opinion, although my husband thought it was good. Nothing out of the ordinary. 

Overall, it wasn't great. For our two drinks and the food, our bill was $50. I don't expect much less in San Francisco, BUT, I want to leave satisfied and feeling like I just ate something amazing, because there are so many amazing restaurants in the area!
author: Shauna S.

description: Came here after a Giants game. Cool place but I don't understand why they close so early. The place was packed yet they kicked everyone out by like 10-11. What a trip. Wonder why they don't capitalize on $? Next time I hope to come earlier to get a more full experience.
author: Gee R.

description: Grabbing lunch before watching Giants game was the perfect combination.  The restaurant has high ceiling so it was not stuffy even though it's packed!  The tuna tartare was marinated well and fresh.  They have the best shrimp and crab Louie with a very big portion of bay shrimp and crab meat.  Their pizza is very thin crusted and well made.  I love their big selection of beer and I managed to catch a bit of the 49er game before going across the street to watch the Giants!
author: Rose L.

description: Went here for a drink and an app before a game (well before, quarter to 3). Had reservations elsewhere at 4. Ordered drinks. Waited awhile to get our drinks. Ordered food, still waiting for drinks. Finally got drinks and food. Food was good. Service was not. Water was never refilled, server finally came by and we told him we were finished and ready to leave- and he never brought our check. Finally had to flag someone down (it was already 4 by this point), they return telling us the system is down so we have to wait. We get another waitress to estimate our tab and ask her if we give cash she can just bring back $10. We had to wait about 10 minutes for that. Was my first time here and I was disappointed.
author: Danielle H.

description:
Probably the best spot to be before the Giants game. They have great happy hour specials and offer a great atmosphere. Both inside and outdoor patio seating available. It gets pretty crowded especially around game time and can often be hard to find seating. They offer a bunch of different bars including beer carts around the restaurant so it makes waiting for drinks much easier.

The food is actually pretty good and they offer some great specials during happy hour. Service is good and staff is friendly.
author: Nick S.

description:
I have been to MoMo's a handful of time;  most memorably, the 2012 giants world series game. The crowd was fun, it was a packed house and the bartenders were on top of their game.

That being said, this past Sunday was the first time I have actually come to eat. It was before a giants game so we grabbed a seat at the bar. I ordered at pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries and my friend ordered a cobb salad with a beer; a hefeweizen to be exact.
The beer came out promptly followed by two waters. Her words were, "this beer is incredibly flat and room temperature". Not wanting to be a bother as they were busy and the bartender was pleasant, she drank it anyway. *insert bitter-beer-face here*

After about 10 minutes, her cobb salad came and the bartender follows by saying "your pulled pork will be right out, the kitchen is backed up". Game day, understandable. 
Then 20 minutes pass. 30 minutes. Almost an hour... and here my friend is, done with her salad and working on her third beer while I'm patiently drinking my coffee trying to hide my frustration due to hunger. Our bartender emphasized with us, continuously went to the kitchen to check on the status and updated me. Come to find out, "the sandwich came out a while ago".... Must have gone to the wrong patron. =( so he comped us a beer.  At that point, we were almost late to the game and I wasn't too hungry anymore.

And, low and behold, the sandwich arrives in all its glory. It was small, but the pulled pork itself was remarkable. The sweet potato fries, on the other  hand, were cold but we were so crunched with time it didn't matter.

All in all, would I pay $15 for a small pulled pork sandwich again? Absolutely not. There is far less expensive, far better food in the area. $50 later, I left and got garlic fries and chicken tenders at the game because I was still hungry.

What saved MoMo's for me was the incredible bar staff who was not only personal but also empathetic/understanding of our situation instead of brushing us off because I wasn't drinking. (didn't catch his name, but he was the buffer white guy who I talked about marathons with).

Definitely come in for a drink or a sit down dining experience, but I'd personally pass eating at the bar again.

Go giants!
author: Ryan L.

description: The owner, Peter, reached out to me privately and offered an apology - he was very sincere, and I was happy to give Momo's another shot. He handled our reservation personally this time and met us at the restaurant and everything was great. We had a great time there and would go back.
author: Adam T.

description: Bottomless mimosas on the weekends unless there is a day game, but their website doesn't mention that so I didn't have the bottomless mimosas, just two small mimosas for 20 bucks (the price for bottomless). Service is ok, nothing special, a little slow. Most servers feign interest in you but have a permanent face of irritation, like they'd really rather be anywhere. Salty food, but I like their happy hour and some of their appetizers are pretty good, tuna or calamari.
author: Athena K.

description: I just had the Huevos Rancheros and it was amazing. Fresh chunks of chorizo and roasted chipotle, creme fresh and guacamole were the perfect toppings.  At $18 a plate, the presentation, taste and quantity were worth it!
author: Elena T.

description:
hey! don't eat here unless you are ok with no waitress service outside and rude managers when you ask "hey! how do I order?" I've honestly never experienced such an ungrateful staff. I understand you have prime real estate across from a national stadium but that doesn't mean you should abuse your guest with pure angst. 
try somewhere else before the game. 
and I dare the staff here to change my mind
author: Carmen F.

description: 7 of my friends and I had dinner at MoMo's last night before heading to the Giants game. Even with how busy the restaurant was, our drinks, appetizers, and dinners all came out to the table at very reasonable times! We did not have to wait long at all to get orders in, either. Our waiter was extremely friendly and made us laugh every time he visited the table. The Thai chicken wings and mac and cheese were delicious and the perfect size for appetizers to hold you over until dinner. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich for my main course and it was delicious!
author: Ailish R.

description: The steak & fries dinner was marvelous. No fat, cooked medium. The bartender was pleasant and attentive. The bourbon was a great pairing with the juicy steak. Perfect experience.
author: Joseph M.

description:
A captive audience and a lack of neighborhood alternatives is what causes a grilled chicken sandwich to be $16. I get that. 

The sandwich was excellent and in a pinch, it had to do. I don't regret it. The fries were good, as well. 

Let me put it this way: as good as the sandwich looked (and turned out to be), there's no way I would have set foot in there if there wasn't a high chance my employer would let me expense it.
author: Andrew L.

description:
MoMo's is still not a place for gays who stutter. It's just a place for a steak dinner that's finally a bargain. I actually tried the $29 NY Steak dinner before about a year or so ago and thought it was decent enough but not enough to motivate me to update my review of this place. Jamie W. and I tried it again last week, and I'm happy to report that things have improved since our last visit. Now the NY Steak dinner is a good deal if you are particularly carnivorous.

It starts with an Iceberg Wedge Salad covered with a major ladle of blue cheese dressing (see photo). Jamie paid the extra $2 for a crock of French Onion Soup that came with a huge layer of dairy gluttony accurately referred to as "Three-Cheese Decadence" (see photo). The medium-rare steak itself was huge with a peppery marinade freckled with capers. It came atop a mound of horseradish mashed potatoes and sauteed green beans (see photo). Good, artery-clogging eatin'.

In a case of too little, too late, I tried to make up for the evening's crimes with a martini glass of mango sorbet. Jamie said the hell with it and ordered the Vanilla Ice Cream Sundae with Chocolate Sauce (see photo). My, that was a lot of food. but it looked like a lot of tables were following the same route toward a coronary. A deal is a deal, and on a non-game night, it's quite bearable in that cavernous place. I'm not much of a fan of Pete's or Pedro's, but I kinda like MoMo's. No, I'm not stuttering.

FOOD - 4 stars...a whole lotta meat and fixings for $29
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...a big space that strangely feels crowded
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...serviceable, no more
TOTAL - 4 stars...stop stuttering!
author: Ed U.

description:
This place was perfect for what we were looking for. We were about to drive back to LA from SF and wanted a quick-ish brunch before the drive. This place was an awesome brunch buffet with really tasty items. We had the eggs benedict (served on a biscuit--yummy!), mac n cheese (woooo-e! So tasty), berries, lox and cream cheese, and coffee cake. Everything was really good for being a buffet and we were out pretty quickly.

My only complaint was the maitre d. Wow, that woman was pissed about something! We walked in and she had the worst look on her face and had no interest in being there. Later when we were eating, I could hear her mumbling angrily to herself behind us while fixing a table. If you are so miserable there, I'd find another job!
author: Jamie S.

description:
sooooo I have to make an update. I received a message from a. concerned manager Caitlyn. I didn't respond untill l
8 months later and she was very prompt polite and professional this long after my event.  that alone deserves 5 stars. and ro my surprise she invited me to try one more time. with it being close to baseball season why not.  so i finnaly make it over and was greeted by two awsome bartenders. they poured nice tasty drink were very attentive. ordered food and it was delicious. the wings were a homerun. burger was top notch.  and this was all with out knowing I was coming or anything. it was just a normal Wednesday.  
thanks again for a wonderful time.  I will be back again and again.
author: Kenneth S.

description:
Came here tonight (Thursday) for an early dinner. No reservations, but they didn't have any issue seating us since it was so early. Lots of small company Christmas dinners going on later, though. Here's the rundown:

Atmosphere: Located across from AT&T Park, I knew this as the place to grab a drink before, during, or after a game, but I had never stopped by. Inside, it's pretty upscale. White table clothes and a well-dressed staff. They constantly refill your water glasses and are very professional throughout the meal. 

Food: It's definitely on the pricier side, but this is prime real estate. I ordered the crab cakes for $26 and my friend ordered the cioppino. The three crab cakes were pretty good, not too oily, but still had a nice crisp outer shell and a good crab flavor. The remoulade that came with it was also pretty tasty. My friend seemed pretty content with his cioppino.

Would I return? Quite possibly. It's a classy place with a great location. We also noticed they offer a bottomless mimosa brunch. Probably one of the rare places that does in SOMA.
author: Leana L.

description:
Friends and I came after the Giant's game.  Super convenient and packed! The line to get in went rather quickly. We came for some drinks, no food.

Staff / bouncer / patrollers were good looking and friendly! Forgot about the new smoking law and these guys were asked to move to the ramp area away from people. Hahaha. I don't like smelling like it anyway and it separates the guys I'd prefer. ;)

Spent about an hour here. Very nice patio with heating lamps outside. I liked the vibe and drunk crowd. It was fun and memorable.
author: Tina N.

description:
I think what makes this place a good restaurant is the access across from AT&T PARK and the well ventilated space around. I like the structure and atmosphere of this restaurant but the food is just ok. I came here last Sunday with my friends and we had an ok time. The food isn't bad in taste but the amount of the food and the price is off balance. 

I ordered the house burger which tasted alright. The meat was the only thing that stuck out which the key ingredient but I also have to add the size of the burger itself. It was like a hot pocket; small. They served like 10 fries on the plate too, which made me mad for $11. The menu needs to be fixed too, because my burger was suppose to come with a fried egg...instead the waitress said, the menu is "confusing" so I had to end up paying for a fried egg. OMFG!

The food a little long too! we were the only 3rd party around 12 pm, and we waited hella long for our meals which shouldn't have taken that long anyway. 

overall, I'm not gonna be coming back but this place IS easy access if there is no where to eat after a Giant's game lol
author: Allister D.

description: Cool spot and the food was just ok for me. Our waitress really took us to 3 stars not the food. I wish it was better than it was as the spot is cool
author: Brad M.

description: We went to MoMo's after watching the Kurios performance in China Basin of Cirque du Soleil. Since MoMo's is across from ATT Ball Park, and is touted as a sports bar, my expectations for the quality of food weren't high. Yes, it is a sports bar with plenty of big screens, yet on a Sunday evening it was quiet and intimate. Our party of four enjoyed excellent service and a very good meal. The beet salad could have used a few more beets, but it was fresh and big enough to split. The lamb burger with sweet potato fries received a thumbs up from one guest and a "good but overcooked" from another. The gumbo and the cioppino were top notch. The cioppino is not served in a large deep bowl as we were used to, but the amount of fish in the dish made up for the lack of broth. A very good experience and we'll definitely come back again.
author: Cynthia B.

description: The food has finally caught up with the service.. in the wrong direction! I was highly disappointed when I dined in the other evening.  There is definitely a change in the quality of food here and the service is as poor as I remember it.
author: Natasha Y.

description: Good service but you could tell the bartender was hurting on a Sunday afternoon.  Can we say "hangover"??   The margarita pizza was pretty good - I asked to have chicken added to it for some protein. Excellent French dip sandwich - would definitely get that again. Tv's everywhere to watch games. Nice sports bar but it was really dead at 3pm on a Sunday afternoon.  Can we say "hangover"?
author: Lisa G.

description: I have been here numerous times before but today while sitting at a table with a view of the entrance I saw a mouse run through the hall toward the kitchen.  At the same time I saw it the hostess saw it.  When a manager asked me if I needed help I informed him I saw a mouse run toward the kitchen.  Later I had the pleasure of watching one of the servers chase the mouse toward the patio and step on it while another server picked up what I assumed was a dead mouse.  No one apologized to me at all which I think was pretty poor service on their fault.
author: Matt M.

description: Our waiter was super friendly, and was not pushy at all, he even offered valuable insight into food options. The strawberry basil lemonade was amazing!
author: Jack W.

description:
Came through before the Giants game on a Friday night, whoa it was packed to the tilt. Brought my team for a team event and some out of office fun.

The setting is pretty nice, with inside dining tables, a bar inside, and a bar outside facing the ballpark, only thing is the bar outside is cash only. But there are waitresses who come around and can take orders and take plastic. 

We ordered some appetizers. Oysters which were just ok, fried calamari which was pretty decent, and pork sliders which I didn't get a chance to try.

Had the Cioppino with its mixture of crab, shrimp, clams in a slightly spicy red sauce. The crab meat tasted great, boy it must have been a while since I had some. 

Overall a nice place to visit before the ballgame.
author: Tommy B.

description:
Came to MoMo's before last nights Giants vs Dodgers game at AT&T Park. Joined 3 friends for an exciting evening..

We were early so we decided on MoMo's. Actually this is like my third time there but at that time I wasn't on YELP and now I am...so now I review ....

We ordered the Margherira pizza. Typically I like thin crust but for some reason the crust was thicker last night and not very warm. Trust me, we weren't going to send it back since the place was PACKED and they were getting slammed. We also ordered the fried calamari which was good and came with a spicy aioli. Also ordered the Mac & Cheese, it was bubbling hot (and definitely didnt taste like your boxed mac n cheese) but it was just mediocre. It was good but nothing memorable. Us girls had a Cosmopolitan and the guys had Beers (I believe Laganitas IPA).
I had a nice buzz on for the game because I'm what one would call a 'light' drinker. lol...
Anyway 3 stars for the food. 4stars for fast service and friendly server despite the fact there were MILLIONS of people.

I actually would give MoMo's 5 stars for ambience. This establishment is quite nice and has great vibe. There are people of all ages here and with one thing in common, THEY ARE DIE HARD SF GIANTS FANS. Last night everybody was in a good mood. I don't know, maybe we just knew we would kick the Dodgers buts!

Definately check out MoMo's, its across the street from the most fabulous ballpark in the country.
author: Janet T.

description: Been coming here for years and usually it ok. The place is across from ATT park so it's easy to fill seats. This particular visit was just awlful. Overall the menu is boring and food quality of my meal was marginal at best. The clincher was service; it really didn't exist. We were a party of 8 but we were basically ignored as we waited 30 minutes to get our food ordered plus drinks. We never saw the waiter after again after the food came.  We waited for another 20 minutes just to get our bill with about 20 customers in house.  I snagged another waitress who promptly handle the charge. Do you suppose it made no difference to him since there was a built service charge? Frankly I was prepared to leave a message with a one dollar tip. Hopefully Momo's might consider wait staff training. Lots of other restaurants in the area would appreciate my business
author: Steve S.

description:
I know that people on here are giving this place low reviews and stars. But I have to tell you that when I walked in. The Hostess seen I had a dog. She instantly catered my dog. She took a take away box staple the sides down and filled it with water for my dog. As we were sitting out in the patio area in the front. I don't know her name was but I found that 100% awesome. People can say this place is overrated. I don't feel it from here. I got great service from the waitress to the bus guy. 

I ordered a grilled chicken sandwich it was yummy. It had caper aioli in it, which I'm a sucker for that MMMMM. 

I would come back again with my dog to!.
author: Linda N.

description:
I was here for a corporate dinner so we had a large section and a pre-set menu with one salad, 4 entree options and 1 dessert. I had the walnut salad for a starter, Blackened salmon for an entree and the chocolate chip cookies for dessert.

Our servers were pretty diligent considering we had a group of about 30-35 people. They busted out the salads all at the same time so we could start eating right away. The salad was well dressed but it was mostly lettuce and arugula (maybe a couple of walnuts).

My salmon dish was A-OK. It was served on top of corn, zucchini and beats. It was the only low carb option on the menu, so I went for it. The salmon was well coked but the whole dish just lacked flavor (and yes, healthy food CAN have flavor).

For dessert we had thick chocolate cookies that were drowning in melted chocolate. Horribly unhealthy, so they were, as you can expect, incredible.
author: Emily G.

description:
whoa whoa whoa

I'm on a burger roll recently, and holy crap - MoMo's makes an amazing burger. 

Fries are perfect size and consistency, plus you get to dip them in their mustard seed aioli. Bun is soft and flaky, patty is big and thick and cooked to a perfect medium rare. Lettuce, tomato, and onion are all very fresh. 

I feel like they must put drugs in their burgers because my hungover ass is REVIVED.

I can't comment on price, service or ambiance because this beautiful creation was delivered to me at my desk. However, after working directly next door to this place a few years ago, I can say you want to AVOID during/directly before or after Giants games. The place will look like the refugee propaganda photos circulating the internet. Packed beyond being able to move, even on the sidewalks around it. So many goddamn drunk people wearing orange. 

I digress...

Hamburgers, tho.

MoMo's, you done good. You done so good.
author: K M.

description: Met some friends there and had a great time. Our server Kalli did a great job. Thank you.
author: John K.

description:
Right in front of the Muni stop!

They're happy hour apps and drinks are decent. I ordered the jalapeno margarita and I thought that it was a jalapeno infused tequila. Nope, they just throw in a slice of jalapeno, LOL!

We stuck to the Moscow Mules.

We ordered wings, pizzas, lamb sliders. All good. 

It wasn't packed so we got the best service ever :)
author: Spooky E.

description: The air was tense and the sun had just slid behind some clouds as we walked into MoMo's I knew at that moment this wasn't going to end well.. I immediately ordered a beer to calm my nerves. I ordered the margarita pizza since well you can't fuck up a margarita pizza. Minutes later far too soon for the pizza to be cooked it arrives on a plate. As I gingerly lift a slice to taste this monstrosity the entire toppings slide off in a watery mess due to the raw tomatoes under the cheese. Never in my life have I been so disappointed by a pizza. I took the opportunity to raise my concerns with the lovely waitress who agreed it was a weird way to make a margarita and she mentioned that others too had been bamboozled by its composition. We swiftly paid and left vowing never to eat pizza there again.
author: Damien M.

description: Food was just ok nothing to brag about. Service was slow even though the place was empty on a Friday night. Location is perfect cross the street from the ball park.
author: Naifeh G.

description: Momo's is hands down best happy hour in San Francisco. $5 wells, pizzas, sliders, Moscow Mules. I've been coming here in a big group for a while and the staff are always so friendly and accommodating. Amazing open patio across from AT&T Park. Definitely a go to!!
author: Veronica C.

description:
My and 2 friends came here on Saturday during the giants game, place was empty, so we sat down to order food and drinks at the bar.

We each opened up our own tab and the red headed girl behind the bar was openly bitching and talking shit about us for opening up separate tabs. The place was empty! I could hear and read her lips while she complained to her coworker (josh), "they want to open up 3 separate tabs - how f*cking stupid is that? That's so f'ing dumb." 

She didn't realize I could hear and see everything she said and we would have stiffed her josh was our actual server on the receipt so we left decent tips.

The food is expensive ($15-18 for burgers and sandwiches) and the cranky red headed bag behind the bar make it not worth the hassle.
author: Umar E.

description:
I had hoped their 'revamp' a year or so ago would have improved their menu.  

I agree with a lot of the latest reviews... its just average stuff... not very flavorful... and overpriced.  Looks like their 'revamp' just got closer aligned ti the expectations of Giant's fans for a quick meal before/after a game.  Strange though as there are only events at AT&T Park less than 1/3 of the year.  

I don't plan on going back.
author: Victor P.

description:
Yesterday was the big JPMCC, we decided that MoMo's was going to be the after party. This is a great venue and the location couldn't be better.  From the patio to the dining room, you get an excellent view of AT&T Park, the high-rises, the Muni trains and all the people walking around. You feel like you're part of the hustle and bustle of the city when you're there. So I give that part 5 Stars. 

Food -- The chicken wings... what I can say about those wings except for MAN O MAN they were DELICIOUS! They were Thai Spice; some sweet, some hot, and a whoooolle lotta of tasty goodness. 
The Calamari was good and I would definitely  order it again. But if I had one criticism it would be seasoning. The flavor would be elevated with some salt and pepper prior to cooking or in the breading /flour. The Calamari as cooked perfectly and was very tender, I found the tempura veggies they added were a very tasty touch. The added dippers were an enhancement, but the Calamari stood on its own.

Gumbo-- Let me preface this critique by saying I am a Gumbo lover, will eat it every chance I get. Especially the homemade seafood Gumbo with crab, sausage, shrimp and chicken wings not CHICKEN BREAST! On to the Report! This gumbo was a disaster. Nothing in the bowl was working and honestly I don't even understand why it was even called Gumbo.  It was missing a lot of key ingredients like the File Powder; the menu said it had Okra that was nowhere to be found.   To me this dish was a bad take on Jambalaya if I ever had it. The chicken had no seasoning at all. It was swimming in what tasted like tomato/pizza sauce and trust me when I say it did nothing to help the dish.  The one good note was the Andouille Sausage was spicy which gave it a kick and the shrimp was cooked. I will on occasion ask the opinion of the servers just to see if they're true foodies or simply sales people.  I have respect for those that are honest. If you've never had it, say so. If it's not that great, say so. And Don't be afraid to make recommendations. So before ordering this I did asked the server how it was, and her reply was "Oh it's really good". Now either she has NEVER tasted Gumbo in her life or has the worst palate ever. (Salesperson)  ;-(     At Delancey's (down the street), their Gumbo is nothing but a few grains of rice swimming in watered down chicken stock with just a few pieces of chicken and sausages thrown in. A flat zero on the gumbo chart, but it beats out the Gumbo I had last night by a huge margin. I've read other reviews on the gumbo from here and I can't fathom how anyone would say this was anything better then absolutely TERRIBLE. I'm sorry , but I'm still shaking my head over this one.
New York Steak- My friend ordered the New York. It was cooked to a perfect medium rare but that's where the good news ends. Their steaks are not very good nor are they terrible.  It would not be my first choice, second or third. 

I would recommend the Pizza all day long. The pizzas are the thin crust with fresh mozzarella. I love the Sausage and Mushroom, the Pepperoni and the Margarita pizza. The pizza is worth a good 4 stars. 

Overall I would say MoMo's is a great place for Happy hour, pizza, appetizers and drinks.  Grab a seat on the patio, people watch and take in what the city has to offer.

Location -- 5 Stars
Chicken Wings -- 5 Stars
Pizza--4 Stars
Calamari --4 Stars
New York -- 1 Stars
Gumbo -- (-5) Stars
Totals ---- 14 Stars / 6  = 2.334 stars
author: AHodgee H.

description: Post Giants game meal for five people. The bar outside was packed but the restaurant inside was surprisingly clear. The food was a tad expensive for what you got but we didn't have any major complaints. Although the chicken for the Cesar salad was very dry. Rating this 3 starts because we were not wow'd by anything. It is not a place I would seek out again and would probably only dine there in the future if happenstance found me there.
author: Peter F.

description:
Came with my family before attending a fundraiser gala at AT&T park. We got there before 7 (when happy hour ends) but were unimpressed by the happy hour menu for drinks so we skipped it.

The food was all great. We got the crab spinach dip which was really tasty. It did not come with enough crostinis but they offered more to us before we even finished what we had. For my main dish, I ordered the salmon dish. it was really good and I enjoyed it a lot.
author: Alexandra W.

description:
MoMo's literally "hit it out of the park" for us before going to Game 5 of the World Series yesterday!

Even with the crazy crowds and two hour wait, it was all worth it. Just post up on a bar stool with a couple GREAT cocktails and wait it out! My friend had a really delicious series of gin & tonics, and I had some very good margaritas. The bartenders here are really on top of it. 

Now onto the food: we were super impressed with the quality of the food considering how busy it was and the fact that we've never been here before to give some comparison. All of our dishes came out hot and presented beautifully.

We had the mac & cheese, with gouda and black forest ham, that was to die for. We'd been eyeing it from our previous perch atop the barstools and the dish did not disappoint. We also had the delicious crab cakes (mind you, I'm not a big crab fan, these were AWESOME) topped with a little remoulade and served over whipped potatoes and steamed spinach. The pepperoni pizza was very good - heavy on the pepperoni, fyi. Our final dish was the calamari, which were crispy, fresh, and tasty.

Our waitress was very sweet and held up well under the pressure of having a constant stream of people coming through the restaurant. Kudos to all the waitstaff at MoMo's - you're all fantastic!

We will be back the next time we are wanting the gameday experience outside the park.
author: Liz G.

description: I have been coming here since 2000, when the ball park opened up, and have a fantastic time always.  They have a diverse menu, that actually expands during the baseball season, the staff is professional, and is always there to make sure your experience is wonderful
author: Paul G.

description: Great hangout at giants game time. Tonight it was a fun place to be to watch the World Series Game 1 SF Giants against the KC Royals. The restaurant was well staffed and food was served hot and fairly fast. As usual we had no problem getting our beer. It is my favorite spot for watching the Giants game if I'm not in the stadium.
author: Nessa M.

description: My wife, son, and I travel to SF to attend a Giants game, when they play our home team, once a year, and we have always noticed the big crowd at MoMo's across from AT&T, so this year we decided to eat there before the game. The interior features a typical sports bar atmosphere, but the menu is not the usual pub grub. My son had a french dip (he deemed it "tough and dry"); my wife made out better with the Cubano sandwich, but I was really looking forward to some ball park fare--brats or hot dogs, but surprisingly they weren't available, so I settled on a Caesar salad which was mostly stems. Next trip we will look for someplace else.
author: MC B.

description:
So after a terrible first experience ( and not the service or the food ) I left a yelp review and Caitlyn, reached out to me and asked to give them another try. So I did.

Since the fiasco with the first visit was a billing issue, they gave me a gift card. After pleasant interaction with management, my friends and I sat down and began to eat and drink mimosas. After staying there for hours (and our server was amazing I might add) and eating so much delicious food, we got the check to venture out in the city. Paul, the director of operations, came over to ask how everything was and of course we raved! He was super apologetic about the first visit and as I tried to use my gift card, he told me no that he had comped the entire meal! I was so shocked! I didn't expect that at all and now I have a gift card I will definitely be using when we go again!

All in all Momo's was so great to me and really made things right in my book. The service was amazing, the management has DEFINITELY been upgraded and the food is fantastic. Thank you again! I will be back in soon!!!
author: Judie R.

description: The food is good - there's enough for everyone to get something that they like, and its generally of a very high quality. I've had the steak salad, the ahi tuna sandwich and the pizza and all were very good.  The service is always excellent too - great waiters.  It's perfect for a big group in SOMA.
author: David Z.

description:
To begin this review I just want to say my intentions are not to be malicious or bring negative attention to the food or drinks from this venue. This review is solely based on customer service and the current staff. 


During my experience to this venue with my family, we were ignored by the two receptionists purposefully until we made an effort to get their attention. Once we had their attention they mentioned how the venue was ran (one side for the bar and the other for dining.) after walking around the place and assessing the bar area to be completely full my family and I walked over to the EMPTY/unblocked dining area where we decided to sit down and have dinner. Once the waitress noticed our presence, she ran to our table asking if we had been seated my the hostesses with a disapproving facial expression. We relayed the message we received about the dining area then went on to tell her we decided to stay for dinner and needed menus. At this point my family had been very disturbed by the waitresses attitude and began to be a little more assertive about needing table services. Right away the waitress decided she did not want to serve our table and called the manager to serve us (the waitress TOLD the manager she would not serve us because we assertively asked for her to provide us menus!!) the manager then helped us order some drinks and tried to calm the situation but at this point my family and I had already been disgusted by the service and the current employees to stay one more minute. 
Again this review is not on the food provided from this venue because we did not even get to try it! In all honesty,  my family has been in the restaurant/bar business in San Francisco for the past 45 years and I am not sure how people like that are hired or even want to apply for jobs in this industry if they do not have the skills their job titles require. I know this venue is always going to have a steady line of customers due to its location but let's just say if it were anywhere else, the place wouldn't even be able to get people in the door to try it due to the horrific costumer service! I hope this helps someone make a better choice as to where they want to spend their time, money and patience.
author: Angelica L.

description: Walked into this place New Years Eve. Everyone was so attentive and friendly. Food was good. Loved the french onion soup. Fairly priced for the food provided. I would come back for sure.
author: Kalita N.

description: Excellent happy hour, great location and perfectly fried fries! Skip the pizza though, it's subpar at best.
author: Hayley H.

description: I have never, ever had anything other than an excellent meal at Momo's, and Tuesday was no exception.  If you're ever craving perfectly cooked linguine with clams, this is the place to go.
author: Katherine W.

description: Good food and nice atmosphere. Visiting SF with a group of 16; they were very accommodating of our large group.  Good wine list and drink menu. Food came quickly, service was good.
author: Carol H.

description:
I was a little hesitant to eat here since most of the reviews are about the drinks and not so much the food.

I ordered:

Strawberry Fields Lemonade (thanks Mike S.) and I really enjoyed it. I didn't get a buzz like Mike S. did per her review, but I did enjoy the flavors. 

Crab and Shrimp Melt: This sounded amazing but when I got the sandwich.. I wasn't sure how to go about it. The sandwich is just on a long piece of bread, which was really tough to cut. This made it really awkward to eat and almost painful since the bread was so crunchy. I only ate one piece and was done. The fries that came with it were really really good, though. 

Calamari - YUM. I really enjoyed the crispiness of the calamari. The veggies were also quite delicious. I would definitely order this again. They use just the right amount of batter so you don't feel greasy after eating it. 

Service was very good. Our drinks were always refilled, and plates cleared when they were ready.

I'm not sure if I would come back here for the food, but I'm willing to give their drinks another shot if I were in the area.
author: Lena H.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night, way different than happy hour, it was dead! 

The service was good, friendly but during dinner they were cleaning and putting away all the chairs and we weren't there late, it was 9:30ish so it was a bit distracting.  I realize they wanted to get ready to close, but for dinner guests it just sets the message of we want you to leave. 

We shared the ahi tartar, which was OK nothing to write home about, the lamb meatballs which were good, but very small for the price, there were 3 small meatballs with a bunch of other stuff on the plate and finally we shared the scallops which I thought were very well prepared and the sides were nice.  While the food was not inventive or creative, it was solid and a great choice for week night dinner, won't be coming here on the weekend again.
author: Inga W.

description: Went here for drinks during/after a Giants game.  I was surprised the place wasn't too busy and we found some seats outside in the bar area.  The restaurant is kind of divided into two parts- there is a sit down restaurant side that's much quieter and then a bar and outdoor area.  The place is in a great location right across the street from the Giants stadium.  The only reason I am giving this place 3 stars is because the lackluster overpriced drinks.  3 doubles were costing us 60$ and it was not high end liquor.  I don't know if they raise their prices when its game day, but at 20$ a drink I couldn't afford to stay there for very long.  Another problem is that most of their beer had run out.  THey have a great bar with lots of draft handles but most of them had cups over them indicating they were out.  I don't know if they just didn't want to switch the keg or if they were really out, but out of maybe 12 taps I would say 5 were open and they were your typical light beers and Budweiser.  I don't know if I will be back to Momo's, maybe for a game sometime, but beware of the prices!
author: Kate F.

description: Came here for drinks after a Giants game one Sunday. Most bars around AT&T Park are packed after each game (especially after a Giants win), but MoMo's seemed the most lively. We got blatantly ignored at the bar and passed over for people who had been waiting for less time. When we finally did get the bartender to serve us, he had an attitude. This soured the entire experience for me. There are plenty of bars and restaurants surrounding AT&T Park to choose from that DON'T treat their patrons rudely. I'd suggest finding one of them instead.
author: Matt P.

description:
Stopped by here for brunch before heading to a Giants game one sunny Sunday afternoon. The patio gets PACKED so get here early if you intend to drink. Luckily since we were eating and not just drinking we were able to get a table, but the dining room was also pretty busy, so again I would recommend coming early. 

To eat I ordered two appetizers, the lamb meatballs, the mac and cheese with ham, and then I had a bloody mary. 

The lamb meatballs were juicy and served with hummus, pita, and some salad. The mac and cheese with ham was super good. It was creamy and piping hot, and it had a lot of ham mixed in with the pasta.

The bloody mary was also pretty solid, it was nice and spicy. After brunch we joined the masses on the patio outside for some drinks. I had a screw driver, it was really strong but still good. The bar tenders outside were really  nice and seemed to be having a good time. i will definitely be back to Momo's before a giants game next season!
author: Stephanie T.

description:
Lack luster performance.  We had appetizers and salads and the food was pretty good. I definitely recommend the meat skewers and the sliders. 
The valet parking was a nice benefit and very convenient. 
However the service was sub par for the atmosphere and cost of the restaurant.  She was inattentive , even though we were one of 3 tables in the restaurant.  Drinks often went empty and her disposition was unfriendly at best. 
Skip the desert. The cookies were dry and the kids wouldn't eat them. The banana bread pudding was overwhelmed by the chocolate sauce so it was difficult to taste the bananas.
author: Thomas R.

description: Typical event night. If people knew how to behave in a crowded bar this place would be better. Great staff, good drinks.
author: Tim A.

description:
great location. food was ok . nothing exceptional and the whole place needs a re model.
probably would rate higher in baseball season
author: Skip D.

description:
GO GIANTS!

Mushroom Pizza, BOMB! Can't really say much else other than...

GO GIANTS!

ps...keep up the good work MoMo's staff!
author: T P.

description:
The lamb meatball starter, with accompanying greek salad and vinaigrette of perfection, is DELICIOUS.  

However, they are so small, that I found myself licking my to-go container in hopes that they would come back to life.  I'm sure I turned on a construction worker or two who happened to be gazing into the building at the exact moment that I started to de-file it.
author: Tamar D.

description:
Decent food, decent service, decent atmosphere, I've dined here many times over the years, but I have a bone to pick with you, MoMo's. 

     I came here with my mom, nephew, and sister last week. 

     First off, your hostess sucks. Hosts/hostesses are very important to a restaurant because they are the first thing a customer sees. They should be friendly and welcoming, not snooty and putting on airs they have no business putting on. Your restaurant isn't NEARLY fancy enough to warrant a snooty hostess. 

     Secondly, while we know that a corkage fee is customary, charging us $20/per bottle corkage seems like highway robbery. 

     Thirdly, you guys sneaked on to our bill an 18% service charge... for a group of only four?!?  I've seen many restaurants do this for a group of six or more, but NEVER for a group of only four. And it was sneaked on to the bill. For such an uncustomary tactic, it should have been explained rather that just put onto the bill where I guess you hope that a customer doesn't notice it and double-tips the waitstaff. We tend to tip very generously (20 - 30%) for good service but the service charge was so off-putting, that we left the waitstaff with no additional tip. 

     I've been here many times and have enjoyed it immensely over the years, but I think MoMo's prime location across from the ball park has gone to their heads. I won't be returning.
author: Robert F.

description:
Drinks and food before the game.  How can you argue with that?  

They have outdoor seating, and the food came quickly even though it was packed.
author: Cori D.

description: A friend chose the place, so I didn't know what to suspect. It is right across from the ballpark, so I can imagine how crazy it could get during the games. The food was very good, but nothing stood out.
author: Robin W.

description:
Fun place to catch a drink and some grub if you can't make it into the game. Very busy and very loud during baseball season, not in baseball season this place could be a good destination for a date.

The atmosphere is dressy casual, you can get away wearing a t shirt, but you could totally be seen here in a three piece suit.

I like the patio and the bar!
author: Steve L.

description: MoMo's is a great sports bar. Luckily we didn't go when a game was playing so we enjoyed a quiet dinner. I came here with my girl randomly and I would totally come back. The ambiance is nice, the waiters are great and the food is good. Their pizza is pretty big and enough to share between 2-3 people. MoMo's I will be back to try more off the menu.
author: Evelyn H.

description:
Being right across from AT&T park, you know food here is going to be pretty expensive. I came here with a few friends and I ordered onion rings for $8 and a Kobe beef burger for $15. As far as I know, Kobe beef is banned from import from Japan so I'm fairly certain that I overpaid on regular beef... 

Anyways, the onion rings here are awesome. Less so rings than fried onion shavings. The burger that i got was super plain. Nothing special about it and it was even a bit on the small side sadly. I would give the place a two star, cause of the price, food quality, food portions, and the fact that the server didn't turn on the heat lamp for us when we were seating outside and my friend had requested it twice, but the onion rings earned that extra star.
author: Austin W.

description:
Average food. Overpriced. Friendly service.

If you're going to the ball game and every other establishment in the area is full.. then consider MoMo's, before diverting to Wholefoods to make yourself a packed lunch.
author: Matt G.

description: Omg, terrible. I came here for my boyfriends birthday brunch and really wish I hadn't. I ordered eggs Benedict with Dungeness crab and the sauce was so tangy! Too tangy. I really did not enjoy it. The server was so nice and offered to substitute a meal for it because I didn't like it but the brunch menu wasn't appealing to me. My boyfriends pulled pork sandwich was also a problem. The meats sweetness got old fast and he only took two bites before he was done. The server, again, was super sweet and took both items off of our bill. We had also ordered pizza, the tomato basil was super salty and the sausage mushroom had no salt at all. Service was great but the prices were too high for the food they have.
author: Xiomara S.

description: Good place to chill before or during a Giants game across the street from AT&T Park. This place is always packed on game day. Drinks are reasonably priced, and it's not too hard to find a spot to enjoy your drink with friends. Large restaurant, and have never tried the food and will have to next time. Wish there were more restrooms though since it gets really packed for the ladies.
author: Denise L.

description:
I give 3 stars because 1) I like the location 2) I like the interior and the booth chairs are super comfy 3) I like their monthly menu

I got the mussel and fries for an appetizers and it's definitely different, but the sauce was extra salty.. I got the chef's daily special which was the meat loaf with mash potatoes and green beans and my boyfriend got the lamb burger. I did not like the meat loaf it was sooooooo freaking salty! I did like the mash potatoes and green bean it was good and my bf said he liked his lamb burger but when I smelled it and took a bite of it.. It smelled and tasted really funky.. I was not pleased with it.. Felt like I ate a tablespoon of salt and am bloated to the max!! I went on a Saturday evening/night it was surprisingly not crowded but service was not great it was quite bad. I saw a couple who got seated and left after the waiter never showed up for 10-15 minutes. I'm not sure of the guy was the owner or chef but he was bussing the tables! At least he's doing something and I appreciate that. Overall experience was not that great and everything was so salty......
author: Vonnie T.

description: We came here for happy hour. We were really excited, having heard only good things about not only the happy hour but also the restaurant/bar in general. It was a nice day, so we decided to sit outside. There was one server for the patio. She seemed friendly. We ordered a ton of food and drink. 4 spicy margaritas, sliders, fries, and 2 pizzas. My friend asked for the veggie pizza without olives. The food came out sporadically and the pizza came with olives. She reacted immediately. They took it back and said they'd make another one. 7 minutes later, the same pizza came out, as if they tried to pick out the olives and pass it off as a new one. Third time is a charm? They made a "new pizza, with a HUGE pool of grease in the middle of it and way less veggies on top. Though the service was scattered and our food was neither organized nor properly served, we still didn't complain. Server went missing for a while but when she came back to ask about dessert we were really excited because it was my friend's birthday and she wanted the chocolate lava cake. The server didn't even acknowledge the birthday verbally. The cake was not lava and very dry. The server didn't apologize once for the service errors. Nor did she say anything about the birthday (even if you don't do free birthday desserts at least wish her a happy one or put a candle on it!). I didn't expect anything comped but the lack of cordiality pushed my buttons. I've been in the service industry for too long to be ok with an aloof server. Maybe she was having a spotty day, but she needed to get organized.
author: Zara S.

description:
I've wanted to come here for a while solely because of the name (my cat's nickname is Momo). Finally I got the opportunity to check it out this past weekend. We made sure there was no Giants game going on because we didn't want to be stuck in any crowds, and went around 1pm on Sunday afternoon.

The weather was nice and we were immediately seated in a nice little table outdoors. It wasn't crowded, but there were a few other parties outdoors so it also wasn't empty.

We got our water pretty quickly, but it took a while before we were able to get a waitress to take our food orders. After that, it took another 30-45 minutes to actually get our food...so beware, it was fine for us because I was catching up with my brother who was visiting for the day from out of town and we could spend more time talking, but I was also very hungry...so if you want a quick meal, probably don't come here. I thought that maybe the reviews on wait time were just because the restaurant got very crowded during games, but apparently it's ALWAYS slow service.

When we did get our food, I was pretty disappointed in mine. I ordered the chicken panini and it was far from a panini. Isn't a panini supposed to be a pressed sandwich? Instead, I received a flavorless, dry, far-too-small-for-the-bread slab of chicken breast between a definitely-not-pressed-and-definitely-hard-and-flavorless sandwich roll. The fries, however, were FABULOUS, which for me made up for it since I don't often get to eat fries. I tried my boyfriend's pizza, which he didn't like, but I thought was pretty yummy (the crust felt almost flaky...yum!). He did enjoy his french onion soup. My brother and his girlfriend also liked the fries, and seemed to be fine with their burger and french dip sandwiches, but didn't seem incredibly impressed.

The service was polite even though slow. My brother had ordered bacon on his burger (for an extra couple of dollars), but they forgot to add it. When he brought it up just to make sure it wouldn't be on the bill, they apologized and brought bacon free of charge.

Overall, the experience wasn't the best, but also wasn't the worst--a very solid 3-star place. I'm just thrilled to have finally checked the place out!
author: Katie V.

description:
Review for outside dining, HH menu only....

Quite enjoyed their delicious pizzettas and HH menu before a Cirque show not that long ago... their drinks were definitely great.. this is an extremely busy restaurant, owing primarily to its location. 

but the interior's (where we sat for a while) dining room is very pretty as well. Like!
author: Jana C.

description:
It's a great place to be pre and post game, but aside from that, I would probably never come.

We started at Pedro's and made our way over here.  Getting a drink was pretty fast for how horribly crowded it was.  Expensive.  The staff was great, but the other people here were rude.  You would think that adults would know better sometimes.

Anyway, we got bored and left.  I went back to Pedro's.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
DON'T COME HERE FOR HH DURING GAME DAYS!!!

What a mistake! We thought we were getting happy hour prices, but it turns out that during game days, there are no happy hour specials.

Fortunately, we didn't order much, but enjoyed the expensive food (although, cheaper than stadium price) and ambiance, where everyone was pump for the game!

Their mushroom and sausage pizza and steak skewers were pretty delish.
author: Jen H.

description: I have only been here for happy hour, but man, what a happy hour.  Their $5 lamb sliders are outstanding!  I wish I was hungrier so that I could have eaten more.  I sat and ate at the bar.  One bad thing is that in the bar area, whenever somebody opens the door, it got cold.  This was in mid December, so maybe it is more pleasant at other times.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Great location. Nice menu. Great burgers and pork sandwiches. Friendly staff. Nick is a great waiter.
author: Brian H.

description:
Came here for dinner and drinks on a fairly busy but not over flowing Saturday night. 

Our waitress came and took drink orders. When she came with my boyfriends beer (about 15 mins) she forgot my wine and I had to ask for it twice before she brought it. Our food orders also took about 30 minutes to come out after that. My boyfriend had the steak and I had spaghetti with clams...you can't go wrong with seafood in sf right? Wrong! I have to say that aside from being bland, it actually tasted bad! Not off, not rotten, just not good. My boyfriend's steak was also overdone and bland. Our friend's pizza was ok.

We finally flagged down our server after a good deal if semaphore to ask for the bill. She didn't inform us of the built in service charge already billed to us and so we tipped on top, only realizing when we got home that it was there. I know, should have checked, but I wouldn't have expected that for only four of us! Very sneaky.

Won't be back. Service was horrible, food not great, prices too high. Sorry!
author: Liz R.

description: We stopped in after landing in SFO to grab a bite to eat. I hear nothing but good things from friends who come out for the baseball game. Our waiter forgot or didn't hear an entree we ordered, barely stopped by our table. We had to flag him down to ask for more water which came in small glasses. We are normally big tippers but I don't think I'll be leaving one today.
author: Jill G.

description:
Momo's is pretty good. We came here yesterday after visiting the Giants County Fair with my friend Jenn and her daughter Olivia. We wanted some real food and a Bloody Mary to enjoy in the sun. (It was so beautiful yesterday)

We ordered our Bloody Marys (a soda for the kid) and the fried onion strings and pulled pork sliders. It was a perfect small meal for 3, each getting a slider and the onion string appetizer was pretty big. 

The best part was sitting in the sun watching all the Giants fans walk by, enjoying a great drink with good friends.
author: Rebekah T.

description: Giants lost to the Dodgers, came here to get a quick bite and go home and pout. We had Bbq pork sliders which was a bit dry, but nice tangy sauce. The wedge salad was "ok" it was not cold and therefore somewhat soggy. Had to flag down our server for silverware! Menu prices are very high.  Here was the kicker...stated on Momo's menu is "A 4% Surcharge On All Guest Checks."  HUH??? Come to find out this "surcharge" is to help the restaurant provide optional health insurance to their employees. Okay fine, offer your employees health insurance, but advertising a mandatory surcharge on their menu sounds like restaurant politics to me. As a diner that is a huge turn off! Chef doesn't want his dishes priced higher, management wants healthcare. ...WHATEVER. So, IF I ever dine there again (very unlikely) I plan to tip @ 14% I'll keep the remaining 4% to cover MY health insurance.  Figure it out - and don't involve your patrons!! Oh ya...and squeezing my way past 1000 celebrating Dodgers fans really didn't help either!
author: Michelle M.

description:
I went here after watching Cirque Du Soleil. This place is good for big groups if you're looking for something that's walking distance from AT&T Park. 

There are often ways a restaurant can redeem itself for example they may have bad decoration but excellent food so it's okay that they didn't spend that much to decorate but it never works the other way around. Food has to be the highlight of my meal. Service and ambiance are only a factor into my experience but if the food falls short then it can ruin a dining experience.

Dishes were a little pricey for what it was. Appetizers in the $15-$20 range and entrees in the $25-40 range. We started off with the calamari it was average you can't really mess up calamari it is fried after all. For my entree I ordered the blackened salmon which had a small piece of salmon and a big scoop of jambalaya. My biggest disappointment was the jambalaya it didn't have flavor not even the slightest kick. Was there really pieces of andouille sausage in here? Because it was more reminiscent of a hot dog. Another person in my party ordered the gumbo which I tried, it didn't have that cajun kick to it instead it was more reminiscent of Italian flavoring like a tomato basil thick stew. The shrimp was also really disappointing tiny little things that didn't look fresh. Another person in my group had ordered the cioppino, it was definitely on the bland side and the seafood didn't impress. 

For dessert we used our Cirque Du Soleil tickets to get a free treat the option was a chocolate ice cream sundae or chocolate chip cookies. Since this was free I can't complain, but these items are also on the regular dessert menu.. I wouldn't suggest ordering this if you're going to pay!

Service was pretty good and so was the environment but the food left me disappointed.
author: Sarah C.

description:
MoMo's lunch before a Giants game.............burger was very good,
Gnocchi with shrimp and eggplant o.k............much to SALTY.

Sunny day, sitting under umbrella shade across from ATT park......priceless.
author: Lynda C.

description:
I went here for a department holiday lunch and it's an appropriate restaurant for the occasion. There were lit Christmas trees and it was festive.  The place seems to be divided into a bar area and the restaurant area. Not sure if there are private rooms, but this is good for groups of 8 ppl max.

The memorable appetizers were the calamari and the oysters. We also had the grits and mussels but they weren't outstanding.

My entree was the NY Steak, and it was very flavorful and salty.  I had the steak medium, and it was on point. The fries were crispy and perfect. I asked for balsamic vinaigrette dressing for my salad, which was too tangy and strong, so I ate my salad dry.

We also ordered the mac n cheese to share and it was extremely heavy and cheesy. I would not order this again.

For dessert, I had the bread budding and it was disappointing. It tasted like two burnt toast with bananas in-between. Do not get this!!! Too bad it's not as good as it looks.

Very good customer service here, they are attentive and check up on you at the right times.

Warning: there's no parking lot, so you'll have to find street parking
author: Kristina N.

description: A friend and I came in here for dinner before a Giants baseball game. I've come in here many times in the past several years, and seem to have a recollection that my earlier visits had better menu items, food quality, and better service. We started with a few martinis (one had to be sent back because it was dirty, and wasn't requested as such), then ordered the Crispy Calamari which came with a cocktail sauce, tartar sauce. That was good. Then for dinner I ordered their burger with blue cheese and bacon. My friend ordered their steak salad. It was all passable but my feeling is that they stay in business is because it's across from AT&T Park and they do a huge business during game days. I remember coming in here a few years ago and the food was way better and the service was more attentive. Water glasses weren't filled until we asked several times. I guess the excitement of the upcoming game made it all passable, but not cheap. However, if it was a restaurant told to stand on it's own as a bar and eating establishment, they would have problems attracting customers. If there wasn't a ballgame? For the price? I probably wouldn't come here to be frank. Might have to start eating in the ballpark before games in the future.
author: Norm D.

description: Went to Momo's for the first time yesterday and definitely not going back. If you're a Giants fan I could see it as a nice alternative if you don't want to eat at the park other than that this place is overpriced because they can be and their servers when you sit down and eat are rude. We had a minor in our party and all we ordered were drinks and the server asked us to leave. RUDE. I would give this place negative stars but I liked the cocktail server Calli, she was nice and attentive despite the rush of people. The potstickers were alright.
author: Edith C.

description: Went to eat here with almost 20 people after a spartan race. They were very accommodating and quick service.
author: Ro R.

description: Wow first time tried for years to get in  Kristen and staff you rock so nice so fun so efficient and I could take the Chef home thank you much Go Giants. Lucy & Rick HMB
author: Anne C.

description: Excellent food. Their mussels and fries were absolutely delicious.  If you like Moscow mules, definitely try their blueberry mule! Its delicious.  The staff are always friendly and helpful no matter how super busy this place gets. Momo's is always a great spot and is particularly an awesome place to hit up for hh or right before a Giants game!
author: Kim L.

description: Love coming here before giants game! The staff is so friendly and the food is great.  We always have a great experience when we come here
author: Amanda G.

description:
Went here with my co-workers for department holiday lunch a few years ago, but I wasn't on Yelp yet - now I am so thought to right a review.
