It was good. The service was friendly and the food tasted great. When we went it was during the Giants off season but I can definitely see it being crowded during the Giants season as it's right across from AT&T park. Great location. We had pete's burger, mac and cheese, the chicken pot pie (which I believe is no longer on the menu), bread pudding and creme brule
author: Kathryn Y.

description: I came here for a beer... The bartender just disappears for really long times... So if you're looking for a quick drink, don't come here.
author: Anonymous T.

description:
Went to Momo's after a Giants game because it was convenient. Service was good. I ordered a NY steak and was surprised at the low quality. My steak was a generous portion but was tough and I wasn't able to eat some of it. Flavor was good, not great. 

Would I go back to Momo's, NO. San Francisco has too many other great places to eat.
author: Alex p.

description:
This place is in a great location and they have valet parking which is a plus with me. I love the casual atmosphere here, I never feel under-dressed and the staff is always attentive.

The ahi tuna tartar is out of this world good, the steak skewers and the Calamari was also good each time I've ordered it. The beet and heirloom carrot salad was divine. The black angus steak was cooked perfectly, I would order it again. I've also had some fabulous 'fish of the day' dishes here so be sure to ask about that. The wine selection here is very good and there is a hipster type bar in the place too, if that's more your cup of tea.

MoMo's is definitely a date-worthy place and if it's a special occasion be sure to tell the staff because they usually bring out ice cream or cake with a candle. A small touch that keeps me coming back!
author: Jay G.

description:
Pre-game beers at this place are awesome IF you can get in.  The wait is usually really long, so you'll have to go extra early or come back later during the game.  

Prices and service are decent.  Happy hour menu looks legit.

PROTIP:  No happy hour during game days...
author: David C.

description: Went there with my sister before a Giants game. Ordered a $24 cheeseburger with avocado which was too salty to be edible. Informed the server who stated she would pass this information on to the chef. Did not get offered compensation. Very disappointing.
author: Jen F.

description:
First the good. The French onion soup is to die for. I mean it is seriously that good!!

 The ambience is a little off though. Tables way too close together. And the booths felt like I could swim in them

Don't go during a ball game. That would be bad. The place is packed. 

The entrees where very good though.
author: Emilie F.

description:
Ehhhhh.  Okay this one gets a short review from an otherwise breathy reviewer:

--The food was way OVERPRICED.

--Food quality was MEDIOCRE at best (especially for being overpriced).

--Service was UNINTERESTING.

--They charge you a 4% SURCHARGE.  Why?  They don't say.  But you're also charged sales tax, and still expected to tip the norm.  WTF is the 4% extra charge for??  Really?!  

No.  Totally annoying!  I would like to give them 1.5 stars, actually.  That extra charge really pisses me off.  We will NOT be back.
author: Gianna C.

description: I've been here twice now. Both times the service was atrocious. I've gotten the Caesar Salad with Salmon both times and the house made dressing has been great but the salmon has been severely over-cooked both times. Way over priced. Won't be back.
author: Joe H.

description:
MMMMMmmmmomo's.   Yummy! It's utterly psychotically overpriced and a meal for two will easily set you back a bill or two with a bottle of wine, so it's totally not worth the price.

If however, you come here a savvy consumer, you can order wisely, share food, and make sure to try the onion strings because they're fricken unbelievably good!

Obviously, way more fun if you can do all this on Game Day, since you're right across from Pac Bell..errr... SBC...sorry... AT&T Park.
author: David O.

description: We regularly use Momo's as a meet up spot during/ before/ after Giants games and don't have a complaint at all!  Service is good,  bartenders are very accommodating and the food is great.  I would recommend this place.  Prices are what you would generally expect out of the city.  If you're hungry you can't go wrong with the House Burger!
author: Andrew C.

description:
I would have given them 5 stars for the food alone but the service wasn't too great. For a Friday evening with a 6:30 pm reservation, I was surprised that this seemingly popular restaurant wasn't as packed as it should be on a Friday night in the city. My boyfriend and I double dated with my best friend and her boyfriend before watching the Cirque du Soleil show. We thought Momo's was worth a try since we had never eaten here before and it was a short walk to our show.

When we were seated at our table, our waiter came shortly but he had a really bad vibe about him like he was having a bad day and we were bothering him. When I told him we were ready to order he looked at me quite rudely and managed to be missing throughout our whole meal. He did not even drop by to ask if we were ok. 

Food wise, I ordered the Wild Mushroom Risotto which looked great and tasted great too. It may have used a bit more salt but otherwise, a good risotto and I liked the mushrooms they used for texture. My boyfriend and best friend both ordered the burger which they said was really good and my friend's boyfriend ordered the gumbo which he thought was delicious. 

I'm willing to go back and give this restaurant another shot...maybe we just got a wierd waiter.
author: Isabella N.

description: It was good food but expensive for the amount. Makes sense since its right next to the Ball park but will find a cheaper place to eat next time
author: Kaitlyn B.

description: SO YUMMY. Went before a Giants game, had great service and fantastic food. The baked Mac and cheese went so well with a mimosa :). Definitely want to go back for more of a happy hour vibe. Can't beat the location.
author: Rachel W.

description:
This bad boy is parked directly across the street from Giants stadium so for sure make it the last stop for an affordable priced beer before taking out the loan you need inside the stadium!!

We popped in right before the game, place was busy but not too bad, no problems ordering drinks and got in and out in time for first pitch!!
author: Mike H.

description:
Perhaps I could be letting the cat out of the bag... and perhaps the folks at MoMo's would rather me not reveal this information, but if you find yourself leaving a Giant's game and you have to usar el baño in a bad way, you can rest assured it's about as easy as 1-2-3 to hop in and utilize the restroom facilities for a quick emergency relief. 

Of course, you should grab a brew afterward... but it's nice to know when you're in a pinch.
author: Ruggy J.

description:
Last weekend we celebrated Michelle's birthday as we watched Matt Cain and the Giants pound the life out of the Rockies, winning 6 - 1. After the game we had dinner reservations at MoMo's, which is where the crowd seems to go after a Giants game since its right across the street from AT&T Park. I couldn't believe how insanely crowded MoMo's gets after a game. The outdoor bar area was filled with people enjoying a cold beer or alcoholic beverage. 

Food:
The dish I enjoyed the most that was shared among the group was the Crispy Calamari. Nice and crispy on the outside and the prawns on the inside were quite flavorful and very tender. These were some of the most delicious calamari I've ever had! Both the cocktail and tartar sauce were excellent choices to dip into. This will be an automatic order the next time I visit MoMo's.

With the rest of my food, that's where the excitement ended. I ordered the French Onion Soup (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/j_22pKNeT6KvvzH1Vbbqow/l) and Smoked Carolina Style Pulled Pork Sliders (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/poY4okZvPrV6gS8HmJwdTg/l). Not that either choice was awful, but I really wasn't impressed with either of my choices and a little disappointed.

Drinks: 
I ordered the Strawberry Fields Lemonade (http://static1.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aBLNh0s0kXpgk0sfXmbWCA/l), which consists of Strawberry Stoli Vodka, Sweet & Sour, Cranberry, and 7-Up. This tasted really good and brought back my buzz I had at the game. I highly recommend this drink for those who love vodka like I do. =P

Summary (2.5 Stars): Great spot to hang out after any Giants game to get a few drinks. I would recommend this place more for the drinks rather than the food. However, the calamari is appetizing!
author: Mike S.

description: Horrible horrible horrible bartenders! Did i say rude as can be? And horrible. You would think a good place to catch the giants game but man if you want to be pointed at and ignored try this place. Such good food and location  managment please drop the older girl in the pony tail and the guy working with her.  They were an embarrassement to this great spot on the noght the giants won the pennant and are heading to the world series. Sorry Momo's but a bad employee trumps good food and location.
author: Heather W.

description:
This place is in a perfect location, right across the street from the ballpark, but that's where my praise ends. Everything is SO expensive, I ended up ordering a salad and an appetizer as my meal, and my bill still exceeded $35. The food was disappointing in terms of portion and flavor. I had crab cakes, which had almost no flavor, and two of my friends ordered skewers which were so overcooked that neither of them could even finish them. Our service was disappointing, too. All of the appetizers and entrees came at the exact same time. The waitress also messed up my friend's order, leaving out an entire (important) ingredient, and basically ignored us throughout the entire meal. (I had ordered a Diet Coke which I finished pretty quickly, which then sat empty on the table while I wished I had something to drink.)

When I went to use the bathroom, it looked like it hadn't been cleaned in FOREVER. There were bits of paper everywhere, but no toilet paper in any of the stalls. And I heard another woman saying she had been in the bathroom earlier and mentioned to the hostess that it needed attention, but apparently no one had done anything about it.

Full disclosure: I came to MoMo's immediately following a Giants game. I knew it was going to be crowded - and it was, in the bar area - but the restaurant wasn't full and the service and food was still below par. Given the choice, I wouldn't come back.
author: Tori G.

description: Oh food but the bar tender was slow and aloof. Food was expensive. Don't think I'll ever return.
author: J B.

description: I had a nice piece of salmon here. They made onion stings for us even though they weren't on the menu.
author: Scott H.

description:
A lot has been written about MoMo's, so I'll keep it short.   Went there on a night when the Giants weren't playing.    The place wasn't super crowded but they only had one bartender working.   He as moving pretty fast but it still too a while to get our drinks.   It was totally worth the wait.   Our drinks were mixed to perfection.   It's hard to find a great martini, but they nailed it that night.   Good show.   
Will I be back?   Sure, the next time I want a drink in that area.
author: Bill C.

description: My husband and I stopped here for a few drinks before the game and I wasn't too pleased. We sat at the bar and our drinks were given to us in plastic cups because we were told they no longer serve glasses after 3pm. Honestly it seemed we were being shorted because a nice cold glass full of beer verses a medium plastic cup seems like a difference. Also the girls kept slamming there drinks everywhere while they made new drinks in front of us that I kept getting alcohol splashed all over me. We left and went to Pete's.
author: Heather B.

description: Food and atmosphere was great, price kinda high. We were seated right away, but after being seated, service was slow. They weren't very busy, waiter was not quick with taking order, getting a box, or with the check.
author: Sarah H.

description: Great service great food. Fun place to go before a Giants game to hang out on the patio.
author: Mattie F.

description:
I've been here twice during a Giant's home game and really like the atmosphere...big screen TV and prompt service.

Get to the game or just hang and watch on the TV in the dining room.  Surprisingly, not too busy in the dining room during game day.  The bar is a different story.
author: Randall F.

description:
I have been 20+ times over the years.  The food is always good. The bread they serve the minute you sit your ass down, is warm, with whipped cream-like butter on the side (I prefer to soak it in olive oil).

I have tried almost everything.  I recently had the scallop and risotto dish with a glass of Chard'nay.  What gets me is how quick they serve 7 people (our table) right before a game.   We had one hour to get our grub on before the national anthem started (never to be missed).   Appetizers and drinks were served in 5-10 minutes, dinner served 15 minutes later.   Everybody got what they wanted and no one had to chug down their beer at the end which is another sign of good timing.  

I repeat:  One hour.  Right before a Friday night Giants game.  Quality food with stellar service.

When complete, we took our fresh baked cookies (new on the menu) into the park for some needed sugar in the 3rd, 5th, and 8th innings.  

The only reason Momo's does not get a 5 star rating is because the food is pricey for the portions.   And a stiff drink is $12, rivaling the park itself. 

And the Giants need to win more often.
author: Bob G.

description:
MoMo's was a recommendation as an institution in the area. I'm certain the vibe is quite different on game-nights than regular nights. We ordered a simple meal but James outdid Erica and me going with the steak 3-course option for $29. I ordered blackened salmon and Erica went with a mushroom flatbread pizza.

Everyone's food was just mediocre. We started with a tuna tartare served on crispy won-tons. I like the tuna, could have done without the won-ton. For entrees, I ordered blackened salmon. It was pretty good, well cooked but extremely over "blackened." The corn side was tasty but the rice was not. Erica's gouda and mushroom pizza was quite good, and we notice many people with pizza on the table, so it is likely the best bet. James did not thoroughly enjoy his steak and did not touch his sides. Our wine was also not great, but that could be as much our fault as theirs.

I'm sure MoMo's is a different place when there is no game, but that shouldn't change the food quality. Our service was quite slow and value is not a word I would use to describe our bill. It might be an institution, but not one I would highly recommend or venture back to visit.
author: Jeff R.

description: Been coming here for over 15 years.  MoMo's is an establishment with a split personality: game days & non-game days. On game days a great place to go before the game to meet long time baseball fans and renew acquaintances.  Great bar tending staff and friendly service; don't expect to get fast service one hour prior to game time.  On non-game days can be relaxing and has an enjoyable patio area.  The food menu price points are high due to its proximity to the ballpark; but its menu does offer a large selection of good entrees and other eats compared to many venues in this area.  Bar area has six large size TVs for viewing.
author: Andy A.

description: We went here for drinks right before the giants / Indians game and it was packed. It's location right across the street from the ball park makes it so popular. But seriously, $7 for a beer ? A lil outrageous for a regular bar.
author: Jennie C.

description: Momo's is the worst place I have ever been in my life.  Not only did they loose my card that I started a tab with they fought with me me when I asked for it. I. LiterallY had to argue with the bouncer who thought he was a genius to get my debit card back. Nothing but worthless industry folks here. Not worth anybody's time.  It sucks at momo. Take it from someone that works as a bartender....I have never been so mistreated in my entire life. Don't waste your time on this place. I have never written a yelp post before but momo is the worst place I have ever been. Take it from a bartender, go anywhere else. These guys are the worst
author: Anthony S.

description:
After a satisfying Giants' win I wanted a satisfying dinner to go with it so we headed over to MoMo's after the game for a quick late night dinner. It seems like a fun place to drink before, during, and after the game; but the dinner side was mostly empty with a few sparse Giants fans coming in after the game for dinner as well. For a place that is decorated like a fancy steakhouse, MoMo's is actually fairly affordable, especially considering its location across the street from AT&T. A quick scan of the dinner menu revealed that they have a $29 three-course meal, which they advertise as the city's juiciest NY steak dinner. 

I started off with the daily soup, which was tomato-based with lentils. It was smooth and tasted cream-free and also went great with the complimentary bread. For $29, I really got my money's worth with all the sides that came with the steak. The steak was tender and cooked a perfect medium-rare. They let me substitute one of the potato sides for mac 'n cheese with ham. The portion size of the mac 'n cheese was very generous. The corkscrew pasta and cubed ham was great, but I could taste that the cheese used wasn't too fancy and was probably limited to only cheap cheddar. I ended up not finishing because the cheese started to solidify later and and became quite heavy. The meal was balanced out with a healthy helping of green beans. For dessert, I had a choice of three, but picked the banana brioche bread pudding, which was mushy but didn't lack the familiar banana or cinnamon flavor. For $29, the meal was definitely worth the price. I also tried ahi tuna tartare, which consisted of five or six crispy won ton chips for $12. Not worth the value if you ask me. Service was great and dinner was a proper end to a great day of baseball.
author: Bailey Z.

description: I had been wanting to go for quite sometime.  I enjoyed my huevos rancheros.  I wanted earlier reservation.  There's so much more I'd like to try as far as breakfast and dinner.  I'll be making more reservations.
author: Kathy W.

description: Best calamari in town! The burger I had for lunch was so delicious! I loved my ice cream dessert and tasty Irish coffee as well! During our meal, we met the owner. He is an awesome guy! I'll definitely be back!
author: Caleb D.

description:
We decided to have dinner here before seeing the Cavalia show in Mission Bay.  Sooo glad we did.  Excellent Chicken Saltimbocca!  It was deliciously tender and juicy and tasty.  The spaghetti squash that was plated with it was also yummy.  If I had been home I would've licked the plate clean.  Hubby had the NY Steak dinner special for $29 which came with a salad, the entree with greens and scalloped potatoes (big portions, and the steak was TENDER).

Didn't know that this place also seems like a kid friendly joint as well so more excuses to come...hello Momo's.
author: Emy B.

description:
My boyfriend and I went here last night before attending Cirque du Soleil.  The restaurant was closed for a private party.  However, they were offering the full menu in the bar.

We were lucky to grab a table and two chairs.  The bartender attended us.

We shared the Caesar Salad, the onion soup and the Steak au Poivre.  The food was wonderful and the perfect amount for us to share.
author: A B.

description: Great atmosphere and location for a pre game spot before hitting AT&T Park, but my two stars had to be given in regard to the prices here.  I get that it's a prime location, but I just can't get down with paying $20 for one beer and one well cocktail.  This ain't Vegas, people.  Hell, even there I don't pay for drinks.  Anyway, being a local I can easily find plenty of other more affordable bars to have my pre game drinks at.  But this place is an easy trap for out-of-towners who are here for the game and don't know where else to go.  But like I said, the atmosphere is great, especially when it's a nice day outside and you can sit on the patio, but the price of drinks leave Momo's rather undesirable for me.
author: Kristen F.

description:
Stopped in after a Giants afternoon game with some co-workers and had a blast.

Great food, service and drinks!
author: Marc M.

description:
MoMo's is always super packed for Giants games.

Given its close proximity to AT&T Park, it's a great alternative if you don't manage to get into the ballpark because of a sold-out game. You'll hear the screams from the park... which are on a few second delay when televised... so you'll basically "hear" that something exciting happens moments before seeing it on tv.

If you forget your Giants gear on a game, no need to fret. There are vendors selling relatively fair priced gear directly outside of MoMo's on the intersection of 2nd & King.

As a bar, it's not my favorite. Drinks are way too pricey and the mixed drinks aren't even strong! The only real perk is the location.
author: Drea B.

description: Get here 90 minutes before first pitch.  Plenty of room.  We sat outside and had a blast.  Just had drinks.  Great atmosphere.  Yes it's expensive but hey, you're going to a ball game, everything is expensive.
author: Robert D.

description: The service was the most outstanding part of my dinner experience at MoMo's. Our waiter was very attentive and friendly. The food was all right but overpriced, especially considering the size of the portions. Our ahi tuna tartare appetizer was lackluster. My salmon entrée was good but at $27 seemed way too expensive for the amount and quality of food I got. The tastiest part of the meal was our desserts: flourless chocolate torte and an ice cream sundae, both of which were very good. MoMo's is all right if you're in a pinch and just need someplace to go for dinner, but I wouldn't recommend it as worth the price.
author: Anna B.

description:
This review isn't about going to MoMo's before or after a Giants game; that's an entirely different deal, and there are tons of other reviews for that.  It's to let you know about at good dinner deal - $25 for a 3-course meal.  The choices are very limited - Caesar salad or soup of the day, meatloaf or crab cioppino, and vanilla ice cream and a cookie - but the food is solid and the service is quite good (if you go on a non-game evening - we were there on an off-season Thursday night and had the whole restaurant almost to ourselves).

Otherwise, the food is overpriced, but fine.  My party also tried the fried calamari, the kobe-style hamburger, the gumbo (surprisingly good), and the spicy shrimp with polenta, and all were solid.

There was plenty of street parking, and the neighborhood is fine after dark.

I'd recommend MoMo's if you want peace and quiet, good service, and get the 3-course dinner special on a non-game night.  But probably not otherwise,
author: Larry L.

description:
Came in on a Sunday morning, no Giants game, no special event in the city.
It was pretty dead and slow BUT I still enjoyed the food and the drinks.
They have a patio area, the bar and sitting area for larger groups.
The food looked and tasted delicious! The portions are decent, large for a small person like me, but hey I'm not complaining! Good spot.
author: Brenda B.

description:
Momo' Restaurant is across the street from AT&T Park, Home of the SF Giants.  I saw nothing but BLUE here when the Dodgers beat the Giants... w00t!

The food isn't terrible, but it isn't the best considering the price you pay.  I had the New York Steak and substituted french fries with Au Gratin potatoes.  The steak came out a little charred so the good part wasn't until I reached the center.  The bf had the Half Roasted Chicken which was a bit dry on the white meat side.  The collard greens that came with his meal weren't bad though considering that I don't like collard greens.

Service was hospitable however it took forever to get our first order of drinks.  There was more cranberry than Vodka in mine.  The beer came out just a tad warm.  Overall, I would imagine it's a decent place to get together for drinks, but I wouldn't eat here again.
author: Gina M.

description: Who knows who got what bag of money to allow this place to open before the ballpark was finished. Kudos to them. I've been here numerous times for numerous reasons so I guess its about time I reviewed. Good place to go to get a shot and a beer before the ball game. I spent one entire game AT the bar even though I had a ticket. That's how much fun I had. Of course, we got seats, which is a miracle. In case you don't know, its right across the street from "telephone park"
author: Rich M.

description:
directly across from AT&T park

mediocre, over-priced food.
S L O W service but nice.

Probably best to come here for drinks only before any of the events start.
author: Tera S.

description:
Got the calamari, hummus, clam&sausage pizza & a lamb burger.

Everything except for the burger was terrible. The only thing this place is good at is putting excessive amount of oil, cheese and cream on everything.

The burger itself was okish.

Everything, even the appetizers were 15-20 dollars. 

One of the worst meals we ever had in SF.
author: Danielle A.

description: Okay I ate dinner here right before a giants game and I was pretty impressed. The price for the location, taste and service was well worth it. I had the Teriyaki Skewers, Crab Cakes, NY Steak, Mac and cheese with ham and for dessert I had the Flourless torte.  I have no complaints about any of my dishes. Each one was amazing and delicious. Our server was attentive and she had character.  The only downside was that we had to sit outside and it was freezing, but that's SF.  I would recommend this place and I would definitely be back!
author: Sheree C.

description: Ok food, but very pricey.  I felt bad for my good friend.  She was craving crab cakes and she only got two and that tasted just ok.  Mine felt like it just came from the store and straight in the microwave.   The service though was outstanding though.
author: Paul H.

description: Place is convenient if you're going to the Giants game but food was a miss for the price and so was the service. They are all about turning tables. My pasta was so-so. Dry with very light sauce if any. Not very much Italian sausage as advertised and even less broccoli. I was done with my food but not my beer and some lady (not dressed as a server) came up, put her hand on my glass and then asked me in another language than English whether I was done with my beer. I told her no and she looked at me like I was crazy. As I type this, a busboy picked up my hisbamd's napkin while he visited the restroom. What if he needed it when he came back. My pasta was $22, husband's gumbo was $20. Definitely won't be back.
author: Patricia G.

description:
I ate at MoMo's for a company dinner and was pleasantly surprised.  Our menu was preset, but my salmon and succotash was great. The salmon was well seasoned and prepared and the succotash nicely sweet. They did a great job of not overcooking the veggies and turning them into mush.  The other dishes looked good, and the steak looked especially good.

The best part was my apple tart dessert thingy. I forget what it's called, but it's basically apple pie ala mode. All good and flaky with ice-cream on top. The person next to me ordered the chocolate dessert and looked real salty when it came out.
author: Channa P.

description:
As funny as this sounds, it never registered to me that Momo's had food. In the past I'd always come here to guzzle down a beer before watching a game. Basically Momo's = Liquid Carbs to me, which does the trick during those types of events. 
However, last night my bf decided we go here before the game and use his gift card...how were we ever going to spend $100 on drinks between the two of us? No thanks. But Mussels, Ciopinno, cocktails and burgers? Yes. The food was surprisingly good, especially the Mussels with Bacon. YUM!! I will definitely come back and order more. The cocktails were also really good, especially 'Strawberry Fields'. 
The overall atmosphere is always fun, upbeat, and pumped up with Giants fans, which is awesome.
author: Sonya D.

description: I visited Momo's during the Super Bowl when the 49ers where playing, so y experience is definitely not the regular experience, so I won't go on about  it. I will say though that even with a totally packed room and outdoor area, my food was fantastic and didn't take too incredibly long to come out. I would recommend this place, and look forward to visiting when they are operating normally.
author: Christopher L.

description: Absolute lamest establishment in SF! Bartender Gil jealous of another bartenders tips. He lied & said we were soliciting drinks (we paid for our drinks), and was mad that some beautiful women (us) can be catered to by awesome strangers. Everyone there flocked to us because we're personable. Gil had steam coming from his ears, he was SO UPSET everyone loved us.. Half the bar almost told him off when he brought up soliciting drinks.. So he went to manager Michelle and told a bogus lie to get the other bartender in trouble because we favored him. Michelle couldn't manage to even look presentable, let alone manage a restaurant. Michelle and Gil should definitely be unemployed!
author: Portia P.

description: My favorite pre-Giants game hot-spot!  Used to live a couple of blocks away, so Momo's was my "local."  Moved a bit farther down the Embarcadero and still go out of my way to hit this place.  A lot of TVs, great location across from the ball park, great bartenders who remember who you are no matter how long you've been gone (Gil and Evan...You're awesome!) Gets busy on game days, but great vibe!
author: Sanfranlifer B.

description:
MoMo's has the location down for sure.  Right across from AT&T Park.  So it gets lots of tourist, baseball fans, etc.

Myself, a friend, and my sister went here for lunch today, while waiting to get into AT&T Park.

Waited about 20 min to get a table.  Not bad considering how PACKED the place was (USA vs Ghana soccer game was going on)

Once seated, Beverly D'Angelo was our waitress....or seriously looked like her.  LOL  Anyways....

Ordered a Blue Moon beer and had the Calamari for an app.  My friend got a Pete's Punch drink....mostly vodka he said.  My sister did a lemonade.

For lunch, I got the Pete's Juicy Burger with bacon.  And added a diet coke after.  Came with fries.  Was ok, not really juicy.  Asked for no tomato, got tomato.

Service was good.

For the prices, the food should have been better.

Didn't try to park around there, as we already had parking at the ballpark lot.  Parking can be pricey.

Not sure I'd come back.  Gotta be better places around AT&T Park.
author: Kevin S.

description:
Great place to grab a drink or something to eat before or after the game. Service was okay, could have been better, but it was game day and somewhat busy. The food was actually better than expected. The decor is nice and they have lots of seating and a patio as well. Overall okay.

We had a girls day out and decided to grab brunch here before the Giants game on Sunday. Since I was half an hour late, I had to buy everyone a round of drinks. The bloody mary was okay-spicy and they had a good variety of beers on tap. Now onto the food...

- MoMo's Crab & Shrimp Louis Salad: bountiful amounts of crab & shrimp, right amount of vinaigrette made it delicious and refreshing! exactly what I wanted on a hot 85 degree day and you can choose between a half order or full (the half is quite enough!)
- Corned Beef Hash with Poached Eggs: a bit heavy and salty, the beef was good, but the rest of the dish was just okay
- Scrambled Eggs w/ Breakfast Sausage & Cheddar Biscuit: sausage was good, typical scrambeld eggs, nothing special
- BBQ Pulled Pork Sandwich: tasty bbq sauce and tender pork, fries were good too
author: Linda C.

description:
We've eaten dinner here a few times & it's always been good.  It is a bit pricey.  It is, however, the best deal in town for happy hour.  We went there on a Thursday night & had the drink special for $3 & other wines & beers for $5.  They had a great selection of appetizers for $5 which was dinner for us.  We had pizza (sausage & mushroom - with garlic & arugala) and a few pork sliders.  We were very happy.

Staff really not the friendliest but we enjoyed sitting at the bar.
author: Donna W.

description: Really good calamari and sausage pizza.  The energy here before a Giant's game is exciting and alive.  The bartenders hook it up!
author: Elise G.

description:
Service: F
Lost orders x 3
Forgot drinks x 2
And lastly, they had the nerve to arbitrarily add a $50 "Service Charge" for a party of 3, then added 4% charge on top of it and asked for gratuity in addition. I am a very good tipper if it is warranted, but for an establishment to just add charges is criminal.
Never again!!!
author: CD H.

description:
Come here for drinks? YES

Come here for food?  ehhh I think not.

Food here is over priced and really not worth it.  I guess they count on the crowd since the Giants stadium is right there.  Shoot that's why I came here in the first place.  Coming from work it was the only place near the stadium that took reservations for our group.  

Had the thin crust pizza and tuna tartar.  Food was really not worth the price since the quality really wasn't that great at all.  

I'll probably be back for drinks before a game but for food I think I rather just head into the stadium.
author: Jenny H.

description:
This is where I was when my beloved Giants won the World Series... Therefore, it will always hold a special place in my heart. 

I have had many a drink and appetizer here before games, after games, during away games. I have yet to go for a proper dinner, so this review is only for booze and food that goes with booze. 

As for ambiance, well... during games... it is all about the Giants baby!  So, it is a grand place to be with the other Giants fans. I have run into some cool folks at the bar and never once had any issues with drunks, dummies or anything of the like that might occur during sporting events.  When I have been there for off season happy hour, I feel like one of the youngest at the bar.  Hey... nothing wrong with that! 

So, being that I tend to have drinks when I am here, it has your standard beer selection and full range of liquor to please all. The staff is nice if you get there early enough, you can find a spot to sit.  Food-wise, it is nothing out of the ordinary, but after a few drinks... anything greasy will taste heavenly... fries!

I will try to go for dinner one of these days... but on another note... I am so excited baseball is about to roll back into town... YES! GO GIANTS!
author: Amelia M.

description:
Such a prime location for the Giants game! This place was packed right before the game just buzzing with fans. Lots of drinks to choose from and the staff is SO friendly!

Had an appetizer rampage:

Got the Ahi Tuna Tartare- light, flavorful and crunchy!
Skirt Steak Skewers- my absolute favorite app from all the ones I tried. The teriyaki glaze is mouthwatering and the steak was cooked to perfection. Also came with a peanuty coleslaw, very yummy.
Crabcakes- with shaved fennel, obviously with lemon! I usually can't hold down crabcakes because I can taste the disgusting fat in them but these were actually pretty good. You can actually taste the crab and not just the batter.
Lamb Meatballs- mmm! Paired with hummus and accompanied by a feta salad this almost pulled first for my favorites! 

I also got the Margherita Pizza to share, simple, delicious and light pizza! 

I left full, satisfied and happy for the Giants game! My bf pretty much had to roll me out!
author: Karis O.

description: Had a really good lunch here recently.  Onion strings were awesome.  And the chicken pear salad with some crumbled blue cheese added as an extra was so good, i would eat that every week if I could.  On a non-game day, seating was plentiful and with the nice weather, sitting outside was an extra treat.  This helped get the 4-star rating.  There were many good sounding items to try on future visits.  We''ll see if they can hold up to the rating.
author: Lewis C.

description:
One of my all time favorite go-to places in SF especially before and after Giants games! It has a great patio and bar to hang out it or a large dining room if you want regular seating. 

Their ahi tuna tartare is SCRUMPTIOUS! I don't know what is in the sauce but I consider myself an expert in ahi tuna tartares and this is one of the best I've had. 

And their happy hour is a great deal during the weekdays! I've been coming here for years and hope it stays around for a very long time...
author: LuLu M.

description: This place looks really nice and I'm sure they have some redeeming qualities. The food was good but not outstanding. Our server only managed to make it to our table three times- one time to take our order, a second time to ask if we were ready for the check, and a third time to return the check. They were not busy when we arrived but were busy as we left. Took forever to get seated and for our waiter to show up but suddenly when it was starting to pick up we were swiftly moved out the door. I'm sure they thrive because they are directly across from AT&T park. Other staff seemed engaged in their tables.
author: Marie G.

description:
We chose MoMo's for our yacht club's sail in dinner and I am glad we did. From start to finish, MoMo's was five star. 
Jackie Krill, their Event Coordinator, made organizing a dream. She is friendly, well organized, and thoughtful. 
Their menu gave us plenty of choices and every member had high praise for the food. Our servers were great! They were quick, good humored, and professional.
The evening was a complete success.
I recommend MoMo's to anyone looking for great food and great service in San Francisco.
author: Chuck H.

description: Fun vibe before the game, and good bloody marys. However, the food itself is pretty awful, especially for the high prices. Do not recommend the restaurant.
author: Natasha F.

description:
Good location across from the ball park and you can drink and chill there too. I went here for a dinner a while ago and it met my expectations. I didnt figure it to be casual because the inside is nice.

Ill come back here again if I can find parking. Thanks to whoever gave me the giftcard 5 years ago...
author: Tim M.

description:
Mediocre at best.  We went here last weekend before seeing Cirque du Soleil  We chose it for its location and because in all the times we've gone to Giants games, my teenage kids have been curious about it.  

$160 later (and only one of us had a drink), it proved to be a huge waste of money and we'll never go back.

From the moment we walked in and were coolly greeted by a man up front, I knew we'd made a mistake. The guy seemed incredibly arrogant and motioned to the woman beside him to seat us at what turned about to be the dining room's crummiest table despite the fact that more a half dozen tables sat empty.  

Our server did her best but was clearly under-trained and we never ever encountered anyone who seemed to be management level.  When we needed our server, we practically had to chase her down to get her attention.

It's San Francisco.  There are literally thousands of wonderful options.  Skip Momo's.
author: Connie E.

description: Great location, crappy attitude. Overly impressed with themselves given the mediocre food and poor bar service. Maybe if the bartenders spent less time bitching about tips, they'd give service good enough to tip well on. Avoid.
author: Gary B.

description:
We were walking around AT&T park on opening weekend Sunday afternoon. We didn't have tickets, so we did the next best thing: drinks and brunch at MoMo's! After getting ID'ed by the bouncer, I asked bluntly, "Do you guys have food?" The bouncer said, "We sure do!"

There was absolutely no wait in the outdoor seating area. We were able to grab a perfect seat in front of the flat TV. It was fun hearing the crowd's reactions then watching the results on TV. Thanks to the 8 second air delay, I was able to predict every play. Lovie was impressed the first 5 times, but then he caught on ;-)

I had the crab and lobster sandwich with fries and Lovie ordered the lamb meatballs. I was kind of disappointed to see that my sandwich was open faced, but the filling was pretty satisfying. Lovie loved the lamb meatballs, but I found them to be forgettable.

The service was spot on considering it was a game day. We had our bud lights refilled when needed. And right when we were leaving, our waiter brought us out bud lights "on the house!" Whoa there. We they trying to get us to stay longer? I think so. But no worries Momo's, we'll be back again!
author: Grace L.

description: We went before Cirque du Soleil, and it was just what we needed.  Food was yummy and the service was good too.
author: Denise M.

description: Went here spontaneously with the friends while out in the city. Foods a little overpriced, but good. I didn't get our servers name, but I should've, considering she was a total b****. Our bill was $100, and being teens left a $6 tip. As we were walking out she had the nerve to stop us and ask if there was a problem with the service because we only tipped her $6. Are you serious? The whole time we were there she didn't even check on us once, the chef cleaned our table so if anything I should have tipped him instead. I suggest you fire that server. Her personality isn't good for the business anyways.
author: Vanessa A.

description: This is a fun place to dine. It is a very relaxing atmosphere. It did not feel stuffy to me. Great service and a friendly staff. Food was good. I had the steak and it was very and flavorful and I would get it again.
author: Alex C.

description: Ugh! 'Out of EGGS' at brunch!. Server stated...before you get too excited...we're out of eggs Benedict, scramble, rancheros, French toast, etc. then came back to let us know they were out of CHICKEN! WTF We were sympathetic for the server until the whatever attitude started. $8 for the worst Mimosa ever! Cold coffee, asked 3 times for iced tea refill, underdressed salad. Seriously, for a supposed SF Dining place that can handle a crowd...Momo's fell well short, actually flat on their face today. Oh, and thanks for adding that 18% Gratuity for 'service'. We were laughing, what a joke!
author: Bill C.

description: Fun place to get a drink before the game. I had an issue with my service on one visit and the staff went above and beyond to make up for it. I would recommend this place for brunch of drinks before a giants game!
author: Rhonda J.

description:
I have never seen it so empty/dead here.. but with baseball season over, my Friday night dinner was low-key and -...quiet...-  I'm always intimidated by the crazy crowds that migrate here after games so.. I was expecting it to be sport-sy and casual inside but... it was actually pretty fancy.  

- Soft bread to munch on and SOFT BUTTER.  THANK YOU...
- Pepperoni pizza on thin crust with stringy cheese was really tasty.  Plenty to share (we had leftovers)
- Mushroom and ricotta ravioli was pretty good ~ Ravioli squares were stuffed to the max with yummy filling and the chunky pomodoro sauce gave it really nice flavor and texture.  
- Blue moon's on tap :)  cheers.

Kinda pricy but a nice treat.

I'd like to be back for drinks on a game night.
author: Kat C.

description: Their brunch is sooo good. The eggs Benedict is the best I've ever had. The fruit is okay, but they have lox bagels and the mac n cheese is delish! I added bacon to the mac n cheese, it made a great lunch. It was hot that day so we all ate outside. The sun was beamin on me real bad that I was sweating, I couldn't even focus on how good my food was. So I asked the waitor to move the umbrella over me so the sun wouldn't be all up in my face....he moved the earth and moon to accommodate me so I was comfortable! Great customer service. 10 stArs for customer service, 5 stars for food. Of course since it was a brunch buffet I ate til my stomach was stretched; I always do that, my eyes are bigger than my stomach. Then I end up wasting food cause im a glutton, then I feel like crap cause I start thinking about all the hungry, poor people in the world then that encourages me to shove the food in my mouth, then that makes me feel nauseous...etc..Ugh! Its a mess, I should really stop doing that.  My tummy ends up looking like a pop belly, then im spending the whole day walkin with my purse infront of me so people can't see my gross tummy. Anyways, I left Momo's extremely full and uncomfortable the rest of the day but well worth it.
author: Michelle G.

description:
I'll be honest:  most things about this place are awful.  The food is extremely overpriced and just not very good at all.  Most of the drinks feel like a rip-off (high prices / weak pours on liquor).  The clientele leaves... a lot to be desired.  Yuppie happy hour / early evening crowd, except on game nights, when it's packed with all sorts.  Too packed to put up with this place, really. 

BUT, on that rare warm, clear SF day, when there is not an overwhelming Giants crowd, and the men in suits haven't yet taken over the place... and you have the patio mostly to yourself.  Well, those are the afternoons when I'll brave MoMo's. :)
author: Heidi M.

description: We waited ages in a dining area that was less than 50% capacity.  Couldn't even get acknowledgement when we finally got a server she just said "I'm not your server, I'm off work but I'll help her" as it turns out she served our party of 5 including 2 small kids and never once identified herself.  The food is mediocre, nothing bad about it but nothing good about it.  The calamari was terrible.  It was in fact crunchy but had zero flavour in the calamari or the batter.  I wouldn't go back.
author: Lin C.

description:
MoMo's is all about location. Perfect for baseball games. For dining, it passes barely. 
I came here for brunch on a nice SF day. The weather outside was nice and they let dogs hang there so it was good to chill on the patio. Looked through the menu which was pretty basic with the usual items like eggs, french toast, burgers, etc. I went for the eggs benedict with hash brown. I think it has to be hard to screw up an eggs benedict besides overcooking the egg. This was really close to that. Also, having puddles of the egg boiling water on the plate is not appetizing. Potatoes were also a little dull and not crisp. Service was excellent which made the experience better.
author: Ed L.

description: We stopped in hoping to get a table before the game. Even though we didn't have a reservation they fit us in if we took no longer than an hour which was absolutely perfect. Two bloody mary 's, Eggs Benedict (a little under done ) & Mexican scramble with Fruit sides. Quick service and very friendly!! $60 for two of us. Even one free bloody since there was an "extra" the waitress offered she accidentally had ordered from another table. Their loss my gain!
author: Anjanette S.

description:
This is a review for the bar only:

We went to happy hour here before seeing Totem.  The food came out fast and hot and everything was great.  Even better were the bartenders! They were really funny and interactive, goofing (while still being professional) around with the staff and patrons all while making perfect drinks.  

Food:
Mac n' cheese- great flavor, although I wish it was a little more gooey.  The pieces of ham mixed in were the perfect compliment to the dish.  And the noodles were long and curly, adding a whimsical feel to the dish.  It was just plain fun to eat.

Pepperoni Pizza- bigger than we thought it would be.  It was also amazing. I love thin-crust pizzas and this one did not disappoint.  Plus, afterward I got to dip my crust in the mac's cheese sauce. Legendary!

Pulled Pork Sliders- pretty good. The meat was moist and delish. 

I will definitely be back!
author: Jordan F.

description: Doesn't matter what I write, this place will always mint money due to the location. But I had the burger and it was one of the blandest burgers I've ever had. It's puzzling because it was greasy, juicy, artery clogging, but UNtasty all at the same time!  How can that be? Someone double check me on this.
author: John H.

description:
We love this place and go frequently for the happy hour drinks and appetizers. We went after a game this time so the bar was packed, instead we ate in the dining room for the first time.

We just the caesar salad (which is one of our favorites in the area because they use real anchovies on them) and a margherita flatbread, which is plenty for two people. 

However, this time we also tried an appetizer that we hadn't had before: the 'grilled and chilled artichoke'. Unfortunately, it was a bust. We couldn't figure out how to eat it and after the server told us, we realized there was actually very little food, if you were able to actually dig it out. (The sauce to dip the artichoke in was fantastic though.) The server said that she actually had a lot of patrons have the same complaint about the dish and got us a different appetizer and comped the artichoke: no questions asked. The other appetizer we got was the onion strings. I love fried onions, but these were so fine, it was like there was no onion and it was all fried batter. Next time, I will just stick to the caeser and flatbread like usual.
author: Alycia N.

description: This review is based on two visits a few days apart. The first visit had us in the dining room. We had great service right after a Giants game. The food was great and my out of town guest was impressed. Second visit,  a group of us came and started in the bar and then moved out to the patio. My only complaint was that we ordered a burger at the bar and asked to sub mashed potatoes for fries. When the burger came, there were no potatoes of any kind and we were told that mashed were not available and the bartender who took the order was off work. The new bartender redeemed the situation by quickly getting us a huge portion of fries. It wasn't exactly what we'd hoped for but one rule of customer service is that a quick imperfect solution is better than a perfect slow one. If you combine the food, interesting wine list, great patio and outstanding location, you get five stars. Yes, it's expensive but across the street from the finest ballpark in America is not a great place to bargain shop.
author: Brian B.

description: This place was pretty good. I came here to meet my parents for lunch before a Giants game, which I think might have resulted in the slower service. It took a long time for our order to be taken, but once it was the food came out very quickly. I ordered the pulled pork sandwich with sweet potato fries and cole slaw. The sandwich was good, the fries yummy, but the cole slaw was nothing special. I did also get the strawberry basil lemonade, which was great. Overall pretty good, but I wouldn't say I would go out of my way to go here from across town. Definitely a good place eating if you are going to a Giants game though.
author: Emma W.

description: Had fun drinking here on Australia Day.  The bartenders were quick and put up with us with a good attitude.
author: David P.

description: Worst drinks ever and I mean ever! Skyrocket prices for a Don Julio Silver margarita's which tasted like sauerkraut? This place used to be ok for brew and an occasional cocktails but bad service, bad prices, and bad drinks... No Thanks. Never going back again.
author: Michael C.

description: Came here Sunday for Australia Day Celebration with lots of other Aussies and my Husband who's from Australia. Place was not busy when we arrived at 1pm. We did valet parking which was $13. You can not beat that in SF. Our Aussie Celebration took over the bar and patio with around 80-100 Aussies and others. The whole restaurant was very clean. The beer on tap was awesome! Fresh and cold served in mason jars. Hit the spot on a beautiful day in SF. Now as for the food. All our dishes were VERY yummy and cooked perfectly. We had the Calamari ($18), pork potstickers ($12), and a Cheeseburger ($24) with a salad. Our only complaint is that the food is extremely overpriced. Obviously they can get away with it because of the awesome location across from ATT park. Staff was friendly and helpful. Not sure we would return if we did not have an event to attend there due to cost. Rather go get steak or seafood for the amount we paid somewhere else. This place is kid friendly.
author: Christina M.

description: We grabbed an early dinner here after a Giants game and really enjoyed the food. The outside patio was quite crowded with quite a few rowdy, intoxicated fans, so we opted to go eat at the restaurant area, which had a surprising number of open tables considering the game had just finished. We shared the vegetarian pesto pizza, the fried calamari, and the fresh corn salad. Next time we're at AT&T Park, we'll probably end up at MoMo's again.
author: Nikki K.

description:
ok, these folks get an A for effort.  went here for a work lunch. they had ZERO (and I mean ZERO) vegan options, even the veggie choices were lacking.  the chef came out & talked to me, put together a pesto pasta w/ veggies & chickpeas.  it was a set menu for a group of 30ish, so I really appreciate the extra attention.  the office brought in cakes that were not vegan, MoMo's was kind enough to bust out some sorbet so I would not be a Sad Sally while everyone else enjoyed dessert.  food was just OK, but service was great.  

Thx for the vegan love, MoMo's!

PS- all the omnis loved their stuff.
author: Virginia D.

description:
We came here while the Giants game was on to have a little dinner and hear all the cheering. 

We tried out the oysters, tuna tartare, ceviche and mac n cheese. These were all pretty decent. The prices weren't too bad considered they're in the city and they can price it any way they would like.  Portions weren't too crazy big for the prices either. 

Service was pretty good, we got everything in a timely manner.
author: Annie D.

description: I had an event in one of the private rooms for my Alumnae Association. Caitlyn was very helpful in planning it as I was doing so from New Jersey. The day of the event, everything ran smoothly. All the guest enjoyed the venue and the food. There was more than enough food and drink for the attendees. Would definitely work with them again.
author: Candace R.

description: Luckily we went when there was no Giants game. It was quiet and very relaxing. The Crispy Calamari was really good. My mimosa was good. For the price, I wouldn't go back. Glad I tried though. Service was just ok.
author: Julie K.

description: This is my favorite place to grab brunch before heading into AT&T park to watch a game. You can't go wrong with their huevos rancheros, mimos or bloody marys. Sitting out on the patio on a warm day in the sun prior to game time is awesome, but these tables are really hard to come by.
author: K L.

description:
Pro:
Across from AT&T Giants ball park
Fast Service
Staff is very nice
French Onion Soup
Wedge Salad - although a bit skimpy on the bacon and tomatoes.

Con:
Ceasar Salad sucked. Its the kind of salad where they give you the heart of the lettuce that has no color what so ever. So unappealing, they need to stop that trend. It is uncut, sorry, I don't find uncut lettuce ooolala. It is just lazy. Leaves on a plate some cheese sprinkled. I asked for the dressing on the side, which they did, but its not the best dressing I had. I also asked if they could add chicken. It was obviously chicken that had been processed and bagged somewhere else. It certainly wasn't grilled chicken. And they charged me an extra $3 for this crappy grey chicken. It tasted fine, but so unappealing to the eyes.

My friend had the burger, which he said had no seasoning what so ever and was pretty bland.

Since my salad was so lack luster we also ordered the toasted bread with tomato, mozzarella cheese, tomatoes. They were kind of sparse on the balsamic vinegar and it was a bit watery. Very little basil.

The best part was (sarcasm here) was that for two soups, two salads, a burger and some bread and cheese....it was $88! I could have had a better meal going to Safeway two blocks down the street and getting a sandwich for $6-7 and been more satisfied. 

It wouldn't take much to elevate this restaurant into a good eating establishment if they broadened the menu a bit and used a bit higher quality of ingredients. Trust me they are rolling in dough at the bar, so they could afford to make better food it they so desired. 

Caution about outdoor seating. Smokers like to linger on the sidewalk and people with cigars like to walk by...Blech.

I will not be eating here again. Ball park food seemed more interesting then this place.
author: W. C.

description: My first review of Pete Osborne's empire across the street from the yard (Momos, Petes and Pedros)....and a swing and a miss...strike 1.  I figured the food would be expensive but good and I batted .500 on that one, unfortunately not in the correct combination.  Fried calamari for $18...never again.  $15 for a poor excuse for tiny pizza inspiring a world of blah....and $24 for crab cakes.  Guess when you have a monopoly going on King Street, price gouging and poor food quality are the norm.  Steer clear if you're looking for anything other than an expensive beer enjoyed in the company of fake people.
author: Mike Z.

description: Fun bar right across from the ballpark. Beers are only $6 compared to $10+ inside. They also have multiple TV's with the game on. I was there the other day and met the most awesome employee. He gave me a ticket to the game that he had been given (but he was working, so couldn't go). Totally made my day! I will definitely come back! :)
author: Katherine W.

description:
came here for the all you can eat weekend brunch. it was really good. they had scramble eggs, jambalaya, fruit, toast/pancakes, salmon, and a bunch of other things. and drinks included. 

i'd come back for a relaxing weekend brunch..and try to not stuff myself again..
author: Janet Y.

description:
Friends and I came here during the off-season, and I think that made a big difference between my experience and those who've rated this place lower. 

Spacious and welcoming, it was the perfect brunch meet-up spot for a group of us spread throughout Northern California. It's close to Muni and Caltrain, for those inclined to take transit, and street parking was a snap on a Sunday mid-day. 

The menu is straightforward, and the food quality was excellent. We were never in need of anything, as servers tended to our drink refills without our having to ask.
author: Becky J.

description:
Another OK place near AT&T park, a little more upscale with the valet parking- since I usually got to Pete's Tavern. But the menu is surprisingly, average. The drinks, however, are grrreat! Add the lovely outdoor seating to the drinks and it's even better.

Calamari for appetizers- usually can't ever go wrong with this. Pizza is alright, but I'd rather go down the street to Amici's for that. They have other average dishes; burgers, short-ribs, salmon, meatloaf and pasta and a special 3-course menu that I might look into one day. 

If here before or after a game, I highly recommend coming here for the drinks!!!
author: S Y.

description:
I totally deconstructed a mammoth cheeseburger before a Giants game at MoMo's. My only gripe: I couldn't get grilled onions because it wasn't time efficient for the kitchen staff to accommodate special orders on game days. Really? 

Attractive, young professional men were milling about on my initial visit. I must withhold stars until I see if said attractive, young professional men actually interact with an exceptionally attractive, young professional woman.  MoMo's makes a killer Manhattan that could help with that.
author: Camille K.

description:
A Radio Head song would describe MoMo's perfectly - "No alarms and no surprises".  We came in for a quick business lunch.  The buffalo chicken sandwich was good - but bundled with french fries.  That makes the grill tuna sandwich - paired with a light, pleasant buckwheat noodle salad - a more guilt-free choice.  Not to mention more unexpected and unusual!

Yet still, "no alarms and no surprises".
author: Kristen S.

description: Ok so my family and I are from out of town and wanted to have a fun/good brunch. The bottomless mimosas got our attention! The brunch food was just ok and probably would have been less than ok if it weren't for the three pitchers of mimosa we had. The service was horrible, my mother asked for bread to three different people and came 25-30 minutes after she asked for it. Along with not getting the table some water or refilling any of it. Just OK.
author: Leah W.

description: This is the go to spot before giants games...great outdoor patio area & usually about 6 bartenders on so getting a drink even though packed isn't to hard..has pretty good food also...
author: Mike L.

description: Came here for brunch and had a wonderful time! Lizbeth and Laura totally took care of my group of 5 for a wonderful Saturday afternoon! Love brunch here!!! Everyone should come!
author: Erin T.

description:
Nice area because its by the Ballpark and by the Bay, the best experienced I had in Momo's was the customer service. I have been there couple of times and both of dining experienced was Great!

The skirt steak that I ordered was juicy and tasteful. Appetizer.....is a plus! Wines are good and the best part was, we got a complimentary desert! How good could that be!

The reason why I gave them a 4, its because their menu is pricey. Other than that everything was Great!
author: NORILY F.

description:
Momo's is a very fun place to go pre or post Giants game at Willie Mays Plaza.  It is right across the street from the LF entrance to the park and GOES OFF before game time.

The food is pretty good, a little pricey - but it provides a great place to eat for the same price as crappy ballpark food.  The "buzz" of the crowd is better than the food itself - but I still do go regularly before Gigante games.
author: Joel V.

description:
It's possible that I was here on an "off" day, or at an awkward time... because I sure felt awkward. 

First, there was no hostess when we walked in. We stood around like uninvited guests at a party for people that were too cool to acknowledge us -- the bartender clearly saw us standing there, and was well within earshot, but just ignored us. I finally had to walk directly up to the bar to ask if there was a hostess. A minute later, the hostess finally showed up. We asked to be seated outside, and we were seated on the patio to the left of the entrance (from streetview). 

Our waiter came out, saw us, and a storm cloud crossed his expression. He looked PISSED that he had yet another table to wait on. He came over, brusquely asked what we wanted to drink, then huffed off to get it. We also observed him talking to the hostess in what appeared to be a mean way, admonishing her for seating us in his section. I think that his shift was about to end, and she'd seated us there anyways. Judging by the extreme shortness of her skirt, and sheerness of her top, she seemed more worried about how much skin she could get away with exposing, rather than paying attention to trivial things like "work." I thought this was a family establishment outside the ballpark? Whatever.

Moving on. Someone other than our waiter brought our drinks out. He appeared to be a manager or something, because he was in something more like a suit. He told us the specials, because our waiter sure hadn't. At that point, my boyfriend and I had settled upon the "app + steak dinner + dessert" deal. We both had a wedge salad, which was pretty good. It was served to us by yet another person -- a blonde, female waitress. After that, our steak dinners came, and were served by the manager guy. I'd have to say that the steaks were 1/3 fat, 2/3 meat, so that was kinda disappointing. The meaty parts of the steak were really good, and cooked exactly as I requested -- medium rare! And the sides were awesome -- snap peas and cheese potatoes. 

Once we were done, we had to wait a while for someone to come clear out plates. Then, we had to ask to see the dessert menus. The blonde waitress was back at this point. We ordered the molten chocolate cake and banana bread pudding (I think?). They were both phenomenal. Best parts of the meal! I don't even remember who cleared those plates or brought the check. Drink refills were hard to come by, as well, due to the fact that we had so many people trading off the responsibility of waiting on us.

We were clearly just a burden on the establishment at that point, and as we watched various waiters starting/ending shifts and flirting with the hostess,and we observed the fact that no one else was seated in our section, it became clear that we probably would have had a much better experience if the hostess had been paying attention and we had been seated in the proper area.

Overall, I think I'd give Momo's another chance because the food really was pretty decent, and the prices were not at all bad. Hopefully, though, we'll just have one server!
author: Natahley B.

description:
Colby beef burger.  That's all.

Let me try to iterate in words my friends reaction when he tried this burger:
Mmm, wow, mmm, this, mmm burger, mmm, wow, is , mmm, wow, what a ,mmm,great, mmm, burger.

There is no reason to eat anything else here. The burger is one of the best in the bay. It possesses a great grilled flavor, is juicy without being greasy and is of adequate size.  The way they thinly slice the pickles and onions is a nice touch and the fries are excellent.  The seared tuna sandwich was a disappoint:  thin and fairly tasteless ( try Gott's if you are in the mood for a seared tuna sandwich), though the ahi tartare is decent.
. 
The service here seems to be good and the location is nice being across from at&t park; making it a fun game day destination.  The bar is a good size and the overall atmosphere is nice.  

Overall it is a nice place to grab a burger and a drink especially on a nice game day. The prices are fairly high with the burger being seventeen dollars, but  If you get a chance it's worth the price in my opinion.
author: Fish E.

description:
I like coming to MoMo's.  Well, correction, I like being treated out to MoMo's.  I'd never be able to afford it on my own :P

Nearly everyone in my party (myself included) get "THE CITY'S JUICIEST 3-COURSE NY STEAK DINNER" which comes with Soup de Jour or Iceberg Wedge Salad, New York Prime Steak w/side, and a dessert for $29.  The waitress was nice enough to switch out the salad for a Caesar though I must admit it was uneventful.

The steak was good AND juicy.. I ordered medium and it came very medium rare.  I didn't complain though because it was perfect when I reheated it the next day.

All in all a bit pricey for casual dining but I love going when I'm not paying (:
author: Kimiko Q.

description:
I came here for a co-worker's going away lunch with a group of about 15. Never having been here before, I was surprised that the restaurant was fancier inside than I thought. I assumed that since it was across from the ballpark, Momo's would be closer to a sports bar/after-the-game hangout spot rather than an upscale, cloth napkin restaurant.

Knowing that I had to return to work and be productive, I skipped the melts, burgers, and pizzas and went light with a salad. I was please to get the waiter's approval with his immediate response of "great choice."

It was a great choice indeed. How could butter lettuce with chicken, candied walnuts and cranberries be anything less than a perfect combination? And the dijon mustard vinaigrette was just creamy and tangy enough to bring more excitement to a seemingly plain salad.  

Since it is near the ballpark, you can expect to see high prices on the menu. And crappy parking, even on a non-Giants', weekday lunch.
author: Kimberly S.

description:
OK, this is the place to go after a Giants game but bring your Platinum card if you go with your buddies.  You can spend some Major League bucks here for drinks. So we just watched the Giants get smoked by almost 6 runs and told the boys I'll buy if we leave early.

First we were going to drink Mojitos but one bartender said "No, not that good" . So it look likes some Ketel Vodka drinks. Remember, we left the left the game early. So we were able to get a seats at the bar. Good thing because this place gets packed to the gills.

Gentleman be on the alert because this place is Cougar country with a capital "C". My buddies and I watch this one young lad get swept off his feet by this one agressive Cougar. Yowsa.

They have a nice outdoor patio but they close early on the weekdays 11:30 pm. Quite a bit early.

Cheers....
author: Jim D.

description:
Went here on a non-game day for a Sunday lunch.

Pretty much as expected.  Totally generic menu... nice staff... slightly high pricing for stock items like a french dip sandwich and apps like fried onion strips and calamari... as to be expected given its proximity to the ballpark.

Service was attentive and polite. Decor equally non-committal.  Food was filling and unremarkable.  

Worthy of 3 stars for being so very precisely a middle-of-the-road establishment on a day when they didn't have to deal with ballpark crowds.  Really, nothing good or bad to report... equal value for money.  Nothing more, nothing less.
author: Mark B.

description: I love this place - always have. Great apps, great wine, great bartenders, great location!
author: Tina N.

description:
Not my type of place. Loud and sporty. Right next to ATT park. I don't really want to go back there.

Drinks weren't good either and the location is spacious so it's not warm or friendly...

not a good place for dates! seriously :)
author: T I.

description: The manager Nick took care of our 12 man table in stride on short notice. Had a long day and the guys needed a good meal. Hands down the best burgers and calamari in town. Next company dinner will be here for many years to come. Thanks again to everyone at this professional and top notch restaurant.
author: Big Leprechaun Moving A.

description:
Reasonable place for a business lunch around Mission Bay

We took two business guests there--there was nothing nice within walking distance of Mission Bay, and both were impressed with the food and service.  The first time around, we had slightly less than an hour to eat and the other was more leisurely, but still had time constraint.

This was the third time I went there--once I was taken out, and the service was not as attentive as the last 2 times--it was at the peak of lunch hour.  Will definitely take business lunches there again!
author: Aggie A.

description:
There are many things I love about my other half J.  Because he introduces me to all the "gay" places in the Castro, he tells me to bring him to the "straight" places in SOMA, which is where we live.  Basically, he's totally down to "party with the heteros" as long as I "party with the homos."  So a few weeks ago, I introduced him to District, and he loved it.

This time, we were meeting up for a lunch interview; he's applying to be a volunteer for the mentoring program that I run (shameless plug, btw - if you're interested, let me know :D ), and so I had a few questions to ask him and go over some paperwork.  We decided to meet at MoMo's.

Since J was trying to look his best for Pride, he opted for a turkey sandwich sans cranberries, and I decided that I didn't care about my figure enough for Pride, so I went for the Mac 'n Cheese.

The mac 'n cheese was okay.  It didn't taste like the boxed kind, so +1.  It also had ham interspersed between the spiral pasta.  +1.  However, it had a taste that I couldn't really place.  It wasn't exactly super smoky, and it didn't taste traditional either.  I think I prefer Q's mac 'n cheese, but this wasn't exactly bad.  Since J didn't like his sandwich or chips that came with it (they were like the criss-cut kettle chips, but they tasted like oil with an aftertaste of fried potatoes), he snagged some of my dish and really enjoyed it.

I'm hesitant to come back, but from reading other reviews, it's a good place to eat brunch and grab a drink before the Giants' games, although realistically I'd HATE to be in such a crowded boisterous restaurant.
author: Tori S.

description: This bar is literally right across the street from the stadium. We came here before a day game and sat outside on the porch area. It is good people watching and the burgers are legit. Prices are reasonable and they have pretty solid Bloody Mary's. Next time I am in town for a game I will absolutely be going to MoMo's for a pregame burger and beverage.
author: Ed M.

description:
4 stars for a yummy HUMM BABY SHOT!

Havent tried anything else, but the lil shot alone is enough to make me come here...but gets a litle hectic when theres a game.

and for those that look younger than 21 you have to wear a wristband =[ lame LOL
author: Christine M.

description: This place is not good. The calamari was overdone and bland. The potstickers were terrible - I didn't know bad potstickers were even possible. We stopped at the apps for fear the bad experience would only continue. The only reason it gets 2 stars is that the service was good.
author: Jessica N.

description:
What a perfect way to start a perfect weekend day in sunny California....  Great weather, nice outdoor seating overlooking the bay and AT&T park, delcious food, awesome company, and impressive service.  They even brought water for my dog in a makeshift doggie bowl.  How cute is that?!

The bruschetta was perfect.  Nicely toasted on a sourdough bread with Mozzarella di Bufala, Prosciutto, Eggplant, Caponata & Pesto.  The french onion soup with three cheese decadence was tasty...  And the special of the day, the Momo baked salmon eggs benedict.  Wow, a delightful and impressive culinary experience.

Absolutely perfect brunch for a perfect sunny day.
author: Danny L.

description:
We usually go here before a Giants game and it is what you expect.  For a hang out in the summer, it has a diverse menu and the portions are huge.

Atmosphere is nice and service is usually pretty good.  In all the times we've been here, we've not had a bad experience.
author: Free B.

description:
I've been here before the games and it's never been really crowded on those weekends. 

It's a little pricey though.

$14 for appetizer sliders

$13 for sourdough french toast with maple syrup 

$12 martinis

$25 valet parking

But the view is awesome! And sitting in the sun is second to none right before a Giants game. The servers and bussers are always on top of the refills, taking away plates, and checking in on just the right moments. 

There could be something much left to be desired with the front desk staff and their tunnel vision but at least the food is okay.
author: Jessica K.

description:
We went to MoMo's before going to a Giants game. Its definitely packed during the ball games and its gotta a great location. We had various assortments of appetizers and drinks. The food was ok but it's nothing to rave about. The taste was just like any other sports bar and grill type of place....It really did not stand out.

The service was ok, the waitress kept insisting to have more drinks. At this point we've already had two shots and a few beers. ...and still had a game to attend to.

Like one of the Yelper's mentioned ...it was a bit over priced ...

Many other spots to hit up in the area. Sorry MoMo's...

Thanks,
-NP
author: Np N.

description:
I have been to Momo's before going to the Giants game a few times.  I cant really say too much about the food- its alright but absolutely nothing special.  
i give this place 3 stars for the location.  during the games and right before the games, this place is packed with fans... and its a great place to grab a little drink and people watch.
author: Katelyn M.

description: We had a fantastic experience here. Seriously-why have I avoided this place. Best place to eat a great meal before a Giants game. We had a 6 pm reservation and they seated us 20 minutes early. I was already happy with them adjusting their schedule because we showed up early. Then we sat down at a table next to a large group that was really loud. We tried to sit there for a while and I realized oh my god it's so loud we had to yell at each other across the table. The waitstaff moved us to a quieter table in the corner. I can't tell you how much it meant that that our waitress was so accommodating of our request to move to a quieter location. Then we proceeded to order and I have a family member with a severe food allergy. The waitress had the manager come out and the manager spoke to directly to our family member with the food allergy and confirmed what she could and could not eat. The manager brought the food items directly to our family member with the food allergy and checked with her after she ate her meal. I cannot recommend this place even more. On top of all that good service the food was delicious.  We had the tuna tartare appetizer and hamburger. An incredible job well done. We'll be back.
author: A F.

description:
Here's just a little hint: you aren't going to find value at an airport restaurant, and you aren't going to be happy going to a restaurant that is directly across from a ballpark.

Idiots will show up here before every game whether the food is good or bad, no matter what the prices are, and they know that.  So the food has become barely edible and over priced.  And they are just as packed as when it wasn't.  So go elsewhere if you even remotely care.

All the restaurants in the area are basically the same, and so you need to go at least a few blocks away to get anything decent.  I suspect most people will only check Yelp after their bad experience, and honestly, you have no one to blame but yourself, it's basically a tourist trap.

What this place provides is sort of a carnival atmosphere before and after the games.  It's basically a Hooters crowd, drunker and rowdier.  If that's what you are looking for, you'll find it.  But if you think you're going t get decent food, you're nuts.  All the money you are paying is for the carnival atmosphere.  The food is merely incidental to the experience.  

And they do an excellent job of providing that experience to people too lazy and stupid to walk more than 6 inches from the ballpark.  5 stars for the experience,  0 stars for the food, 2.5 net stars, which I rounded down.
author: Charles G.

description:
Awesome spot to watch the Diamondbacks win!

The french onion soup is awesome.  

Service is nice too
author: Brooks S.

description:
Decent food with a great atmosphere. Get a pizza and split it. Try the macaroni, it's delicious.
