Right by AT&T park near pier 1 and Embarcadero. Cabs are abundant and service was on par.
author: Nick P.

description: The first time i went to momo's i had a great time . The food is so great their i was speechless because i truly love great food . The best restaurant hands down that you need to go here so stop what your doing and come taste this great food and come see the great staff.  This place here is the real deal so come check it out its very worth it.
author: Bryson F.

description:
Momo's is a good place before the ball game (if you're early enough or secure a reservation) for American fare.

We've been here a couple of times and have enjoywed their baby back ribs and shared a crab and shrimp combo (Momo's Louis).  Their menu is a bit pricey, but at least you'll get good quality of food and flavor better than what you can eat at the ball park.
author: JJAMZ C.

description:
Experience 1:
5 stars. Dinner with the family and my ex.

Good food, perhaps a little bland. I had the seafood risotto. If i remember what i had here up to 1 year ago, it means it was notable. Cheese and delicious. Could have used some garlic. Service, A+ fine dining experience.

Experience 2:
5 stars. 12 friends. Post Giants game.

Bar was packed but who cares, everyone clientele and bar tenders were nice. They have an outside patio which is where this place shines on a brilliant day like last saturday. I really can't say too much except for the fact that i wasn't overly hammered, but i still had a great time with great people here.
author: Peter T.

description: The service was great. Didn't wait long for seating and the food came out pretty quick. They also have happy hour! First time here and I will most likely come back again.
author: Steven T.

description:
I work next to Momo's.

One word: Buffalo chicken sandwich.

I have no idea who goes to this restaurant. There are always older 'pearl necklace' ladies and I'm like, "Why are you coming here, older ladies?"

It just baffles me. This restaurant is overpriced and not awesome. It's not terrible but who needs to spend $200 for lunch? (I mean, I did with my friends and coworkers on more than one occasion. Why did we do that??) During ball games it's a fucking shitshow. I've seen more than one guy pulled out on a stretcher into a paramedic truck.

So besides the fact that it's like the forces of light vs. the forces of dark depending on the day and if there's a game, it's tasty and probably really bad for you.
author: Klevin D.

description: My friends and I were looking for a place close by to grab some drinks and nibbles.  We decided to try Momo's are were not disappointed! I asked the bartender Gil for a wine recommendation and he suggested a delicious red that I am absolutely hooked on. We also ordered an assortment or appetizers including their tasty steak skewers which I highly recommend. We also appreciated how attentive the bar manager was, who checked in with us and made sure we were satisfied with everything. The service during my bar visit was superb with friendly and accommodating staff who went out of their way to make sure we were happy.  The combination of quality food and outstanding service makes Momo's my new favorite spot that I can count on for an all around excellent experience.
author: Jen L.

description:
This is an ok restaurant.  The interior is very nice and the service is friendly and very attentive(even the bus boys watch your drink and ask you if you want refills).

I was there for an early lunch and chose the seafood cioppino.  The dish was a bit more on the expensive side ($24) but decent.  The seafood was cooked perfectly and the broth was nice.  Had the perfect amount of kick.

This would be an excellent location for a business meeting (though a bit pricey) or a date (I would come here for an anniversary).  I don't think it is good for the 'lone traveler' looking for a meal.  For that, you may want to try another spot.
author: Ted H.

description: Came in early to the bar before the game to beat the crowd.  Not very crowded.  Bar staff never even looked at us.  After 20 minutes busboy finally asked and took order .  Took bartender another 15 minutes to fill and delivered with snarl.  Terrible service.  Will never come back and will tell others not to go also.
author: Mark S.

description:
Happy hour on Thursdays, 5-7pm is Ladies Night. This means 2 dollar martinis. Yes, ladies, 2 DOLLARS!!! On other nights, martini's during happy hour is still a good price ($4). Since you have to order at the bar, when it gets busy, it's hard getting the attention of the two bartenders to order more drinks and food.

I thought the food was great, or maybe the alcohol thought the food was great. We ordered the garlic cheese fries ($4), as well as their sausage/bell peppers and BBQ chicken flat bread pizza ($8 each). I'll definitely be coming back on Thursdays for Happy Hour.
author: Feuy S.

description:
Always a pleasure to hit Momo's before or during a game (if I ain't got tickets).  This place is packed before games as Giant's fans get their drank on!!  Nice place with TV's and alcohol and great location...YES!  Food wise...nothing to rave about. Pizza was burnt and fries tasted like the fries I make at home with my deep fryer.  

3-Stars for location, full bar, and good times with friends...always.  Go Giants!!
author: Patrick C.

description: Zack was a wonderful bartender today. We stopped by after the Giants game and Gay Pride parade for drinks and dinner.  He continued to check on us to see if we needed  anything prior to closing.  Also he is very cute!
author: Bev L.

description:
My girlfriend and I recently visited Momo's during our anniversary and had a great time.

Cocktails: I had the 209 Gin, dry vermouth and apricot liqueur and she had a cocktail with bourbon, amaro and bitters. Both were delicious.

The bruschetta was both visually impressive and the burrata and heirloom tomatoes perfect.

The Mussels and frites were excellent. Really enjoyed dipping bread into the sauce after the fries and mussels were devoured.

Chef was accommodating to the fact that Jenny was vegetarian and customized the eggplant pizza to our liking.

For our special occasion they provided a platter of apple tart, chocolate soufflé and chocolate chip cookies a la mode for dessert. Decadent and delightful.  We also enjoyed a couple glasses of champagne.  What a treat!

Overall highly recommend this place to friends and anyone looking for a fresh place to eat and drink.
author: Matthew P.

description:
Oh MoMo's.... I've meet many of interesting people here.
It's a pretty cool spot to hangout with friends & enjoy a drink and appetizers.  The ahi tuna tartare is one of my favorites here. 

Going here on a game day can either be good or bad.. depending on if you like huge crowds or not!
author: nicole b.

description: I came here on a monday night game against the Phillies. This is mostly a standing room bar, and it was still packed. Goodluck trying to get a drink here, the lines at the bar were four people deep. I went to the bar stand outside and was able to get a drink. Beers are about $7 and they offer canned beer for a dollar cheaper. Alcoholic beverages are offered here as well, but oly one or two options which are margaritas. I ended coming here because public house was even more packed. You should avoid on home games
author: Phan H.

description: After driving by this place for years I finally met a friend for apps and drinks on a quiet Sunday afternoon. The hostess seemed put out to seat us in the dining room - brunch was nearly done and there were plenty of tables open. The martini (for a place with a martini olive as it's logo) was singularly unremarkable, and a small pour to boot. The only saving grace was the truly nice server we had - think he may have even been a busboy. Two drinks and an app were $50 and soooo not worth it. Too many great places in SF to waste your money here.
author: Mel R.

description: I have walked by 100 or so times on baseball game days. Its always packed and and just seemed like some place you go because the other places nearby are more packed.  So when I went recently I was not expecting much. However I was happy to discover MoMo's is actually pretty good, not great but pretty good. There are a good number of TV's they don't mind changing for you and they have a rather good drink selection.  The food was the best surprise as it was pretty good. This place is not going to become my neighborhood bar, but I will for sure check it out again for a good bite to eat before the game.
author: douglas B.

description:
Was hoping to come here last Sunday to pre-game it but their wait was over an hour, so we hit up O'Neill's instead.

Came back after the game and was able to get some seats at the bar. Nice atmosphere which is conveniently located by AT&T Park. 

I love their outdoor seating! I will definitely come a little earlier next time. I want to try out their food. The drinks here were good, but could have been a little stronger (the long island iced tea I ordered was a little watered down). I'll give them another shot though the next time I go to a game.
author: Veronica L.

description:
Momo's has slipped a notch.

Boom Boom has retired, the game-day menu has been streamlined, and the sevice was not up to par on our most recent visit.

Losing a great maitre'd like Boom Boom certainly hurts, even if they have plenty of friendly, pretty young women working there.  Boom Boom knew everyone's name, and really made you feel welcome.

The streamlined menu idea is a mistake.  The waiter said it was so that they could offer quality food with no delays, but we had never had problems with the quality of the food or timeliness of the service.
Now, many of our favorite dishes are not available prior to baseball games, and that is pretty much the only time we eat at Momo's.

We ordered crispy onion strings, and first we got calamari, which was immediately replaced by soggy onion strings.  Tasty, but definitely lacking the advertised crispiness.  To their credit, they did comp these when we complained.

Drinks were slow in coming from the bar.  The bar was busy, but it was a Sunday morning/afternoon, and wasn't THAT busy.  

The waiter seemed to have a problem with the computer they enter the orders in, because he would be on it for quite some time after each order, and when he brought the bill, it included things we had not ordered.  He straightened it out, comped the onion strings and a drink, and apologized.  Maybe he was new.  There seemed to be several new faces, and new art on the walls, if that matters to anyone.

My burger was cooked perfectly, and very tasty, with a generous helping of bacon.  The wife loved her salad and enjoyed the shrimp.
author: Ramon V.

description:
We just had brunch there on Sunday and the meal and serves was great.  Our waiter was very attentive without being annoying.   Girlfriend had the Shrimp and Crab salad 1/2 portion and I had French onion soup and Pulled pork sliders.  

The French onion soup was great.  The soup had a lot of flavor usually this dish is all about the cheese but here the soup itself could carry it.  

The Crab salad was HUGH me and my g/f couldn't imagine how much bigger a whole could be.  The crab and shrimp were piled nice and high.  She barely finished the seafood part leaving a lot of lettuce behind.

Here is where they lose a star.  The Pulled Pork sliders were great the meat was tender and flavorful the slaw didn't have too much mayo in it, the buns were perfect.  BUT you only get 3 and they charge you $12 dollars.  They are sliders 2 bits maybe 3 max.  Just wasn't worth it comes out to $4 dollars a slide.  I milked them and made each slider last for 4 bits.  I even stopped and had a piece of bread after 2 to slow myself down. They should really think of making it 4.  Also if it was 4 it would be easier to share assuming 2 couples.   

I will add one caveat  the Giants were out of town.  I'm sure if the stadium had been open we might have gotten different service.
author: Kevin C.

description:
One word: OVERRATED.

It was a quiet afternoon and there were about 3-4 other tables in the entire restaurant. We were a table of four, and we spent almost three hours at this place waiting. Waiting waiting waiting. Our server took forever to take our order, and then the food took forever to come out. It's not like the kitchen is so far away. You can SEE the kitchen from where we were sitting.

And get this. When the food came, the pizza had a hair on it. Gross. I expect that type of stuff in some hole-in-a-wall, not some fancy schmancy place that charges an arm and a leg for everything despite its crappy service and average food.

If this place was anywhere else but across from the ballpark or if there were no more yuppies in SF, it would go out of business in a heartbeat. I'll never go here again.
author: Sara K.

description: We came after a giants game and they treated us so rudely. We were seated in the back room where another table was kicked out. We were denied liquor and told they wouldn't serve us more alcohol since we were in the same room as the other group. We talked to them calmly and the still refused to serve us. They also shorted us a pizza and brought us drinks we did not order. They were rude and I will never come here again! BEWARE. They will treat you like you are high schoolers trying to steal alcohol!
author: streeterville c.

description: Uninspired menu. Mass market ingredients. Mechanical service. Massively overpriced.  You will not find a single local here
author: David C.

description: BEST SALMON BENIDICTS EVER! Always a bit crowded but love the Giants comradery ...
author: Megan B.

description: The service here sucks. The bartender was rude and they left out an entree even though we double checked the order with them. The kitchen closed so we ended up super hungry at the end of the night. Nor did they bother checking on us even though we were a huge party sitting outside (some heat lamps would have been nice). The food was only okay. Lousy service. Go elsewhere.
author: Donna W.

description: 32$ steak wasn't that amazing. The lady at the reception was a little rude. I'd give it a 2, but the girl that served us was great, so 3...
author: Dorin C.

description: Friendly staff and convenient location, though I probably wouldn't go again.  I had a hamburger for lunch and the meat was actually a bit gamey.  Not my preferred taste for hamburger.
author: H. H.

description: Good luck getting any service on game day/night.  Drinks are so-so and super roudy bridge & tunnel crowd which is too bad for such prime location.  Pain in the ass to have security at the door but with that crowd, I was glad they were there to throw out trashy people.  Nonetheless, good meeting place before games for out-of-towners.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Joined co-workers for after work dinner and had a pleasant time.  Had the Gumbo and found it very good.  Good meal but a bit over priced.  Probably due to the location.
author: Paul G.

description:
The whole family (8 of us) went to see the Giants win against the Padres 8-1!!!  Yeah!!
I made reservations at MoMo's and we had a table ready for us and received ice water, bread, butter right away.  Our server, Rachel, couldn't have been more helpful.  We all had very good wine, beer, and other drinks.  If you love blue cheese, the way that I do, get the iceburg wedge with blue cheese and bacon bits.  A large salad!  I also had the crab cake that was delicious.  My sons had hamburgers and they thought they were perfect.  The sisters really liked the onion soup.

Yes, MoMo's is best known for their bar.  It is a great place for Giants fans before and after the game, but do try the restaurant, too.  I saw a number of  people enjoying the pizza.

Let's Go Giants!!
author: Rose J.

description:
I've been here a couple times now and each time, I would say that it's OK meaning 3 stars.  The first time I came here was with some friends for a Sunday brunch before an A's-Giants game last year.  It was definitely busy and full of fans which made the service a little slower but that was understandable.  I had the French toast which was good but on the pricier side.  We combined brunch items with cocktails which was a nice treat before the baseball game.

The second time I came here was for a work dinner about 7 months ago.  We had about 20 people at our table for dinner.  The service the second time was better than my first experience, probably because we had a lot of people and they already tacked on the 18% mandatory gratuity for parties of 6 or larger.  I had the scallops this night and they were good.I remember the drinks coming out quickly - as soon as I was near finished with my cocktail, they would already ask if I would like another.  Overall, this place is nice but on the pricier side for what you get.  The drinks aren't as strong as their price would indicate; worth going to every now and then but not as a main go-to place.
author: Paul C.

description: Had lunch here with my wife while wandering around in the area.  Ate outside, which was very pleasant.  I ordered the huevos rancheros and my wife had a salad.  The huevos rancheros were really good: crispy tortilla with egg, beans, guacamole, sausage and some pretty good spicy sauce.  I'd definitely order it again.
author: Richard M.

description:
We have been here before and enjoyed but the last time we sat in the dinning room for 25 minutes without anyone coming near us.  A table next to us caught a busboy and asked for service - when the waitress came (10 minutes later) she came to us and we directed her to the people that had asked - saying we needed service too. This went on all the time we were there. The waitress took our drink order and disappeared for another 15 minutes.  Took our food order and disappeared for another 20 minutes - by that time we were ready to just walk out.  It was my sister-in-law's birthday so we ordered desert - same thing and another 15 minutes to get the bill. 

The food was OK but not spectacular and the service was HORRIBLE!  We wrote the restaurant and they didn't even have the courtesy to answer - so NO we won't go again - if they dont' care about their customers I guess they don't need any
author: Harlean M.

description: $50.00 for a couple of burgers and ice teas.  Burgers were not stellar.  Service was average.  Best thing going for MoMo's is its great location!
author: Dawn J.

description: Had an awesome night at Momos right after the Giants game tonight. Bartender (Zach) was excellent, knew exactly what we wanted. Would definitely return.
author: Andrew H.

description:
I can only attest for Sunday brunch, in which the weather was perfect and there was no game craziness.  I came with Danny and our pup.  I'll say I was pleasantly surprised when they brought our pup a bowl of water, without us asking for one.  I had the Bruschetta (fresh mozzarella cheese, pesto and prosciutto), if that sounds good to you, it was.  I also had the French Onion Soup, which is one of my favorite soups.  And it didn't disappoint.

Overall, it was a wonderful way to spend Sunday morning/afternoon with my 2 loved ones.
author: Kim L.

description:
Rachel was our server and she was simply divine and such a QT. I thoroughly enjoyed my Caesar salad...I normally don't do the croutons but these were cheesy and oh-so-tasty! Then, speaking of cheese, I selected the mac-and-cheese lunch with black forest ham...oh holy cow mother of beef....so D'LISH. My son went with the $15 dollar buttermilk pancakes....a bit over priced?? uhh yeah but tasty. Then for dessert, we split the chocolate banana bread pudding topped with fresh creme and chocolate sauce.....lil piece of heaven here.....for realz. 

Located right off Muni, next to the Ball Park, I totally see myself coming back in the future. Itsa bit pricey but yanno...YUMMY enough for what you spend!
author: Virgo M.

description: Stopped in on a Sunday night alone and sat at the bar. Giants were out of town so it was very quiet. Ordered the Spaghetti, it came fast, was great. solid friendly service. This place has become an SF institution and I am happy to have had the opportunity to watch it happen.
author: Kenneth J.

description: Great for before Giants games. They have a really fantastic outdoor patio with an extra bar to accommodate the crowds.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Our small group ate here before an afternoon weekday Giants game.  

Good atmosphere:  the place was buzzing with Giants fans, it was beautiful weather, nice place to eat, pleasant seating inside.  Sort of weird that they have bouncers out front carding every person upon arrival... have your drivers license ready!  

Food was good:  I had the pulled pork sandwich which came with sweet potato fries and coleslaw, all delish.  The pork was ample, with a lovely smoky flavor.  The fries were cut super thin and the best I've had.  Coleslaw had ample dressing, and was very tasty.  1 companion had the Dungeness crab cakes, which looked wonderful, and the other had a salad (which she didn't finish) and a side order of the sweet potato fries, which was HUGE.  While the prices fell within Yelp's $$ range, I thought it was very pricey for lunch!!!

Our waitress was appropriately attentive:  taking our order promptly, coming by at the right times to help, bringing ketchup and the bill quickly, etc.
author: A H.

description:
Came here after I got bored at the Giants game. Looooved the atmosphere. Weather was gorgeous and warm with a slight breeze. Sat outside and it reminded me of my San Diego days!! 

Had a ginger drink (of course!) 
Oysters Rockafeller
Fresh Oysters

Superb. Go for drinks/snacks before, in between, and after the game!
author: Lola D.

description:
MoMo's is just so-so. 

My two experiences here were for prom (years ago) and recently for a friend's birthday.  What I remembered is still the issue with MoMo's.  Their food is simply just "ok", not great, not horrible - just mediocre. 

It's the spot to be before a game, or if you're in the area - say for a Cirque du Soleil show, but other than that, I would take your taste buds elsewhere. N

Nothing memorable so I can't even reference a dish... it was just another meal, unfortunately.
author: Lisa L.

description:
If you live in or very near San Francisco, then you live in a bubble.  A spoiled little boutiquey bubble where every restaurant is unique and different, and you might avoid going to, NAY, even SEEING an Applebee's for years at a time.

But what happens when you want your Applebee's?  Your T.G.I.Friday's?  But you don't want to have to pass the San Francisco county/city line to do it?

MoMo's is your answer.

Solid, three star food.  Everything was very tasty, nothing was shockingly amazing.  This is not a restaurant where people talk about the chef.  This is a restaurant where people go home with doggie bags.  Remember those?
author: Mariah M.

description:
Something with the name of the restaurant caught my eye and I had the opportunity to try this place out. Had to be the olive stabbing thru the second O. I'd always pass this place heading to a SF Giants game and the section in the front always has a crowd with drinks in their hands cheering on th Giants. I always say to myself "it's gotta be good there". 

My friends and I came on a weekend evening where no Giant's game was happening. Walked in and was welcomed into a pretty empty restaurant. Looked around to only see few other tables being occupied with business looking folks. We were seated. We ordered. We got drunk off of their Cosmo's (fyi, delicious). We ate. We were semi-satisfied. We ordered desert. We were more satisfied.

This place was more of a place for a quiet dinner. I didn't feel I could have more then a six in voice without having someone to smack me with an invisible ruler to shut up. Just not the place to be drunk... loud and rowdy. Maybe a good place to go on a friend-date. 

I didn't order an appetizer, didn't want to ruin the delicious dinner I've imagined. I ordered the Grilled Skirt Steak with braised Onions, Portobello Mushrooms and fries only to discover it was average American food I probably could have ordered at a family eatry like Sizzlers. 

Topped the night with more cosmo's and Tiramisu with Lany Fingers. Although my overall experience was "A-OK" on the yelp scale, I don't think I would come back to this place.
author: Jane A.

description:
Went here on 6/3 which happened to be the same day as a Giants' game. The bouncer/ security guard posted outside was welcoming and encouraged me and my friend  to come on in for breakfast as it was 10 AM and we were starving! Charmed by his easy-going attitude, we went inside fully intending to eat the good food he talked about.
The hostess greeted us, telling us about the three breakfast specials. When she finished, I asked, "how much are these dishes?" 
She coldly responded, "I don't know, they're specials." And turned to speak to another person waiting.
Seriously?! You don't know the prices of the limited THREE choices you just mentioned?
To the manager of Momo's: you hired well for your security. He was nice and welcoming which is great since he was seated outside and is the very first person a customer talks to before entering Momo's. But your hostess, your hostess left a lot to be desired. She sounded snooty, lazy and uneducated about what you serve. She was also the deciding factor of us turning around and eating at the much friendlier IRONSIDE, just around the corner and up a couple of blocks. They had a full buffet with delicious food and, just importantly, really nice staff. This includes their hostess, waiter and cooks (and those are just the people who spoke to me.) But I'm inclined to believe all their staff are friendly.
I strongly recommend a customer service workshop for your hostess. It should be easy to identify her as she is the person who worked on 6/3 at 10 AM.
author: ElleDee R.

description:
The Bottom Line: Upscale, good for happy hour after work or before the ballgame. Little Pricey, only above average.

I had the 29.99 NY steak + Salad/Soup + Dessert. 
Soup I substituted a french onion for a few bucks extra, it was okay, not really commensurate of a 8 dollar soup, could've used a piece of toasted bread, and the cheese could've been more baked on top of the soup.

I did try a friends Caesar salad and it was good.

The steak was cooked medium rare as ordered, but it was tough as all hell. Seasoning and flavor were ok. It also came with Potatoes Au Gratin which was a little overcooked, dried out kinda like its a big tray they keep recooking. String beans done perfect.

Dessert was a sundae, nothing to rave about but they use real chocolate instead of chocolate syrup which was nice. 

I'm going to give MoMo's a 3 star because it just wasn't that impressive, everything was just slightly above par, esp the price. Service was slightly slow.
author: Steven C.

description: Beautiful and rare hot day on the patio. Had the cobb salad for lunch, with balsamic vinaigrette. Not enough dressing in one ramekin. Mixed greens which I don't care for and left somewhat hungry. All for nearly $20 after tip and tax. Certainly not my last time to MoMo's, just won't be ordering that again, or might just stick to pre/post Giants games drinking.
author: Anthony T.

description: The brunch buffet on Saturdays and Sundays is amazing!  The variety and quality of the food will appeal to all ages and tastes.  I am a big fan of the sliced tri-tip steak and turkey breast.  In addition, the pastries and salads were an excellent complement to the meal.  My first taste was on Saturday and it was so good I brought 15 of my friends on Sunday.  They thoroughly enjoyed it as well.
author: Kirby R.

description: This place is kind of a San Francisco institution. It gets so crowded before Giants games. You grab a drink or 2 then you hit the game.  The downside is it's so crowded and almost impossible to find a seat. But it's close to public transit, don't drink and drive!
author: Heidi D.

description:
I have usually only gone to this place for "working" lunches, so it was so nice to spend a Friday with Michael here.  1st off they are VERY dog friendly, they brought Lexi treats and a nice bowl of water, of course you know what that means....instant star.

I ordered a chicken standwich and Michael got the burger.  We both noticed that the fries were PERFECT! Unfortunatley, Michael's burger was still mooing on the inside so he had to send it back for a little more cooking.  I actually hate it when this happens, it kinda throws off the meal a bit.  

Once his food came back we both enjoyed our food, the nice weather and were entertained by some of the rambling homeless people calling us rich yuppies.....god if they only knew how poor I really was.

So overall a good experience, worth the walk from the office, but I would only go back again on payday, the bill was almost 40 bucks.  yikes!
author: Alicia K.

description: The mussels were DIVINE. The service was pretty decent for a Saturday night. good atmosphere and overall experience.
author: Jamie R.

description:
Been here twice for lunch and both times the food was only mediocre. Actually I think the food is pretty overpriced for the quality offered. 

If you are paying $12 for a salad you would expect a generous portion which is assembled nicely and has lots of goodies as toppings. 
Frankly I was disappointed when my dish arrived. The other time I ordered the Gumbo which was not spicy nor had any flavor. It was very bland and I didn't enjoy it even after adding salt and pepper. 
The service is ok, not super friendly nor very helpful. 

All in all, I would only come here again for drinks and/or to sit outside. End of the story.
author: Sonja S.

description: Some of the worst and most overpriced food in the city.  Only tolerable if you are too drunk too notice. This will never change as long as they are right next to the ballpark.
author: Ravi R.

description:
Came here for a random pit stop for drinks. Highly recommend to grab a seat outside if the weather is nice. You get a good view of AT&T park, somewhat. 

Round 1: 2 beers, mojito, something punch. If i were to come back cocktails are the way to go. The mojito was pretty strong! 
You get your moneys worth.

Round 2, 3: We asked for SoCo w lime. But they didnt have lime. So instead a sweet & sour back did justice. Once we got the bill we got charged for Crown. So we did not know if what we drank was crown or soco LOL. Oh well drinks are drinks!

Bill came out to 100 plus between 4 girls. Not to bad. Can't really say anything about the service, we didnt order food so we were left alone for the most part!
author: Geneve V.

description:
WORST BARTENDER I HAVE EVER SEEN

For years I have heard about  folks going to Giants games and sitting on the paito for "Momos".   I guess its all about location because this place is horrible.  From the moment I got on the patio before the game the service was horrible.    We sat on the patio for 20 minutes and no one came to help us.....

....Proceeded to the bar where a bartender was texting on his phone.  Looked up at us and said I will be right with you while he finished his text for about 45 seconds.....no exaggeration.   I was just stunned.  Finally took our order and snatched the money out of my hand like I owed him something.   Made a crappy drink through my change on the bar and went back to his texting.    SORRY FOR BOTHERING YOU.

I had to go in to bar to order my own food.    Food took forever and came to me cold.  I will never, ever go back and would not recommend to anyone.  I had to rush into game because food took forever or I would have absolultey asked to speak to manager.  Will never go back and have told this story to most of my friends because of the audacity of this youngman.
author: Ximena B.

description: The Ahi Tartare is review-worthy all by itself! This is the perfect wasabi-sushi appetizer - or meal if you order two or three :)  I am not sure what was in those mason jars my companions were drinking, but they raved about it as well. Great experience on the deck across from the stadium - and  I cannot wait to go back.
author: Crockett H.

description:
We sat in the patio area on a beautiful sunny day and ordered a bunch of appetizers accompanied with a bubbly Prosecco.  The food was good but not amazing. . I would come here more for the ambiance. Its a pretty chill place and there is an outdoor bar that is visible at the entrance where people are mingling. The portions  of the food are fairly generous and the presentation of the food was appealing. By the way, be preparred for obnoxious rowdy men when its game day.

Our selections:

-Ahi Tuna Tartare-- flavorful but the sauce was overpowering the taste of tuna a tad bit. Still a goody though. 
-Bruschetta- Mozzarella di Bufala, Prosciutto, Eggplant, Caponata & Pesto--awesome combination
-Crispy Onion Strings- nothing special but a nice subsitute to the rings
-Oysters on the Half Shell- refreshing and paired well with the Prosecco

-Dunguness Crab Louis Salad- It was huge! So get half an order if its just for yourself. The real crab meat and the chunks of avacados were yummy. It came with a dressing similar to thousand island.

Sliders- Smoked Carolina Style Pulled Pork - mouth watering and heavy.
author: Jeanne L.

description: I haven't been to MoMo's in several years and a friend suggested we stop by for lunch while walking around this past weekend.  Fortunately, the ballgame wasn't until later in the day so the place was not crowded.  The lamb burger was fabulous!  The service was great.  They renovated the restaurant within the past several months and it looks fresh.  Also, great outside dining with plenty of umbrellas.  Still holding their ground with great food.
author: bill l.

description: This past Saturday I took several friends from out of state for dinner and drinks. Upon arrival we were greeted by very friendly personnel at the front desk. We had reservations and were seated right away. This is where things really broke down. The restaurant was not crowded and there were obviously ample staff present to deal with the light patronage.  We waited almost 30 minutes before a waitress came to take a drink order. Once she had our order she returned approximately 10 minutes later with our drinks.  She disappeared for approximately 20 more minutes and finally returned to take our food order. The food returned pretty quickly, which I expected because at this point there was only 2 other tables occupied.  The food was excellent! We finished our meals and waited 45 minutes after that before the waitress returned. She never checked on us nor did she ask if we wanted more drinks or dessert.  It took an additional 20 minutes for her to return with our check and when she did, she mentioned the automatic 20% gratuity because we had 7 in our group.  Well let's just say this did not go over very well.  We asked for a manager and were told that the manager was not on site.  We asked for separate checks and tipped meagerly based upon her very poor customer service. Just as we got up to leave, we noticed that the only other occupied table of 6 were voicing similar displeasure at the poor service they were receiving.  All in all I feel that it is very unfortunate that a restaurant with a first class location, great atmosphere and excellent food showed so poorly due to a dismal wait staff.  My reccomendation: pass this one by until they get their act together!
author: Mike M.

description: ....If you want a very crowded place before or after a game along with very drunk people, you will like this place.  If you want a hamburger there is a McDonalds 2 blocks away....do you get it...because of game crowds they make money hand over fist no matter what they put out...
author: jim b.

description:
The location is only thing going for this place. Food was mediocre and way over priced for what it is. 4 quarter sized half inch scallops for 27$ and they weren't special. the onion soup was super fatty with heavy greece. small salads for 11. also our server started off great until i informed her that i hadn't gotten my side with entree 5 minutes later i cancelled it with the busser and i saw her give a fuss from afar then she came up and rudely said the dish was ready but she'll cancel it and swiftly walked away.. 
at least the jameson was good!
author: Ryan R.

description: Decent food but over priced for what you get. We asked for blue cheese stuffed olives and they nicely offered to make them but then charged us $5 for the service! Really???
author: Amber J.

description: Great location, nice surroundings with great outdoor seating.  However, the food is just so-so.  They seem to be coasting a bit.  Acme French toast was a big highlight, but everything else was about 85% of Cheesecake Factory quality.  Service about a B.  That's it.  OK food, nice spot.  Get off your ass and walk a bit to the Ferry Bldg if you want good food.
author: Nate S.

description:
I am definitely a Momo's fan, for dinner, lunch, drinks, happy hour, ball games, you name it.  Living in the area, I am probably here more often than I should be, but oh well!

What a lot of people don't know about Momo's, it's not just a place to drink beer while crowded on a porch before and after Giant's games.  They have a great dinner, I highly recommend the French Onion Soup, and the steak dinner is a great meal for a great price.  $29 for a large steak with veggies and potatoes, salad, and dessert.  Happy hour is great, pizzas, $4 martinis, snacks, etc.

Probably the biggest deck in the neighborhood and great for sunny days, heaters out there when it gets cooler.

And, on to the game watching.  It's great for that.  I was there for many of the play off and World Series games.  We sat in the dining room and watched the tv's back there while enjoying great eats and drinks.  I just could not do the packed bar thing for a whole game and enjoy watching it like that.  Also, great for before and after the games.  Gets crowded, but that's what it's all about during those times.

The staff is excellent, they'll take care of you and remember you if you keep coming back!

I've only done lunch, dinner, and drinks, so I can't comment on breakfast yet...
author: Stephanie J.

description: Love the patio for drinks. Definitely a party spot before and after games on summer nights. Such a great place to pregame! Love the vibe but I am harshly questioned by the bouncers and asked for my ID because I look under 21. I get that's their job but they need to ease up a bit.
author: Gina B.

description: Great food, good portion sizes for those not worried about their calorie intake. Good wine selection also. Ambience a bit boring for my taste in the main dining area, crowd seems a bit "senior".
author: Yvonne G.

description: Delishes crab cakes and their crab Louie wasn't bad either. I also loved their oysters. It's a huge restaurant and it's right across from my beloved giants stadium. Only bad thing is their happy hour menu has a small selection and we couldn't order anything else because there was a private party. Boo... Anyways huge place with great service.
author: Lisa Z.

description: Stumbled upon MoMo's after attending the Bay Area Science Festival at AT&T Park. Nice find. Service was friendly and attentive; food was very good. Knocking off a star for the completely unexplained "4% surcharge" added to all checks. Still worth it.
author: Rich W.

description: Stephanie at Momo's is absolutely the best!!  We had left our Giants tickets at home and were in desperate need of a printer to print them off again.  One phone call and she came through for us !  Definitely appreciated Stephanie going above and beyond for some forgetful Giants fans.  That alone will bring us back for another visit to dine!
author: Lynda H.

description:
Great pre-game and post-game stop.  I like going to MoMo's due to its proximity to the ballpark.  The place is always packed, but it doesn't have a lot of drama like some other establishments I've been to.  If you get to the ballpark early, MoMo's allows for pre-game imbibing at cheaper prices than inside the park.  Post-game is a must, so that you can wait for the crowds for MUNI to die down.

I give 'em 5 stars because they take care of me there.  Which I don't always like because my threshold is low due to my size.
author: Aileen B.

description:
We were all hoping that the Giants would sweep the Padres yesterday, but Zito choked. Grr!! I have yet to watch him win one! Anyway, with alcohol no longer being served during the 8th inning, and the Giants being down 6 runs, we headed out of the ballpark and across the street to MoMo's.

The place was packed, but we managed to get into an opening at the bar and scored three open stools. Since we were drinking margaritas all afternoon, we decided to continue drinking them here. And boy oh boy, were they STRONG! We had a couple before needing some drunkie munchies. We ordered a margherita pizza, which was pretty decent. I wish I would've known about their famous chocolate brioche banana bread pudding with chocolate caramel sauce, because I would've been all over it.

MoMo's is a fun spot to hang out before, during and after a game, but don't expect food that's better or cheaper than ballpark food. Personally, I still prefer getting some fried chicken from Happy Donuts down the block.
author: Connie C.

description: Great location, trendy bar, and a great place after a Giants game! Went straight to the bartender ( who was very attentive to us) and ordered 7 Patron shots... UGH... It was great.. but I was definitely hurting the next day. I'm too old for this! (I know I'll be doing it again next weekend though!)
author: Jojo N.

description:
I went here last Saturday during a Giant's game with the intention of just getting drinks, but ended up eating too. We were in the dining room, which was great because they had huge screens up to watch the game on, including a projector.

We ordered the Margherita Pizza and the side Mac and Cheese, along with two glasses of wine. The pizza was good, but it came out cold. Not kind of warm...it was barely room temperature. Such a bummer because the pizza could have been great! Instead, it was just okay. The mac and cheese was okay, but it definitely could have used a lot more bread crumbs, and it wasn't that hot either.  

Our waitress was extremely nice, and would give her an extra star if the food wasn't so-so. Not sure if I'd ever be back here to eat, but might come again for drinks because it's so close to the park. Disappointing overall.
author: Cori H.

description: Beautiful day in S.F., on Monday, April 16th. It was suggested by a friend that we try this place. It was great because we sat outside on the lovely patio which is huge plus on a beautiful SF day. I ordered the open face shrimp & crab sandwich, it was very good, but my other half had the French dip and OMG, it was probably the best I've ever tasted, I was jealous that I hadn't ordered it but it was nice because we shared. Portions are a nice size and reasonably priced. Very nice place for a sit down lunch rather than the grab & go. They also make a killer top shelf margarita ;-)
author: Valerie L.

description:
3.5 stars actually---
BEST Shrimp/Crab Louie Salad ever made! My guy ordered a boneless chicken ...that came with a bone. It also came with a broccoli rabe which was absolutely unedible. The potatoes had no flavor. So I have mixed feelings on this place. At least what I got was good! The staff sound genuine and are not annoyingly fake or too rehearsed.
author: Anna N.

description:
This is a great place to meet friends before events at Pac Bell Park.  We went for lunch prior to seeing the latest Cirque du Soliel.  Made reservations, but arrived a little late.  Were seated and served quickly, service was friendly and efficient, and everyone liked their food.  I got the chicken pot pie, which was essentially a piece of puff pastry atop a chicken stew.  Much lighter fare than expected, but flavorful and the veges were not overcooked, which was nice.  

The most outstanding part of the experience, though, was the amazing hostess.  She took it upon herself to alert us that, if we were going to Cirque, we had better leave soon because late arrivals aren't allowed in.  We had no idea were were running late, and were SO appreciative.  She expediting our exit and we made it to the show by the skin of our noses!  Bravo Momo hostess!!
author: Holly S.

description:
First time here.  I actually expected this place to be pretentious and expensive, but was not.  Came here on a Sunday afternoon. We ordered Mussels with fries for shared appetizer (which was awesome!)  
Chicken Pot Pie which was freshly made (i know because of the crispness of the carrots and other vegetables, the puff pastry was fresh too.)  2nd, the Blackened Catfish was very good too!  Very friendly and attentive service by host, waiter, and server (my point, we had 3 people serving us).  We sat outside which was very nice.  I almost forgot to mention the drinks.  They have a full service bar and what I gather, they specialize in Martinis.  No Martinis were ordered so I can't comment on those.  What I can comment on is that they have a premium wine and  draft beer selection as well non alcoholic drinks which are not on the menu which can be ordered (such as lemonade).  Tables  outside are very pleasant during the afternoon.   I had a quick peek and saw how how this place could  be popular in the evening too.  (Additional notes regarding gender:  When I mentioned "Host", It was either a man or a woman.  When I mentioned, "Waiter". this is the person who waited on us and who explained the menu and took our order".  When I mentioned "Server", this is actually the person who delivered and presented our food to us.)
author: Don J.

description: Took 10 friends for a yearly get together in early January and they made us feel very comfortable.  Food was great, wine was excellent and service was as good as it gets.  Waiter offered complimentary tastings on each wine that looked good.  We hung out for hours and enjoyed looking across the street at the ball park.  Been going there a few times a year since they opened and they have been consistently top notch.
author: A B.

description: The mahi mahi was great. They took great care with our food allergies and made the fish and sides with no butter. The Brussels sprouts where done to perfection.   We also got in without reservations on valentines day.
author: MIchael H.

description: I've only been here twice for lunch. And both times I've gotten the Crab Melt Sandwich and it is soo sooo good. Mhmmm. It's an open faced sandwich of tons of crab meat melted with cheese onto a piece of bread. Perfectly made and so yummy to eat. It comes with french fries or a salad, or maybe both, I can't remember. Service is good here as can be expected. But it is pricey for lunch, then again it is in the SOMA and I did get a crab sandwich, so not that pricey in those regards.
author: Grace L.

description:
Good but rather predictable (boring?) food. 

Summary:
- Calamari: crispy and done just right
- Ahi Tartare: Flavorful
- Crab & Shrimp Melt with Fries: I was expecting a hearty sandwich, but it was One piece of  baguette topped with cheddar, crab and shrimp. It was good, but i was expecting a bigger sandwich for $12
- Mac & Cheese; Good but not mind-blowing. Huge portion though
- Good service

So overall, very predictable menu, nothing you can't find anywhere else, it was done well, but not amazing. Solid lunch choice, but not really something i would crave...

Oh, but i can't wait for $2 Martinis for Ladies on Thursdays! Wooo hooo
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Eh. Went for lunch on a non-baseball game day. Service was good, atmopshere is clean, but the food was just okay. I ordered the turkey sandwich and it was dry and came with homemade potato chips (doesn't say this on the menu). The potato chips were not good at all.
author: Amy O.

description: Recommended by a friend and grateful for it!! MoMo's was a great restaurant to have date night with my husband before seeing the Cirque du Soleil show the other night! The atmosphere was warm and cozy, service was good and the drinks and food we great! The Mac & Cheese is a must!
author: Leann W.

description:
Take me out to the ball game...take me out after the ball game...

This is pretty much where all the rowdies go that still want to keep raging after the game. Its the closest bar to the park entrance, so naturally it is the most crowded spot to hit up directly after it ends...

These 2 stars are solely for the convenience from the field (seriously, this bar was closer than our car). Its a catch 22 though, because the convenience means it will be crowded as hell. It took us a while to get in/get our beers, but it was a nice starting spot to hit on our crawl down the SOMA district fan-friendly bars.
author: Samantha R.

description: Fantastic spot for a drink before the game. Can't wait to return on a warmer day. Service in the beer garden is horrendously slow.
author: Michael H.

description:
Hmmm, hmmm, hmmm...

Delicious - House Cured Salmon Gravlax Flat Bread with Cheesy Chive Scrambled Eggs

Thirst quenching - Berry Lemonade
author: Nanette L.

description:
Have been to this place once before but ate outside.. Today was my first time eating inside and I had a nice time. Very good tasting food minus the large pieces of calamari started to make me feel a little sick (just the thought of a whole baby octopus I guess). I will be back again very soon! Not to mention, because of the small space between personal tables, me and my best friend made new friends because of being so close! Haha. Had no choice but to have to talk to them because of the space between! 

We shared the calamari and the pepperoni pizza. The pizza was amazing and the calamari was very good too! We just didn't like the big pieces of calamari which wasn't a big deal since there was a lot of little pieces to eat. :) 

Thanks for the awesome service MoMo's! Be back soon!
author: Christa M.

description:
I had such a great time at Momo's yesterday. It was my 1st time there and for sure will not be my last.I loved the location, the great outdoor patio seating, and the top notch service!  

The food was very good... We had the pasta and clams, tomatos and cheese,and  a side of salad. The food was very fresh n tasty and our server was spot on. 

There was not one thing that stood out about my trip to Momo's other than the great experience and good times I had there! I look foward to going there again.
author: Doug S.

description:
I've come here at various times through the years: dinner during the 2002 playoffs, brunch on Easter Sunday, Valentine's Day dinner, lunch during a rain delay, and brunch again. 

While the atmosphere's always been great, game day or not, the food's slipping a little bit. Instead of everything being great, it's now hit or miss. Pulled pork and calamari are average: mac and cheese & meat loaf are delicious. The cocktails are good, and beer's about $2-3 cheaper than at the ballpark. Service is good, but a little slow when there's a game. 

It is possible to have a quiet dinner here. You just have to go when there's no event at AT&T Park.
author: Julia G.

description:
Like a fat kid in a donut shop...

"I want that one!"

"No, no, no, I want THAT one!"

"Ooh, look at THAT one!"

"Nuh-uh, THAT one! Nomnomnonom!"

A great place to skeeve on tall good looking men before a Giants game. Even worth the $6/bottled beer.
author: Devon S.

description:
Came here right after a Giants game.  it was PACKED.  Took us at least 10 minutes just to walk inside and get to the bar. If you come here after a game looking for serenity, you're in the wrong place.  All you'll get is handfuls upon handfuls of Giants fan.

Space heaters in the outdoor are are a godsend, and it really is a great place to grab a quick drink before/after a game.
author: Eric C.

description:
Not really itching to go back...

Came here months ago with a few friends. We ordered the appetizer clam pizza. Get this...they just threw the clams still in with their shells on top of the pizza...this made the pizza soggy! Gross!. For the main dishes we had lobster ravioli (tasty but a little pricy for getting only 3) ...Braised Short Ribs were average...a little under seasoned. 

The waitress was really pleasant but the food could use a little help.
author: Michelle Y.

description:
This place is crowded (even in the waiting area).  At this place, they will make you show your driver's license at the entrance.  I go to this place once a year, only when I absolutely have to.  You may think I am talking about your local DMV office, but I am talking about MoMo's.

Due to its location and shameless self promotion, MoMo's has quickly become a San Francisco institution.  Located directly across from AT&T Park, MoMo's has become THE place to grab a pre-game drink or even dinner.  Be prepared for long lines at the bar, and forget about sitting on the patio if the weather is nice.  Don't think you're the only one who figured out that a quick stop at MoMo's might be fun.

This place is yet another example of commercialization of baseball.  MoMo's patrons, by en large, could really care less about the game.  They are more interested in getting a nice buzz before heading off to their Field Club seats in the bottom of the fourth inning.  There is nothing wrong with this, but it is that kind of a crowd.  It's not baseball fans going to a bar, it's the bar crowd catching a baseball game.

I've been to MoMo's a number of times, and I always left the place thinking: "MoMo's?  Meh."  The food is not exciting, and talk about overpriced!  Yikes.  You are definitely paying for the location and for people watching.  I would add ambiance to this list, but MoMo's lacks any kind of feel, really.  It's just blah.

I came here a couple of weeks ago with a friend from out of town before the Giants/Dodgers game.  We wanted to eat elsewhere, but the place was too crowded.  He wanted to try MoMo's, and, despite my many warnings, we decided to go in.  After a 14-minute wait, we were seated in a spacious back room with mirrors on the walls and tables very far apart from one another.  The restaurant was busy and noisy.  

We opted for something new: their $29 prix fixe steak dinner menu.  It looked too good to be true: a salad, an entree and a dessert for $29?  Most entrees were in the $22-$25 range.  

Our first course was the iceberg wedge salad with blue cheese.  The dressing wasn't great, but the salad was pretty decent.  The second course was "the juiciest steak in town."  About 12-14 oz of low-grade sirloin was indeed juicy; however, it didn't make up for the fact that it was chewy, stingy and fiber-y.  It was served with slightly undercooked green beans and slightly burned potatoes au gratin.  The dessert, however was great.  The ice cream sunday, served in a tall aluminum martini glass, was mmm mmm good!  A scoop of vanilla ice cream, topped with caramel and walnut, with just a slight hint of dulce de leche.  In a word - scrumptious.  

I will probably come back to MoMo's again, even if it is to take advantage of their $29 prix fixe.  Let's face it, $29 won't buy you a lot at the ballpark.  And why settle for a crappy hotdog or a mediocre hamburger when for the same price, you can have a below average steak brought to you by almost always friendly waiters?
author: Yan G.

description:
MoMo's is the spot to go before and after a Giants game. It's always packed with fun people looking for a good time.

Given how busy it can get during game season, I would say the service is great. We had to wait a bit to order our food after ordering our Bloody Marys, but again, it was busy so it was expected. Waiting with a drink with fellow Giants fans makes the wait go by fast.

From the menu yesterday: French Toast, Eggs Benedict, and Scrambled Eggs w/ Breakfast Sausage, Bloody Marys. Everything was perfect, especially my french toast - totally recommend. I also got contact taste from the surrounding burgers and fries - MmmMmm.

FINAL ANSWER: The place to be during game season! Everybody who plan to go to a Giants game should have Momo's on their agenda.
author: Maria C.

description: Stopped in here early for some lunch before the Giants game. We were way early so almost no one was there. Great drinks and pretty good food. Service was good too. Prices were a little high for lunch even for the city but right across from the ball park what can you expect. I'd certainly go bac.
author: Gary B.

description:
Momo's, I wanted so much to dislike you! You're huge, you're flashy, you're packed, and I'm jealous of how much money you make (at least on game days!). But I have to say, for the type of restaurant you are trying to be, you keep it real, and I can't help but be a fan.

Here's what you do exceptionally well: fried food. The onion rings here are the best onion rings I've had in my life (more shoestring style instead of chunky and the size of my head). I know that's a bold statement, but you know like how when you fall in love, you just know? I tasted them and I just knew, no other onion rings could ever compete. Also, I am not generally a fan of large-cut fries, but damn son, they have them down perfectly. They were so crispy amazing that I was stealing them from the person sitting next to me...without asking. I was ready to fight for those fries.

Now, if you're looking to go the more healthy route, well they've got you covered. The giant chicken/pear salad is delicious and big enough to be your lunch and dinner! Finally, the salmon gravlax (crudo, essentially. But, doesn't that sound like a great name for a dwarf in an RPG!?) was spot on. Sure it's a little overpriced, but they don't skimp on the portion sizes, and for its location, I think it could be a lot worse.

The service has always been attentive and friendly, although a bit slow. But, the speed is of little concern to me when I go because kicking back on the patio on a sunny day with a cocktail is the perfect way to spend a Friday afternoon (especially if you're trying to avoid work!). If only they had some tanning chairs out there!
author: Kelsey E.

description:
Average place. The location is killer. The food is pretty good - not great. Nothing really stood out as exceptional.

I love the outdoor patio area right across from the ballpark.

The candied pecans are really good. They have these  in their salad.

I go the fish of the day - I forgot the variety (Snapper?) it was a bit overcooked and rather bland (I had very little sauce on my plate). I also had jumbalaya which was bland and mushy (reminded me of cafeteria food) and corn (again - boring and forgettable).

The molten chocolate volcano cake was divine. I could have used more berries but the cake was really good.

I'd only go back for the convenient location.
author: Chili B.

description:
I just spend three hours today eating a great lunch with 11 other Boomer ladies.  This is a great meetup for any woman born between 1946 and 1964. Everything from hostess, wait staff, and food was perfect.  If you want a place to have a group outing, this it.
Everyone knows I am a very picky eater.  Every bite I had of my French onion soup and French dip sandwich was fantastic.  The chocolate chip cookies were so good.  Everyone liked their food choices.  I want to bring my daughter here for her 30th birthday dinner.  The food prices were so reasonable. 
I so enjoyed the experience!
author: cheryl b.

description:
It's 5 stars on a sunny beautiful day so you can people watch. It is 1 star for the service which was so so so so slow. We came today after kayaking on the bay and got a table for 12 outside. It seriously took forever to put our orders in. Our waiter disappeared and it took forever to pay. Yes, there was a giants game, but we came after it started, so Momo's was actually pretty dead. By the time we finished, the game was out and it was packed. Still, no excuse to be that slow.

For the food. It's is pricey, but what do you expect across from the ballpark? The calamari was plentiful and looked and smelled delicious. Everyone seemed to enjoy their burgers and fries. I ordered the salad with fruit which was actually really delicious. There was iceburg lettuce, pecorino slices, peaches, mangoes and pears - yummy! The dressing really went well with the salad and fruit.
author: Natalie S.

description: This place is a bit pricey but it's really delicious. We went here and ordered a burger..I know..who goes to a fancy place and orders burgers? Well..I do..but it was a really good burger!!! Another time we went here, we had drinks and appetizers, which were all very delicious. If I could sucker someone to take me here or if I were richer, I'd go here more often!
author: Pika C.

description:
MoMo's only has a 3 star rating now? Why?? What happened?? I was able to revisit MoMo's during my lunch hour yesterday and was well pleased with what we ordered. 5 stars for food and service.

CRISPY CALAMARI
Indeed, it was crispppyyy!! Some places state that they have crispy fried calamari but they usually come out oil drenched and soggy. Not here! The ones here were fried with a batter that had a spice kick to it. It was delicious. This was served with cocktail sauce and tartar sauce -- I preferred the tartar sauce. 

CRAB CAKES
Four round meatball sized crab cakes came out sitting on a bed of roasted red peppers and other spices. There was a little dollop of some chipotle mayo sauce on each crab cake that definitely went well with it. Cut a bit of the crab cake, put some roasted red peppers on it, and a bit of the chipotle sauce and you're good to go. YUM-O!

MAC AND CHEESE W/ HAM
The last time I had this was on New Years Eve and I vowed that it was the best last meal of 2008. I still agree. This came out in a mini skillet which was about 6 inches in diameter. Sounds small but there was definitely enough to feed two. You can't eat that much mac and cheese and walk out of a restaurant feeling fine. The corkscrew noodles were still cooked al dente, and the cubes of ham were chopped up in tiny bits so that it wasn't overpowering the cheese flavor. To add to that, the top of the mac and cheese had a crispy layer to it. I don't know what cheeses went in here but I can safely assume its a mix of cheddar and parmesean cheeses. I loveeee MoMo's mac and cheese!!

Why doesn't anyone like MoMo's as much as I do...?
author: Heidi C.

description: Came in for brunch on a Sunday morning. Jared was great, very attentive and friendly. Got eggs Benedict and there was a small mistake on the order. They quickly fixed the issue and we enjoyed our meal. Made a reservation easily on open table and were seated right away. Over all great experience and Jared was awesome! Just moved into the area, definitely coming back soon. When Jared is working of course :)
author: Madeline M.

description:
Went in before a Giants game one Friday night. The place was packed but we managed to secure 2 seats at the bar with relative ease. We ordered 2 drinks and a burger to share and were worried it wouldn't come in time for the game. To our surprise, it did! And it was delicious!
I've never been here before but I would come back before a game to have a quick bite to eat. Thumbs up!
author: L F.

description:
So much fun before a Giants game that we actually, um forgot to go to the game.  

Oh well next time maybe we won't have as much fun.
author: Denise B.

description:
We love Momo's. The food is really good for the price. We always get the Steak dinner for $29 and that gets you 3 good courses AND they have $4 Martinis so we try to get there right after work to make it before 7pm. I wish they extended the cut off time though but oh well, the drinks are really good.  The service is great!

I'm not sure how it is on the weekends as we always go on the weekdays but when there's no company events, the place is actually pretty laid back and you can expect to have a nice quiet dinner.
author: Diana B.

description:
The food was decent but the service was terrible.

My party showed up last Saturday (10/6), the day of the the Giants game, after the game started to grab some dinner and drinks. It was busy with people drinking in the patio but we wanted a table and that part of the restaurant was not too busy. We asked the hostess how long the wait was for 3 people. With attitude she asked if it was for drinks and appetizers or if we were going to have a meal. (was that necessary question?) We replied saying we are going to have all three. Then she said it would be a 30-40 minute wait. We were fine with it because we were already having drinks. Five minutes later a party of four walked in and asked for a table and the same hostess told them it was going to be a 15 minute wait. We were kind of puzzled because the same girl told us 30-40 minutes five minutes prior. No kidding, five minutes later the party of 4 were seated before us. When we confronted the hostess, this time I think it was the manager, she said to give her a few minutes and she will look into it. We were eventually seated 10 minutes later. The original hostess apologized and said they were seated first because the had a bigger party so they got the bigger table. I am thinking so since they had one more person they were seated first? That does not make sense.

Not to through out the race card but the party of 4 were all Caucasians and we are not. I am just saying... that was not cool.

At the end of the day, their service in the hostess booth needs to be reevaluated. The girls were not friendly and seemed to look down at us. Not a cool experience. I did have high hopes for this place and now will probably not go back.
author: Joe G.

description: I can see that this place is all about Giants games. I went on an afternoon when it was not game day and not much business. The service was terrible. I don't usually get angry by the service, but I did with these guys. Food is not good and way overpriced.  Fine if you just want beers or drinks.  I'm sure it's fine to get hyped up before the baseball game with your crew. They are always going to be busy on game day, so the servers and bartenders feel that they don't need to care about service. I'm not going back, but I know that won't make a dent in their business.
author: Cortez K.

description:
I was there again last night before the Giants game and my daughter and I had a wonderful dinner. Our servers name was Rachael. She was very nice and when I told her we weren't in a hurry she left us alone to talk and didn't rush us with our food. 

I had the pork chop which was done just perfect. I normally don't order pork chops out because they can get dry if not cook properly. But MoMo's chop was spot on. 

The next time you go and you have a problem you should ask for Peter... he is one of the main partners and he was walking the room last night and introduced himself to us and asked how we were doing..   He also made a point to come back after our entree was served to double check if all was okay.  I bet he would want to hear about any comments or concerns..


My daughter had the NY Steak... it was cooked to perfection and the side dishes of potato and creamed spinach was very tasty.. Just a hint of nutmeg in the creamed spinach and gee that makes a huge difference in the taste. 

It's so funny that the reviews are so mixed on this place.. I mean they get hit really hard before the game and just before the game starts the whole place pretty much clears out. I guess they just don't have the process down yet.. I've probably eaten at MoMo's about 8 different times and I have always been happy...
author: Robin G.

description:
Came here for a notre dame game watch last year when all other bars were playing the Ohio State Penn State game. We had the entire outside patio and a huge screen TV. The place gets PACKED, get here early to get a decent seat. 

Drinks were stiff, average price at $11 for a Ketel One tonic. Parking is not too terrible, plenty of street parking actually if you're there on the right time. We had a decent sized group. Would return here if we had another game watch, but probably not otherwise.
author: Ahmed S.

description: I went here for lunch, so we were seated right away. It was alittle slow so we had speedy customer service. The food was great, and the prices were about right for the location. I felt the food was prepared fresh from a taste perspective. I could appreciate fresh tasting food if I am paying 20 for a salad.
author: Naomi J.

description:
I have been here a few times and every time I have been there, it was overly crowded and well overpriced.  The food's ok but not worth the prices in my opinion.  They do however cater to you if you have a private party.  My old company has thrown 2 parties there and they have been more than accommodating.  

If I were asked to go there just for dinner?  I'd say forget it.  There are other places in the area that are cheaper and quieter.
author: Jennifer C.

description: I went to this resturant on Sunday May 12, 2013 before the SF Giants game as many Giants fans do. I was with three girlfriends and thought it would be a great place to have a few mimosas before the game. After we were sat and ordered our first round of mimosas, the manager came over and rudely told us we had to leave because we were not ordering food and that she wanted to give our table away. I have never been treated this way in an establishment. I will never go back there.
author: Ashley R.

description:
Post ball game eats, without the post ball game craziness.

Now, you all know darn well that I'm not a baseball person, but, I just happened to be in the neighborhood, in the moments after AT&T park released thousands of hungry fans, looking for eats.  Peaking in at neighboring establishments, we encountered long waits for tables, or adrenaline pumped fans, still exhibiting stadium-like behavior.  MoMo's seemed to be the one bashful child in the class, so the decision was made.   The host was rather welcoming, and got us a good window seat right away.  Water and bread were on the table quickly as well.  A sliced loaf of sourdough bread, and whipped butter were a promising start, and the menu items looked tasty on paper.  I opted for the mushroom filled ravioli, with artichoke hearts, and asparagus, served in a bath of parmasan broth.  The dish, while attractive, and green, was lacking expertise of pasta preparation.  The individual pasta were almost glued together.  I did, however, enjoy mushroom filling, and the added asparagus, as it was fresh, bright green, and not overcooked.  My dining partner ordered the gumbo.  The smokiness of the sausage in the gumbo was definitely the highlight of that dish.  Though the other elements of the gumbo lacked Louisiana authenticity, it did have a satisfying quality. After tasting that, I had a case of buyer's remorse with my dish.  

The service was responsive, though we did have one awkward server moment.  When seated, a server quickly obtained our drink orders, and about one to two minutes later, a different server came over, taking out drink order, which were already addressed.  Not a huge deal, but evidence of a slight communication gap on the team.  Otherwise the overall service experience was good.  Be aware that a 4% surcharge is applied to all parties.  I didn't feel that the cuisine was so exclusive, that surcharges were warranted, so just be aware of that, prior to dining.  If seeking calm in the storm, in the AT%T Park vicinity, just after a baseball game concludes, then this is where you'll find refuge.
author: Damon Z.

description: All the times I have been here I have never sampled the Food.Had a bunch of drinks though and ALWAYS had a great time.For the most part go here when attending Giants games.Its a fun place.Ya gotta go !
author: Joe P.

description: I love this place.  Sit outside after a game and get the steak sandwhich
author: brad a.

description:
3 stars for cougar hunt watching
2 stars for food
2 stars for mixology
5 stars for location but
1 star for crowd control
author: Annie T.

description: Went here for the Cleveland game last Sat (6/25) and as always it was a great scene.  Immediately got a table outside and enjoyed some great food and drinks.  The best place to go before the game on a sunny day.
author: Hawk M.

description:
I really wanted to like this place, it being right across the street from AT&T Park. I decided to check it out on a day when the Giants were playing on the road. I figured it'd be a good way to catch the game and hang out near the park.

I get there, and one TV is showing the Giants game. The rest are showing something else. No one is really watching them except me, and they won't change the channel. You'd think that the restaurant across the street from the Giants stadium would show the Giants on TV.

The drinks were very expensive as was the food. We ended up leaving and going to Pete's Tavern down the street. I would recommend that you do that too if you ever find yourself in the neighborhood.
author: Antony M.

description:
Night out with my hubby.  Made last minute reservations, but still had to wait due to a private party closing out most of the restaurant.  Only a small amount of tables in the back were available for the regular diners.  

Started off sharing a prosciutto and fontina pizza.  Perfectly topped with sweet figs and fresh rosemary.  Ended up packing some home.  I had the Crab and Shrimp Louie salad.  It looks like a small salad, but don't let it fool you.  It's plenty.  My husband had the braised short rib with a veggie medley (tasted like brussel sprout leaves and bacon), and a horseradish mashed potatoes that were just way too horseradishy.  Couldn't eat it.  If they gave a little more juice with the meat - it would have been perfect.   On the side, we ordered the mac and cheese.  That dish didn't stand a chance between the two of us.  

All in all, everything was very good - except the mashed potatoes.  No room for dessert.  Looking forward to the leftovers tomorrow.
author: Denise M.

description: Went to momos before an evening giants game. Glad we made a reservation because they were packed! We were seated outside on their beautiful patio. Bring a jacket because it isn't heated but we were prepared. Our server was knowledgable and attentive as was the busser. The food was excellent. What more can you say?
author: Peter G.

description:
2 stars for the simple fact that their price of a beer is about the same as getting one at the ballpark across the street. 

Overrated
author: Bob V.

description:
SHITTY SERVICE!!!

Waitresses and Managers are RUDE! The service sucks, overpriced and small portions.

People only go here as a place to chill before Giants game.

Never giving my business or money to them again.
author: Ashely S.

description: Came here for a client lunch. We had a large party and their waitstaff was attentive. Had the crab and shrimp melt but it was just mehhh. Guess I can't compare it to what I was expecting (crab roll @ f.i.s.h.) but it was an okay time. Great location and beautiful on a nice sunny day if you sit out on the patio.
author: Dee H.

description:
My friends  and I brought our dogs with us to lunch.  We noticed that there were several dogs with thier owners eating lunch in the front patio as well.  So we felt that it was a dog friendly place.  The matradee brought out a water bowl for our dogs.  That was really a nice touch.

I ordered the gumbo half size it was delicious.  Just the right amount of spice and not too much rice.  My friends ordered the crab louie salad that was an ok portion  could have been a few ounces more, but tasted good.  My other friend ordered pancakes.  The pancakes were enourmous almost the sized of the plate.  She enjoyed every bite.

The service was good did not have to wait a long time for anything and she kept checking back with us from time to time to refill our waters.  

Overall I would come back again for the food and the fact that our dogs are welcome.
author: Jennifer H.

description: This place acts like it knows it doesn't need your business. Its right across the street from the ballpark and only survives because of the few thousand people that come to the stadium. If you want to eat at a place that will treat you like they could care less if they're failing miserably at their job and absolutely horrible customer service then this is the place for you.
author: A S.

description: This place is always packed so I figured it's got to be good. I went before the game. I ordered pastrami reuben, an all time favorite. How can you blow it? They did. Toasted bread that was hard, 2 thin slices of pastrami that was so hard, DRY and salty. Cheese? where? sauerkraut? where? $13? I was scrambling for dressing to soften the sandwich so I could eat something so I could get to the game. Someone else in the party had the Kobe burger which looked decent. Coming back,  I think not.
author: Mae S.

description:
This review is mainly for the Martini Happy hour. I did go to Momo's for dinner a couple of years ago and liked it.

Martini Happy hour (4-7pm)! All martini's are $4 and there are also $3 appetizers. The appetizers are HUGE. If you order a pizza, it is pretty much enough for a meal. And the onion strings are really good too. I think my favorite martini was the Sparkling Grape (they put champagne in it). 

Keep in mind though, that Happy Hour doesn't happen on game days (or during March madness). So make sure no big games are happening before you go.
author: Vickie D.

description:
Hmm so everyone used to come here before games (assume they still do), and it was always super crowded, but a good time!
Came for lunch the other day, to sit outside....as usual, my bloody was fairly dissapointing, but the waiter was extremely nice and friendly, and my boyfriend liked his pulled pork sandwich..
i'd say i wouldnt bother getting a bloody here, and the prices are fairly steep (the sandwich he wanted was $25, but with valet and the location, i guess its to be expected). i'll definitely plan to come back before games in the future, but for lunch, probably not..
author: Danielle J.

description:
NO STARS!!!

Who charges $45 for a service fee on CUPCAKES??
MOMO's does!!

Get this straight.. we bought our own cupcakes, we served ourselves..and THEY CHARGED us $45?!!! Oh HELL FREEEZKKK NO!!!

16 people started complaining and the manager wasn't even man enough to come out and calm our group down.

After 30 minutes of refusing to pay, they finally removed it..

Note to others: Do not bring cupcakes or else they'll charge you a fee. WTF!

PS!! Let's Go Giants! and Mo Mo's.. get out of town!
author: Emily L.

description: good for drinks before or after a game but i would not go out of my way to eat or go here. The food is average and my bartender was wasted or an idiot, took him forever to take 3 steps in any direction.
author: Caitlin F.

description:
Yelp really should allow us to put negative stars... And this would be the first one I update when Yelp has this feature!!! 

I had a reservation using Opentable.com, but when I got there the hostess said they don't have my reservation. The next table is not until 35-45min later. I show her my email confirmation on my phone, and she said ' WELL it's not on my system, so I don't have a table for you.'
