The menu was quite unimpressive.  Nothing grabbed my attention as I went down the list of entrees.  If the description alone couldn't sell, then I had very little expectation for the rest.

I chose to go with appetizers instead.  The mussels were decent, but I kept thinking that my recipe was way better.  The salad was OK.  The beef capaccio was mediocre (I prefer the more tangy version in North Beach, with much less watercress as well).  

Overall a very blah kind of food experience.
author: Jiajia C.

description:
My date and I had brunch here last Saturday.  This was my first time dining here.  I've always been curious to check this place out and was excited to be finally doing so.  Well, I was disappointed.

He ordered Scrambled Eggs and Breakfast Sausage over Cheddar Biscuit's with Mornay Sauce.  I got Murphy Eggs and Corned Beef Hash.

Upon arrival of our dishes, I wished I had ordered what he got (merely basing this on how his dish looked...way heartier than mine).  My Murphy Eggs and Corned Beef Hash was nothing spectacular.  I didn't realize that Murphy Eggs are just eggs sunny side up on toasted rye.  The corned beef hash was of huge cubes of corned beef with potatoes, and heavy on the sauce.  His order was drenched in sauce.  When I tried his dish, all I could taste was the sauce.  There was just too much sauce on everything...even on my corned beef hash =(

We also got an order of corn muffins.  It was just two muffins topped w/ a lot of butter for $6, but they were the best corn muffins I've ever had in San Francisco.  They were moist and super tasty, with fresh whole kernels of corn...mmmm.  I'd totally go back there again, just to get the corn muffins.  

Moreover, our waiter wasn't very good at refilling our glasses of water.  My date couldn't wait any longer for the water to come to us, so he went over to try to grab a pitcher himself.  He got scolded for doing so and was told to go back to his seat.  Someone came with a pitcher a couple minutes later.

Again, I'll only go back there for the corn muffins...and maybe, for some drinks before/after a game.
author: Michelle N.

description:
Company-sponsored lunch before the Giants game on Thursday.  had the Grilled Ahi Tuna Burger.  Not bad at all, with aioli sauce and ginger coleslaw.

Got very crowded though, even though our section was roped off.  Moochers who tried to crash our party because they "thought" it was part of the restaurant they could go to.  Tried to eat our food (freakin' moochers).  READ THE SIGNS people!!!

Saw the prices on the menu.  Glad our company owners have money.
author: Mario P.

description:
Great place to sit outside on the day of a ballgame or after work drinks.   The breakfast food is probably the worst meal.   Service is always good.   They have a wide variety of appetizers for that a good for gatherings with friends before heading to a game.

The place is bigger than you would expect for the outside, so the wait (if any) moves fast.  Probably the best (highest end place) to grab food before a game.
author: Jason B.

description:
We had the worst service ever from the bartender at this joint. We were a party of 6...and none of us will ever go back. What was worse...was that he knew he was being a jerk and acted like that was normal for him.  The guy had an IQ of a rock and had terrible customer service. The only time he acted decent was after he closed the bar and let all of his friends in to drink for free. 

Never again.
author: Henry H.

description: Stopped by here on the way out of town for some dinner with my wife and daughter. We are avid Giant's fans and have always been curious about this restaurant across from the ballpark, and I must say we were pleased with the service and food. We started with a lettuce wedge and the crab cakes, both of which were tasty, but I felt they were a bit overpriced. Especially the crab cakes as there were only 2 on the plate, presented very beautifully, and tasty, nonetheless we paid $17 for 2 crab cakes. I ordered the meatloaf, my wife the roasted chicken and my daughter of course a pepperoni pizza. My meatloaf was very good and tasty as was the chicken, i am not a pizza fan and therefore did not try the pizza, but my daughter seemed to enjoy it. We ended with some coffee and the apple pie which was very good as well. Service was great and the fact that they had valet service out front to help with the always difficult task of finding parking in the city was a very big plus. It is a bit pricy as we spent around $160 for the dinner for 3 of us, but overall we will definitely return.
author: Jeremy R.

description:
Unimpressed.

The food was only OK and probably not worth it for the price. There are too many other awesome restaurants in San Francisco to both returning.
author: Sydney L.

description: I like the location of MoMo's and the surrounding establishments. It does not hurt that its literally fronting the SF Giants stadium. I was here during happy hour and the drinks were okay. During the World Series events it was crazy full of people. I liked that they had an outdoor TV for fans to see. The environment during that time was awesome!
author: Russ C.

description:
Momo's is good for two things: business lunch and baseball games (especially on warm, sunny days - the patio is great). For just about anything else, it'd be way underwhelming.

Stick to the traditional basics here. For example, the chicken pot pie is tasty, but a recent shrimp and crab melt order was meh, as it featured (to my surprise) capers - really unsavory. One dessert - chocolate banana bread pudding - is fantastic. But a waitress-recommended pumpkin pie was just fine. She claimed it was crusted with pecans, but it didn't seem particularly special to me.

Service is fine, but feels a little desperate in these recession days - our waitress was a bit over-the-top with zaniness, which led me to believe she hasn't had much human interaction for a while...
author: Kiesha R.

description: Came here for a few more rounds of Spotin after pizza and an Amstell at Amici's after Oktobrefest.  The service is friendly and the atmosphere upscale yet casual and layed back.  I definitely want to come back for food and give an update.  So, for excellent beers at reasonable prices with friendly service in an upscale yet casual atmosphere, Momo's cannot be beat.  Keep up the good work guys.!
author: Brian S.

description: A bottle of red wine and Louie salad for lunch, damn that was good.
author: John W.

description:
9:20PM 
3.29.2007

I came here post-Giants victory to the Mariners.

It was ok...it felt like I was at a party after a high school basketball game circa 1999; only a little older.  Every dude in there had a fade and the girls were....eh.

At least the beers here are cheaper than AT&T Park...$7 for a Corona. 

Come here....only for convinience sake.
author: William R.

description:
Took them 50 minutes to make dinner causing us to be late to the Giant's game even though they assured us they had a fast turnaround. Mac and cheese has ham in it despite no mention of this on the menu. Corn bread muffins tasted like cardboard.

May be a good place to grab a drink before the ballgame, but skip the food.
author: Nick L.

description:
I'm not sure why this place only has a 3 star rating. I recently went there for dinner with 3 of my friends and I thought the food was absolutely amazing. There wasn't one dish that i didn't like, the service could have been a little bit better here and there but overall I had a great experience at this restaurant. 

We ordered the corn bread and mac and cheese for our sides which were so delicious. The mac and cheese was creamy and soft and then it had to perfect amount of crunch to it with the bread crumbs. The corn bread was great too. Yes they only give you two but its a side not a meal. It was sweet and salty at the same time and the texture of the bread was very good. 

For dinner we ordered the ravioli and the salmon. I'm not a huge fish person but i actually really enjoyed the salmon, it didn't have that typical fishy taste to it. Plus it was blackened or battered or something because it had such a nice crunch to it. The ravioli was so delicious with mushrooms and the pomodoro sauce. I loved it. 

Then there was desert. We ordered the chocolate cake. It was good but I have had better. 

Overall i thought that the meal was delicious the service was pretty good and I would definitely go back here for dinner again.
author: Samantha T.

description: This is the place to go to after a giants game for a beer. The place is trendy, but that's all it is. The food is is ok and once again your paying for location. Overall it's not too bad,
author: Russell T.

description: Great drinks, food, and atmosphere... The staff is spot on and very accommodating!
author: Anthony C.

description:
Definitely avoid MoMos unless you want food poisoning.  

I was there on Dec 9th, had their famous steak and got very, very sick that same night.  Food poisoning...bad.  

I called the manager two days later to inform him.  He was a little defensive, but ended up offering to send a gift certificate to make good.  Two weeks later and I still have yet to receive this, so I guess 'making good' with customers is not a priority at MoMos.

Worse thing is that I live in the neighborbood, which I explained to the manager.  You would think he'd bend over backwards to 'make good' with someone who lives a couple blocks away.

So, no more MoMos (and I guess Pete's Tavern for that matter) for me.  And I highly recommend avoiding it to others given this experience.  I have also been asking around, and it seems that getting food poison at MoMo's is not such a rare thing.

You have been warned, so dine at your own risk at MoMos.  And if you get sick, don't expect any action or even understanding from the manager....not even if you live in the neighborhood!
author: Brian W.

description:
I have been to Momos three times.  Two times I wasn't paying, and one time I was. Two of my experiences were fantastic, and one was disappointing.  Can you match the trips?

Momo's is very expensive. The first time I went I was treated to a wide variety of different appetizers that were delicious.  The fresh bread was fantastic, and you really cant go wrong with the appetizers. I had the Margherita Pizza and a Salad. I was a little disappointed with the salad, but I really liked the pizza. 

When I went and paid for myself, I was shocked by the small amount of food I got for the price. My date got a "specialty" meal which ended up costing upwards of thirty dollars. Remember the specialties will probably cost more than the listed menu items, but if you are considering Momo's, price probably isn't too much of a problem.  You'll love the food, if you can afford it!
author: Jay S.

description:
I have had both good and bad luck here in regards to the food and service; it's really hit and miss. I live close to Momo's and have a dog (they are very dog friendly) so i stop in once every few weeks with my pet for lunch or brunch. They always bring water in a bowl for the dog.  :-) 

Food is OK but not horrible.  I would recommend staying away from anything with a cheese sauce.  it is always broken and oily. Price is in the 23.00 -26.00 range for most meals.  I wouldn't go out of my way to eat here but if you find your self in the area and want food you could do worse in SOMA.
author: Brian K.

description:
Ok so I have been to Momo's for pregame drinks, and it's quite the "scene." My grandma surprised me by telling me that before she dies, she would like to eat at Momo's. That is a direct quote. I was pretty surprised to hear that random comment, and we quickly took her there for her birthday two weeks later. We arrived at 12 and were one of four parties at the restaurant. Service was HORRIBLE! I have never seen service that slow, inattentive, or snobby. We were probably there for 20 minutes before we could order, had to beg for coffee refills after our
 food had been delivered, and I had to go ask a cook for the bill finally. Food was forgettable, service was definitely memorable for all the wrong reasons, and the whole experienced was a disappointment. 

I'll drink an overpriced margarita out front but will never eat inside again, my poor grandma wasted her bday meal at that place. bleh.
author: Kassaundra G.

description: Just ate their last night with my family. great food and service. really liked the steak dinner and the mashed potatoes.
author: Ben L.

description:
Going to a Giant's game and found Pete's to be too crowded, try Momo's.  The outdoor patio on a warm day is pretty fun, but we live in San Francisco folks...those days are few and far between.  Everyone who knows better knows that sunny does not equal warm so don't run the risk of outdoor seating and heat lamps if you're coming for dinner.

The food at Momo's is good, but overpriced.  Stick to well priced options like the burger or pizza unless you want to shell out $30 for an entree that should really cost $15.  I like Momo's only for a drink before the Giants game and that's largely because the place is across the street from the left field gate.
author: John M.

description:
ok ew
-1 for not having the patio set up on a sunny saturday afternoon.
-1 for allowing dogs inside the bar (I don't care if it is your friend I don't want your damn mutt under my feet while trying to eat)
-1 for saying sit whever and then having no servers come by
-1 for waving us over to pick up our own drinks
-1 for my watered down flat vodka soda. (yes people soda water has bubble usually)
-1 for way too expensive for the size of the drinks
-1 for the gross bathrooms
-1 for the attitude of the hostess who acted like we were asking her to perform brain surgery when we asked if they were closing early (since there seemed to be no waiters anywhere)
-1 for the bartender being too busy flirting with a group of girls who looked like they were 16 ( I know they weren't 21 because they had a giggle fest about getting served under age in the bathroom)
-1 for the clientele there this day ( I know you shouldn't judge a bar by its patrons but hell what else is a bar?)

Came here after warped tour to sit down and relax with my two friends and frankly I was like wtf? This place gets such great reveiws maybe they only try on giants game days? W/e it is I def will not be back with so many other options in the area that havn't sucked.
author: Meg N.

description: I have eaten here before and it was mediocre, but went with some friends because they wanted to go.  Everyone's meals were very poorly done.  Chicken very dried out, fish overcooked, and the gumbo tasted like it had been made a week before.  In fairness, the service was pretty good, but would not return.
author: R R.

description: Happy Hour is the best! Nice list of cocktails--sit outside if the weather permits.
author: Wendy B.

description: This restaurant will go down in my memory as the first one I encountered which charges 3.5% (something like that) tax to fund their requirement to provide their workers with health benefits. At the time, my old manager who was also there suggested that people would consider reducing the tip amount they leave because of this.
author: H K.

description:
Is it just me, but every time I come here before or after a game I feel like I'm surrounded by A's fans in Giants gear...

Do real Giants fans come here?  

I give this place one star for the outside patio.....otherwise the service is terrible and the drinks are inconsistent.  All I can say is if you can't make the same drink taste the same twice in a row you shouldn't be in business.  This place has Kobe Bryant written all over it...,  Just as Kobe will never be a winner without Shaq..., Momo's will never be a winner without the Giants!

This place is killing me!  Every time I leave here to watch me beloved Giants, I can't help from thinking, "Are you freakin kidding me!"...  I just have to laugh..
author: Mark I.

description: OK Momo's...you're forgiven.  You get an additional star for the your non-gameday Martini Hour (4-7 Mon-Fri).  Martinis are $4 each and some apps are only $3 (tasty margherita pizza).  Yay!  There are some other apps for a little more but they all looked mouth-watering.
author: Nina L.

description:
Are you choking on your blood yet!!!  Die!  As the fat lady sang!
That was the best part of the Opera we saw on the big screen at ATT Park.  Too bad we didn't see much before that.  Free opera that was simulcast live from the SF Opera House really drew in the crowd that created a line around the ball park at 630.  

We were like "Forget that - Lines are for suckas!!!".  So we went across the street to Momo's and decided to have dinner.  Economy must be really bad when we can get seated right away at 7pm on a Sat night.  The ol lady had the linguine and clams.. a little disappointing as they used the same flat egg noodle that is used sometimes in Chinese soups, like Wonton Noodle soup.  It was like they decided to dump their clams in wine sauce appetizer over some noodles.  Kinda tasty though, but the leftovers are still in our fridge 3 days later.  I had the NY Steak complete dinner $29, which is 4 bux more than just ordering the steak alone.  It included, chicken corn chowder soup-YUM, the NY Steak which was perfectly done and extremely tasty with some au gratin tatoes-yum again.  Had a side of mac n cheez, which had chunks of ham in it baked individually, not the best, but damn good.  And also a dessert was included which was the choco volcano and ordered a side scoop of ice cream.. which required the belt to be let out 2 notches.  With 2 waters, we got outa there for $67 including a tip for great attentive service.

We made it to show sometime after half time for the opera and scored great seats.  Ya, no line at all.  That's plenty of opera for any one person.  Been here after the games a many a times too.  Great drinks and appetizers- good pizza and nachos.  Parking is ridiculous, especially with the new meter system.
author: Jon W.

description: I was expecting this place to be a sloppy disaster because of it's proximity to the ballpark. But it was actually really nice -- EXCELLENT happy hour specials (martinis/wine/beer and appetizers) from 4-7 pm. If you're going with a large group, make a reservation.
author: Sarah B.

description: I came here to watch parts of the World Cup with some coworkers for lunch. Pretty pricey place for the quality of food. We just ordered the turkey sandwiches and the soup. From the outside appearance, MoMo's seems like a semi-dressy sit-down place; however, the food they serve proves otherwise. Typical American dining: sandwiches, fries, potato chips but with nice napkins and a fancy looking bar.
author: D S.

description: MoMo's is a good place for dinner around the area, though it is crowded during the Giants season. They play Giants games, and if you don't have a ticket to watch the game at the ballpark, this place is the best to go. The food is a bit pricey. It's a good place to go for a drink and to just chill with friends.
author: Alina R.

description: I cant comment on the food cause I've never eaten here before. I did however come here for a few drinks with my friends before we went to a Giants game. Being a game day, the bar here was PACKED BIGTIME. And yet, it didn't take more than 3 minutes to have our drinks in our hands. My long island ice tea was deadly! I saw the ridiculous amount of alcohol the bartender put in it, and yet you couldn't taste the alcohol at all. Needless to say, after just 2 drinks I was done drinking for the night! No 7th inning beer- nada. And it was all reasonably priced- for San Francisco!
author: David D.

description: I gave Momos one star because there was nothing less to give them. We live across the street from Momos and have been going there for several years. The service is never consistent. Our neighbors refuse to go because of their bad experiences and tonight we had some of the same. My wife and I arrived at 5:45 and sat outside next to a group of people. The place was not that busy. The server that was taking care of the table next to us, ignored us for almost 20 minutes. My wife went into the bar to order a drink and was ignored by the bar tender as well. The only service that came our way was a bus person who cleared our table but never wiped it down. I asked to speak to the manager an relayed our experience. We will never return and feel that we need to share our experience. Beware!!!!!!!
author: earle s.

description: I love this place! I wonder why the reviews aren't higher.  We came here for saturday brunch.  They accommodated our group of 15+ AND three dogs.  Their service was SO superb that they even regularly came by to give our dogs a water bowl with water and treats.. You cant' find that anywhere!  I had their salmon with scrambled eggs on flat bread.  SO YUMMMMYYyy and also their mimosas are great.  I would take anyone visiting from out of town here too because it is right across from the ball park!!!
author: Stephanie C.

description: I'm a big fan of happy hour, so I was already excited to try out momo's happy hour.  You can imagine my excitement when I learned that because it was a Thursday, the drinks were discounted even more. it was like I was meant to attend happy hour that day.  The drinks are a bit on the strong side, with cute names to them.  You have to order all your drinks and food at the bar, which isn't much of a problem when they're not busy.  i got to catch up with some friends, grab a quick drink, and walk back with just enough time to catch my shuttle back to bart.  needless to say, it was the perfect ending to a really long work day.
author: Lucy W.

description: Location is great, right across from AT&T park... Good for people watching. Don't understand the extremley overpriced food... Not worth eating just come here for a pre-game drink.
author: Meredith A.

description: I went there for lunch yesterday and I don't remember having such bad service. The waitress with the ponytail didn't even apologize when I spoke up and complained. I will never go back either.
author: Robin S.

description:
I have an attachment to MoMo's that is purely sentimental. The food certainly doesn't warrant it. It's decent, but over-priced for what it is.

MoMo's has extensive outdoor and indoor seating. I can't say much for the atmosphere, which is slightly impersonal. If you're looking for food before a ballgame, it's definitely a cut above what you'll eat in the park. 

Their salads are large and well-prepared, but the vinaigrettes are sugary. The organic mixed baby greens with candied walnuts is far too sweet. 
The MoMo's Louis with Bay Shrimp had a similarly sweet note.

The burger is good. I'd stick to bar food here, which is the reason the price tag is just a little too high.
author: Simone E.

description:
casual digs for comfort food.

it's not gonna be pretty.  it's not going to be cheap since it's on the embarcadero near the ball park.  and who are we kidding?... it's not going to be fine dining.

but if you are in the neighborhood and want something fried, swing on by.

a group of work folk lost a bet and took the winners out for lunch here.  it was sunny and so we basked in the sun and glory of the win out on the patio.

half of the table ordered the buffalo chicken sandwich.  it looked delicious but i can't eat chicken so i ordered the philly cheese steak sandwich with crispy onion strings.  it was disgustingly gooey, greasy, and fattening.  in other words, yummy.

wash it down with some iced diet coke and i was feeling that boy, victory sure is sweet.
author: Anh V.

description:
If you like raw pancake batter, then I may I suggest brunch at Momo's?

I went to brunch with my family a year ago and ordered pancakes, a seemingly benign decision. 
How difficult is it to make pancakes? 

The buttermillk pancakes I ordered arrived several minutes after the rest of my family had received their meals. And though they had a lovely golden exterior, I dug in with my fork only to discover it was just a thin shell of cooked pancake with raw pancake batter filling. I don't even understand how they transferred the pancakes to the plate without them bursting open and oozing out. 

The waiter kindly took the uncooked food back to the kitchen for me. 10 minutes later he returned with another piping hot plate of pancakes. I again proceeded to dig in and AGAIN the pancackes were raw inside. YUCK! 

After that I ordered some toast instead. The toast arrived not only burnt, but cold and the waiter didn't offer me butter or anything else to put on my burnt, cold toast. 
Needless to say, I needed to get something to eat after brunch at Momo's.

MOMO'S IS TERRIBLE. I WILL NEVER EAT HERE AGAIN. 
They don't even deserve one single star but I had to give them one in order to post this review.
author: Nichole K.

description:
Random stop-in on a weekday evening.  The place was busy but not packed, and they seated us immediately.

Things I'm giving stars for:  
- the food was very good; felt fresh and not too fussy
- most of the staff's attitude
- the space, which is open and light; managing to feel smart without being stuffy

Things I'm taking stars off for:
- the fact that our jolly waiter was so busy being jolly he forgot to bring our drinks
- the fact that our jolly waiter, despite us asking him if we'd be better sharing a starter, was so enthusiastic for us to have one each we ended up feeling full before our main course
- the fact that our jolly waiter asked how the meal was, and was already three or four steps away before I'd even started to respond.

It's odd really, I remember quite liking the waiter for his personality, but in retrospect, everything I felt let the place down was in his actual service.
author: Jon M.

description: Didn't realize it was so late on Monday when I was searching for a lunch place. Momo's was the only place open. I have a ton of dietary restrictions and didn't really find anything on the menu. I asked to see the dinner menu, but the waitress asked what I was looking for. The chef was able to grill me up a variety of vegis and added some basmati rice. It was great, and greatly appreciated. The service was a bit slow, considering that there were hardly any patrons in the restaurant. I don't think I would make Momo's a go to place, but decent none the less.
author: Ginger K.

description: Gosh. I really REALLY want to like you Momo's. But once again, I feel somewhat let down. Not that my huevos rancheros wasn't tasty-but it wasn't hot. And like the last time I ate there, the service wasn't top notch. I had to ask a water guy to find our waitress so we could pay the bill. And the restaurant wasn't even half full. WIth the Public House in play, I think i'm probably going to stay on the other side of King St from now on.
author: Melanie L.

description: Every time I go to the ball park I make a reservation at MOMO's . Last weekend when the Giant's were playing I started my day with Brunch at Momo's munching on onion strings and Amazing Mac & Cheese. Sipping  $5 dollar mimosa's I watched the craziness outside while enjoying the speed ans efficiency of the restaurant inside. I am always happy with this place wish it was closer so I could go there more often!
author: Kris M.

description: This place is overpriced and over-rated.  Only reason they get hype is because they're located right across the street from AT&T Park.  Place gets poppin on warm nights after Giants games.
author: Chris T.

description:
I've never had a bad meal at MoMo's.  Their outdoor seating only adds to the great food.  As long as you don't go when the Giant's are playing, you can enjoy a nice lunch/dinner.  Make sure you order the Mac and Cheese.  I'm a huge fan of the classics.  My friend loved the tuna tartar (sp?)

If you do end up there for Giant's game, the outdoor patio turns in to a great party scene.  All in all, I love this place and would highly recommend it.
author: David B.

description: Great place to have a beer before a G game.  Food is ok, its gone downhill over the years.  Service needs work.
author: Demanding T.

description: Went here for a company holiday party. Group of 12+ folks and we had an awesome evening. I've seen the place several times going to/from a Giants game and was always a popular looking place. We had a few martini's in the bar before we were seated.  I had the NY Steak dinner and the steak was delicious. I actually ate the side of spinach. We had some great wines and our server was very attentive especially considering the size of our group. That was the best steak I've had in the city in the last year at a restaurant, but I haven't been to many steak houses.
author: Ryan D.

description:
I used to refer to an old, old, old ex's new girlfriend as MoMo. Why? Because it sounded right. Because homegirl sucked like a Hoover Elite. It was an insult to me that he took up with a BigEasy like that after breaking up with me.
MoMo's the restaurant has the same things going for it: It sucks and it kind of plays hooker to the schmoes getting rowdy pre-Giants game. 
This place is enough to send someone with social anxiety into 72 hours of observation in a psych ward. It's enough to get my heart beating and my  palms sweaty, just trying to figure out how the hell to navigate through a crowd like the pre-game crowds. 
The food is an atrocity, the drinks are just for show, and the staff need a training or four about customer service. Me to waitress: You. Work. Here. Now put those boobs away, stop flirting with Oaktown and Fremont over there, and get me my goddam drink! 
Oh, and note to obnoxious drunk losers talking about  my ass while I was trying to unearth the bathroom from the pile of hoochies waiting in line: You are not cute when you're sober. You are especially not cute when you're drunk and obnoxious. You are lucky I had to pee so bad or I would have given you a lesson about how to talk to a lady.
That's MoMo's.
author: Autumn K.

description:
a fun place to get a heat-on before or after the ballgame at Pac Bell/SBC/AT&T whatever in the hell the park is named now. the crowd is mostly attractive, thank the Lord the fuglies steer clear, low self-esteem keeps them away perhaps. we all know they prefer the shithole Mission anyway. it's so much more pleasant to be surrounded by lovely drunk people rather than drunkies resembling orcs.

the man was complaining about the price, surprise surprise. this is damn overpriced SF after all. we spent over $100 on 7 premium cocktails, fried calamari and oyster apps. I told him we should have gone for happy hour but nooooooooooo. wah wah wah wah wah. but I would most def come back . . . W/OUT the man next time.
author: Prima D.

description: Love going here before and after the giants game but that's pretty much it. The food is not the best and is overpriced. I've had the steak and it was over cooked. Yuck! I'd rather wait until I get inside the club level to get food. There's a full service bar inside outside on the patio however getting drinks is still a pain. Drinks are a little overpriced too but  I have gotten some that were pretty damn strong. It does get packed before the games and there have been times where a giants fan and an opposing team's fan gets into it. What sucks is they close so early too, 10 pm on a weekend? I guess.
author: Lola L.

description: A great place to meet people before a game if you don't ever want to be able to find them and want to be surrounded by tools. Go to 21st Amendment instead...
author: Todd E.

description:
i had donated a wad of cash to a charity in the east bay - bay area crisis nursery - and as part of the stuff that they gave me as a 'thank you' was a gift cert for MoMo's.... it expired in mid-November and the girlfriend had never been so we prioritized making it out there before the cert expired. 

we stopped into Bacar for a round of wine before going into Momo's and it was pretty much as i remembered it.  nothing special but it is right across from the ball park and it isn't that bad.  the bruchetta appetizer and the caesar salad were both very large so it's a good thing that me and the 90 pound GF decided to share the short rib entree with the gigantic mound of mash and huge helping of brussel sprouts.  we didn't even come close to finishing the entree.  it was pretty big and the bruschetta with proscuitto was lasge, as i've already said.  

in any case, nothing was terrible out of the ordinary - either on the positive or negative side.  the big screen tv's were relegated to the bar area which was nice so we weren't assaulted by images of the world series while trying to eat.  the place doesn't get much business when the baseball season is done so we had no trouble getting a seat.  service was decent but not exactly world class.  the waiter actually brought back our short rib in a doggie bag, plopped it on the table in front of us and THEN asked if we wanted dessert.  pretty funny actually.  dessert was likewise decent.  nothing wrong with the place but not fine dining or anything.  GF wasn't very impressed either but nothing extraordinary to complain about either.
author: dan h.

description: Came here for brunch one Sunday but ended up having more of a lunch. I ordered a ceviche, which was good...compared to other places I've had ceviche this one was above average. I also had a decent chicken ceaser salad, which was pretty big and reasonably priced.
author: Alyssa G.

description: I went with a friend I haven't seen in a while. It was a good place to make conversation over food and drinks. The servers were easily accessible and the dim lighting was nice. The menu was picky eater friendly and worked out for me since I am a picky eater. lol I had the meatloaf with mashed potatoes and mushroom gravy. My companion had the blackened salmon with andouille jambalaya, and sauteed corn. Both dishes came with greens. I was able to try his dish as well. I liked them both and I would go back and order either of them again if at that point I'm not in the mood to try something new.
author: Tanyamarie A.

description: Went here for lunch with co-workers from time to time.  The food is overpriced and not very good.  We stopped going here after giving them enough chances; hoping our experience would improve over time.  Didn't happen.
author: Flory T.

description: This is a great place for brunch especially if you come very early in the morning.  The service is good and the food is excellent!  It's a little bit pricy (most brunch dishes are about $14) but the portions are pretty sizable.
author: Carmen M.

description: Momo's is generally full of a-holes. On the plus side, it is super convenient for the ballpark. Also on the plus side, last week I saw one of said a-holes tossed out down the wheelchair ramp. He responded by throwing his own flip-flop back into the restaurant, then asked for it back. I'll go back for that kind of atmosphere.
author: Nick K.

description: I've eaten at Momo's a few times, and in general the food's been pretty appetizing, but nothing spectacular. My favorite time to go to this place is after a baseball game at SBC Park - while drinks seem to borrow from the stadium's pricing ($6 beers), it's pretty fun to hang out on the patio with a boisterous group of Giants fans as the crowds disperse after a game.
author: Nish N.

description: I try to stay away from this place during Giants games. Actually, in general. It's not really my scene. But went there with the mom on a warm night and sat outside, which was pretty nice. When it's not too crowded, I like it fine. Service was a little slow, I think because the general air of the place is pretty ambivalent toward me and my ilk. The elegant dining room is a wierd contrast with the raging crowds of barely-legal tramps and college guys that this place attracts. The appetizers are okay, and you're better off sharing a few than wasting $30 on one mediocre entree. At $15 per plate, the appetizers should really be better than they are, though. The coconut rock shrimp with chili dipping sauce are straight out of a Miami tourist trap, and the marinated beet salad is just a plate of incongruent tastes. Weak drinks.
author: Megan W.

description:
what is the meaning of the SAN FRANCISCO HEALTH CARE SECURITY ORDINANCE surcharge and what does it have to do with my fried onion strings?

3 stars less 1 due to poor value and mysterious surcharge.  

recommended:  crab salad and onion strings.
author: Josie M.

description: My friend and i decided to check out something nearby before we caught the bus to the treasure island muzik festival.  Well.... we were one of the only tables besides a few that came after us.  I had some of the best eggs benedict i have ever tasted.  Good morning cocktails! and the service was perfect.  I had never ventured down to this area but it is quite nice and quiet as well.  I will be returning soon.
author: Michelle M.

description:
not my scene......but i will say its a good spot for ny steak.   love their ny pre-fix 3 course dinner for $29.99!!!!  
- 1st course choice of soup of the day or salad
- 2nd course ny steak w/potatoes au gratin & spinach.......one of "the best" ny steaks (huge, juicy, tender)  w/the best accompaniments -- rich, cheesy potatoes & the sauteed spinach helps neutralize the richness.........
- 3rd course.....good ole fashion vanilla sundae with fudge topping & nuts

the pomegranate lemon drop was a nice start.

had their margherita pizza & burger before....but eh, nothing to write home about...........

hub & my brother got the ny steak pre-fixe special last time......i never order a full steak entree for myself but next time i'll definitely get the ny pre-fix special all to myself...

great convenient spot to grab dinner before or after the game....
author: Cindi N.

description: Perfect place before a game!  We had brunch for Sunday's game and were not disappointed.  The best part is that actually take reservations so you can plan ahead.  The eggs, cheddar biscuits, and sausage were great.  My boyfriend had the salmon flatbread dish and loved it.  We are going back next week before the game.  Great!
author: Kim D.

description:
The food here is extremely mediocre(much like Cheesecake Factory) except they have the nerve to charge twice as much as other mediocre food places. Sometimes their herb chicken is very good with it being juicy and fresh, but that's about it. Pesto mashed potatoes? Sour. Steak and meatloaf? Bland. Heirloom and mozzarella salad? Blah.

It was my father's birthday this past Tuesday and my sister and I made the mistake of coming here because our first choice restaurant was closed. We had the rudest, most negligent, and incompetent waiter. He did not come to our table for at least 10 minutes. When he finally showed, it was to tell us he would be back later. Might I mention that this was an extremely slow night with the restaurant almost 90% empty? 

When he took our orders, he was blatantly condescending and even attempted to correct the way my husband ordered wine--except that he "corrected" him with the wrong pronunciation. He also managed to step on my husband's foot for a good 5 seconds and didn't apologize. I had ordered a side of pesto mashed potatoes. It was untouched, but this idiotic asshole took it away from me without asking if I was finished with it or if I wanted it boxed. Before I could tell the dumbass I wanted it boxed, he threw a plate ONTO my side dish. "I actually wanted that boxed." I told him. "Okay." he replied, as he piled a 2nd plate onto the first. I must've given him a dirty look because only then did he take both plates off my then very squashed side dish.  We were initially planning on dessert, but I was so livid, the only thing I wanted to do was murder our waiter. At the end of the evening, the motherfucking asshole wordlessly placed the check in the middle of the table and left. My sister was nice enough to still tip that incompetent piece of shit. Because I was splitting with her, I ended up tipping by default. Talk about major regrets. 

The only reason it gets a second star is because the service is usually not that atrocious(judging from the last 2 times I've been there), and their hostesses are consistently great.
author: Faye S.

description: Words of advice: if you're coming from the East Bay to this area take BART. Finding parking around here is like looking for a SF Giants World Series trophy. Good mix of Cougars and Kittens at this place. I just hate getting blamed by pissed off middle aged women for disrespecting them by shouting "Cougar!" when my friend Chris does it and looks away. They look at me and think I did it then I have to explain myself while hearing Chris' evil laugh in the background. This is the spot during the Bay Bridge series every year. I'll be there with a Maker's and coke in hand.
author: Erik W.

description: This review is for drinks only.  I guess if you need to get a drink across from the ball yard this is THE place, but the pour is quite small, martinis that are singles and almost an inch below the rim of the glass and a simply shot of dewars at $11.  I thought prices were high, bartender not very friendly and it was not busy when we were there so its not like they had an excuse.  Seeing a pizza that someone was eating and having read the reviews on the food, I can't imagine wanting to eat here.  I won't be going back.
author: Andrew C.

description: Yesterday I had the misfortunate of having dinner at MoMo across from ATT Park on the first night of the season of baseball.  What a rip off.  They gave me 3 oz's of tomato in a small wine glass and charged $3.00  The food was over-salted.  I brought this to the attention of the waiter.  He did nothing.  I paid my bill and took the left over food home to feed the wild turkey vultures as it is not good for much else.  I notified the owner.  He hid from me with two of his buddies and then gave me to the newly hired manager who did nothing.  My partner and I having been going to MoMo's since they opened in 2000 and BoomBoom was the receptionist.  We sold our seats in 2007.  So this is 7 years of eating at MoMo twice a month.  They don't care.  They have business now with the Giants winning the World Series.  My advice, go somewhere else.  Anywhere unless you want to get ripoff.(The bar is good for meeting people)  Otherwise save your money for the second rip off, ATT Park.  Another place for high price crappie food.
author: Natasha P.

description: This place is very 'social'.  I have been there twice now, last time was on June 13, just before the Giant's vs. A's game.  The patio was packed, we didn't make a reservation, so we ate at the bar.  Crowd was friendly, fun, & festive.  Again, we only ordered from the appetizer menu to share (for two) as that is a really economical way to determine if you like a place or not.  I liked both dishes, the ceviche and 1/2 dozen oysters.  The food was really good and the Bloody Mary's were zippy.  If you like beer, eat here.  They have a host of choices on tap.  I recommend this eaterie for a place to have fun with friends.  But for a romantic evening, maybe not.
author: Arturo S.

description: On the pricier side for lunch, but still good. The red currant iced tea was great. Also of note are the french fries which have a nice cakey batter. The Buffalo chicken sandwich is the real deal. Its not heavy on the fried, but is definitely heavy on the heat. They must drench the chicken in the sauce, because that could be the spiciest buffalo chicken I've ever had. They also obviously have outdoor seating which never hurts...
author: Nicolas H.

description: This place is bullshit they kick people out for no reason then when u tell them to let you get your purse they tell you come back in the morning after someone steels your shit look I get it if your faded and causing problems but dude to kick you out for nothing really. Anyways if u choose to go here keep your purse attached to you at all times you never know when they will kick you out
author: Jeni Z.

description:
good/decent.  that's all this place is.  which is fine, better than being 2-star terrible.  the hostess was very accomodating as i walked in with a table for 4 and then bumped it up to 5 and then once more to 6.  so they were good in that respect.

i was initially drawn to this place because of the "chocolate brioche banana bread pudding" on their DAT menu, so i made sure i had enough room in my tummy for that at the end.  just got the crab cakes appetizer and a cocktail.  cocktail was super strong like whoa.  and the crab cakes were decently filling.  good size considering they were just an appetizer.  very meaty, and like the server said, not too much bread filler.  so that part was good (they weren't awesome to the point of making me go back for more though).

and i was all excited for the dessert!  but was pretty much let down.  it was nothing like i had imagined.  it was just regular banana bread pudding, obviously sliced out from a big pan of the stuff and then drizzled with chocolate and/or caramel sauce.  i left unsatisfied, but not dissatisfied.
author: spiff e.

description:
Terrible!
I had the pizza, and it was horrible--burnt! 
The service sucked, too. Totally overpriced. Skip it!

OH. PS. When they wiped the crumbs off the table, they wiped them right onto the floor! Seriously weird.
author: Anna J.

description: We went here for the first time after the MLB All Star events and it was packed! Definitely the place to be if your a sports fan who wants great food! Location, location, location...right accross from AT&T Park...awesome! The food was very good and the service was fantastic. We were seated far from the TV during the All Star Game and we requested to be seated closer to the screen and they made arrangements for us to be very close to the action, very nice of them! We will go back, you should go to!
author: Jason F.

description: I give it one star because food was mediocre, you pay a lot for the amount of you food you get. And my waitress wasn't very responsive to us. I had to ask twice to get a refill on my drink.
author: Julie A.

description:
I went to Momos before a show expecting it to be bad because it's next to the ballpark. It was great! 

The waitress was so nice. Tuna appetizer and hummus were fantastic. Drinks were great too. I had the fish special which was pretty good.

The only downsides were that it took a long time (I think it was because everyone was seeing the same show so everyone came in at the same time) and the appetizers were 5 stars but entrees only 3.

I'll be back!
author: Alexandra M.

description: Dunno about the food (besides the free bread that was warm, fresh, and yummy) but the bloody marys were pretty good...SPICY. we sat outside which is nice on a sunny day and the waitress was very nice.
author: Hanan H.

description: Didn't eat here but they had really good drinks and the staff was hella cool.  Staff keeps it real Oakland!
author: Ronnie D.

description:
somehow, venn diagrams made their way into tonight's happy hour conversation.  (leave it to an ex math team member, i suppose.  hah.)

let's construct momo's idea of customer service in a venn diagram:

set A - not too crowded of an establishment when the giants aren't playing
set B - heat lamps conveniently adorn an elevated patio
set C - easy enough to get a drink
set D - cocktails are reasonably priced

sets A and B are concentric.  sets C and D reside on mars.  
$10.50 for a cranberry grey goose (which i did NOT buy).
the calamari was so-so.
it was like pulling teeth trying to get the bartender's attention.  
closed my friend's tab w/o her consent.

...i hope your bartending skills are better during baseball season.
author: Ting A.

description: Momo's worked out for us for brunch today.  The weather was fantastic so the location could not have been better.  The food is nothing you haven't seen before but it was tasty and the people watching is interesting.  The crowd seems to be a cross between sports nuts, Marina types, and locals who want to take their friends or parents somewhere nice.  I felt a little sorry for the alt-dude who was with his upper-middle-class parents and their little dog.  He clearly didn't fit in, but hey, you gots to take the parents somewhere.
author: Denise G.

description: Just went here for a pre-game father's day brunch. At first I thought the prices were a little on the high-side, but when the food came out, I understood. We ordered the bruschetta and pancetta wrapped prawns as starters and the salmon flatbread and scrambled eggs with biscuit entrees. It was the perfect brunch selection. Everything looked and tasted great. Service was very good, especially for the patio. For the price, the food is a lot better than across the street in the stadium. Worth it before or after a game.
author: Jeffrey Y.

description: Came here for a quick bite and a beer.  It was pretty good and not too expensive.  All we had was the Ahi-Tuna Tartart (sp?) and it was DELICIOUS.  So refreshing.  The Coronas washed it down quite nicely as well.  We'll be back.
author: Noneya B.

description: The food here is actually pretty good, probably deserving of 3.5 stars.  The onion strings are very good (though not in the same league as Rigolo's) and I really like the eggs & smoked salmon flatbread.  But the service is atrocious.  We saw our onion strings sitting on a counter for about ten minutes before they were brought to us.  And we were left waiting to order and any time we need to talk to the server for ages.  Our kids liked the food, but are not nearly patient enough for the service.
author: Paul H.

description: Lightning fast lunch spot when there's no ballpark crowd.  I had the ahi tuna sandwich, cooked perfectly, topped with a unique slaw on a toasted bun, and my friend had the prawn gumbo, a giant platter that he got all the way through.  Friendly service, fair prices, outside seating - what's not to like?
author: Matt S.

description: I love the location, right across from AT&T Park. The food is pretty good. They have a good Cobb Salad, Meatloaf, and really good chocolate chip cookies. Dont go on a game night it is packed.
author: Steven C.

description: My wife and I went here on Sunday afternoon. Both meals were OK, not great. She had the French Dip and I had the Grilled Chicken sandwich. I also had the French Onion soup which was very good. Overall impression was medium.
author: Mark C.

description: No way.  Not a good place for a meal. Food is way overpriced and the service was slow--wasn't busy at the time either.  Portions are good but the food itself didn't justify the price. Caesar salad had way too much cheese and the Roast Chicken was very plain plus drowning the bird in packaged gravy didn't help.  The fried calamari appetizer was pretty good though so this could possibly be a good place for drinks / appetizers before a game since its across the street from the Park. But for lunch/dinner, you're better off going somewhere else.
author: Ed C.

description: What can I say!  Momo's is a low-key comfort food favorite of mine.  It's warm and not too pretentious or noisey(very wide open with high ceilings & floors are accoustically carpeted).  It's not crazy-exciting or anything but aside from that, what's not to like as it is right across from one of the best ball parks in the country.  The food is very good  and the staff has been adequate if not great.  It's a bit pricey but when you think of the lo-cal, and those wonderfull scallop and fish dishes, it's really not so.  I've been a few times for lunch only and have never been dissapointed with the food.  I'd have to say Momo's is probably better for business lunches or just chillin' with the Mr. or Mrs. than for an exciting prelude to a wild party night unless it's a Giants game.  Cheers!
author: Tim F.

description: Really good calamari and great eggs benedict!  Sat outside on the patio, which is a great place to people watch.  AT&T Park is across the street as well as the train stop.
author: Byron W.

description: Never again. My husband and i had lunch here 12/28 and the place was pretty dead, maybe 4 other tables, tops. We had drinks, apps, and lunch. I gave this place 2 stars because the food was good but the service was terrible. The waiter was rude, service was slow, our drinks did not appear until way after our meal?!?  They didn't even bother clearing our dirty dishes from the appetizers.  Our water looked put out to have to serve us, not hanks there are too many good places to eat to waste time here. The people working here need some serious customer service training, especially the hostess.
author: h. d.

description: Being across from the ball park, you would think this place is a tourist trap, but it's not! I went there late one night with a friend just to get some desert, and we were both presently surprised. We had walked past this place a bazillion times and never bothered to go in. I don't know what the food is like (other than the fact that is looked and smelled great), but the desert is amazing. We shared the apple tarte and the chocolate volcano. The apple tarte was on a beautiful soft flaky crust, with thin slices of apples cooked to perfection, smothered in a buttery caramel sauce. The volcano cake was perfectly crunchy on the outside with flowing warm chocolate on the inside. Two dishes that most restaurants screw up, and they nailed them!
author: Aly O.

description: rude lady at the front with the short blond hair, learn how to greet customers and smile... if you cannot manage that... find yourself another job or ask them to put you somewhere in the back where no one has to see your unpleasant self. i had heard marvelous things about this place and i was utterly disappointed by our unfriendly welcoming and her cold demeanor. definitely seemed like we interrupted her hectic night... (only 2 other parties in the dining area). i will definitely NEVER return here. what a waste.
author: S B.

description: Came here for lunch on a non-game day...and it was okay.  Overpriced, but the quality was pretty good for down-home cuisine.  The calamari had the perfect balance of crunch and chew.  My pulled pork sandwich was perfect and my friend's mac-n-cheese was tasty.  Service was prompt...but I still don't think I'd be back mainly because it lacked the bang for the buck.
author: Mark D.

description: In defense of poor, maligned momo's, last night (non-game night) it was mostly empty, the service was fine, and the food was damn good.  Not really my style so much, but the beer was cold and the food came out like instantly.  No complaints.
author: Scott C.

description: I have tried the appetizers and drinks, but never dined here. It looks good, and always busy during SF Giants games. The patio is a great place to hang out
author: Gabriel B.

description: My nickname is MoMo, so I just *HAD* to come here. The food was great, the service was excellent and the place wasn't crowded at all. This is a really classy place to come to if it's *NOT* on a game day.If you come on a day when the Giants are playing, you get what you pay for: loud, drunk frats and shitty service from overworked servers. Oh yeah, and beer in plastic cups!
author: Maurice R.

description: Went there for a reunion and the service was impeccable. They gave us a private room with approximately 7 tables with room for 6 at each table. More people showed then were expected and the staff did a fantastic job of bringing in more chairs, flatware, plates , and drinks etc. The steak was perfect and the deserts were not only good but very well presented. I have walked by MoMo's many times going to Giants games but this is the first time I have ever eaten there. I would highly recommend it.
author: Benzee B.

description: Came here before an afternoon game. Oysters were good, pork sliders not the best, salad w/walnuts decent. When we ordered we told the waiter to bring out whatever is ready since we wanted to get the game. But everything came out all at once, and rather slowly. We wondered why the salad didn't come out first.
author: Starla L.

description:
Live across the street from Momo's. Use to go there every now and then and used to like their food.

Tried the stead dinner special recently. It was very disappointing, not what you think a steak dinner should be. 

Went over to try the happy hour. The bar tender walked around his area 3 times and failed to give us the bar menu when there were only about 15 people there on Fri night at the bar area. 

Walked out of the area in protest for no service. Spoke to the restaurant manager about it. 

The restaurant side was completely empty at 7:00 on Fri night.
author: Kathy P.

description: MoMo's is obviously busy on a Friday night with a 7:15 Giants start with Tim Lincecum on the mound.  We had a 20-30 minute wait but got a look at the menu and decided what we wanted to eat.  Once we got our table on the patio, we ordered our food and a couple of beers.  It was packed, but there was only one waiter.  No wonder it took 45 minutes for our food.  The salmon and halibut were good but the sauce on the ribs was too sweet.  After scarfing down our food, we ran across the way to the ballpark.  Because of our wait(s), we were a couple minutes late for the start.  Anyway, we saw a Giants loss, but I might try MoMo's again, just not on a game day.
author: Shannon W.

description: I went to MoMo's for dinner with a group of friends based on what one of them saw on a Food Network show. I can how it'd be nice to sit out on the patio but it was really windy so we opted to be seated inside. The interior was spacious, and our server was friendly. They have a $29 NY Steak 3 course dinner and that was what three of us ordered. It was fine, good crust on the meat and cooked to my liking. I didn't really care for the pureed potato and leek soup. Everything over salted. I felt that the tiramisu left something to be desired. It was nice that we didn't feel rushed, though they were not that busy to begin with.
author: Maggie L.

description: Ack.  Avoid.  High Fiver Central.  Before, during and after the game, full of pre-drunk people trying to hard to celebrate going to the game, instead of going to the game, with a  smattering of people muttering about how they ever got talked into meeting up here before the game.  Other times, vast expanses of empty table acreage and average food.
author: Kevin S.

description: If you love baseball, and want to get yer drunk on before a game with a bunch of non-descript white folks,pay $10 for a Bud, and stumble across the street, this is the place. Otherwise, it's too damn boring on a non-game day. Close you eye, and you're at an Olive Garden.
author: Rene D.

description:
pretty overpriced for food that's really nothing special.  there's plenty of places one can find food that's on their menu at a zillion other restaurants.
service was mediocre (we were eating at the bar)
drinks weren't anything special either
i guess the location's good for baseball fans...
author: charlotte s.

description: Nothing to say that hasnt already been said about Momo's.  I would LOVE this place more if their prices werent through the roof.  You cant get away with charging $20-35 per entree without offering SPECTACULAR food, and Momo's just doesnt deliver.  Great atmosphere though, and good for groups with reservations.
author: Cathleya G.

description: Eh, it's an okay place for happy hour. The buffalo wings are pretty good, but what I really love (for some odd reason) is the mixed green salad, which is $9...and scrumptious! The crab cakes are also quite tasty, but I was disappointed by the calamari. I've only been here with work (when they were paying), and I'm not sure I'd want to come back on my own credit card...
author: lindsay w.

description:
i have never, EVER, had the desire to come here on game days.  

one glance at that douchey crowd swarming around those itty bitty bars out on the patio is enough to keep me far far away.  i mean, you pretty much know that you'll only be able to get - at most - two rounds of overpriced beer.  and for the majority of the time, you'll be standing at the bar, frustrated and grumpy over the fact that the bartender isn't acknowledging you.

... its like a guaranteed bad time.

so anyway.

today is one of those gorgeous-80 degrees-no-cloud-in-the-sky-how-can-you-live-anywhere-else-but-san-francisco kind of day.

(and thank the mighty heavens above, it is not a game day)

the boss decided to take us out to lunch, and after our plans for the ramp was thwarted by the thirty some odd offices who had the same idea, we headed for momo's patio. 

lunch turned out to be better than i thought.  for appetizers we shared the tuna tartare with fried wonton skins, which i really liked.  we also had the bruschetta with mozzerella and prosciutto, which was good in a standard bread-cheese-cured meats kinda way.

for my entree i had originally picked the ($17) chicken breast/pear/walnut salad (my coworker got it, and it looked really good!) but switched to the ($20) dungeness crab louie after learning that they don't put mayonnaise in it.

considering the overpriced tiny plastic cups of beer on game days, i was really surprised by how much crab they give you.  for $20, you get a very generous serving of super fresh dungeness crab meat (pure and unadulterated and untouched by dressing) atop crunchy chopped iceberg lettuce, wedges of tomatoes, a quarter of an avocado, and a hard boiled egg.  they give you thousand island dressing on the side, and you only really need just a little bit to enhance the natural mildly salty deliciousness of the crab.

this is definitely a good business lunch place.  thought i dont think i'll come back often - its a bit spendy, the food definitely exceeded my expectations.  

thank you boss :)
author: Helen L.

description: DO NOT go here for a meal...but DO go for a little pre-Giants game fun!  It's always pretty packed, but it's a great crowd...though I usually end up swatting men away from my HOT roommates!  It's all in good fun!
author: Sarah D.

description: The food was great, the service is great... best thing there is the apple tarte dessert!  YUUUUMMMM.  I want it now.
author: Jules M.

description:
I've been here twice now after a Giants game and it is always packed.  They have bouncers who are rude and their drinks are inconsistent.  I ordered a Long Island which tasted like lemonade (all bad) and my friend ordered a screwdriver which was ALL Vodka - which is a good thing. 

 I guess folks just come here after the game because it's conveniently located across from the ball park.  They do have an outdoor area so I've give them a plus for that.  I don't think I'd come back unless folks I'm with insist.  Especially, there are tons of cooler bars in the area.
author: Maryanne D.

description: I've had a great time at MoMo's on previous visits when I stop by for a drink. I always avoid days when the Giants are playing, as it is just too crowded. I had a couple of friends in from out of town and we wanted a place near my office. Someone chose Momo's. Can't say I will eat there again. It clearly has aspirations of being something better than it is. The result is like paying for Rachel Ray-inspired over-wrought diner food. I had a Skirt Steak and it was a actually a great piece of meat, but covered in butter and onions cooked in impossible amounts of butter. Simple and fresh would be way better.
author: Bob R.

description: Always a fun place to have good food and a martini and watch Peter McGowan drinking martinis to try to forget about the Zito trade.
author: Tom D.

description: Two stars because of location and I've always been able to get a couple of drinks before heading over to pacbell. Oh, and a great place to watch women who are starved for attention trying to outdo each other as the baseball fans leave for the stadium. Everything else ... no stars.
author: Pamela B.

description: The last time I was here after a Giant's game......on a Monday......lets say we had a little too much to drink.........next thing you know I was on the next plane to Vegas......that was a crazy week......Momo's is a fun place!
author: tom h.

description: Went here for my birthday one year. They used to have a great prix fixe NY steak special (don't know if they still have it). The food was good. Highly recommended, regardless if they still have the steak special.
author: Steve C.

description: Went to MoMo's for the first time Sunday while the Giants game was going on.  It's a cool spot to grab a couple drinks outside and enjoy the nice weather.  However, I wouldn't want to be there after the game lets out.
author: Steve H.

description: We've been coming here probably since it first opened. Game days it is always just ok. On non game days like today it is usually OK. Today was another story - I am hoping it was an anomaly. I ordered the smoked salmon flatbread with eggs. In the past you got a full plate of the flatbread with a decent helping of the salmon. With the eggs in the middle. Today it was a half plate of cold flatbread with a scant portion of salmon. The eggs were room temperature at best. The table that was seated before us didn't have their order taken until the table that was seated after us had their order taken. And their food took forever for it to arrive. They were hungry and would have liked to even have some bread or something while they were waiting.
author: Debbie M.

description:
One word: avoid.

We visited Momo's in late afternoon and were the only two people in the entire dining room.  We were seated promptly but everything after that was terrible.  It took an hour for our food to arrive after we had ordered.  As far as I can tell this was because the waitstaff was busy talking among themselves and more or less ignored us.  We had to ask several times for refills of water.  When the food arrived it was mediocre at best.  I mentioned the appauling service to the manager on the way out but this didn't seem to surprise anyone.  I guess they make enough money from people with no expectations.
author: Vincent B.

description: I wouldn't consider myself a typical Momo's type but this place is so much fun to go to before a game.  Where else can a group of girls go expecting to buy scalped tickets...end up at Momo's to have people give you their tickets for free and an arm wrestle, and then end up at the game sitting with the drunk and rowdy Santa Clara University Alumni Association? "Umm..yeah...of course we went to SCU..."  Sure, the people there are "Marina types" and you can guarantee they'll be heading out there after the game, but they're fun, nice, and DRRUNK.  Definitely would never eat here but the drunken pre and post game crowd is very entertaining..especially if you're sober.
author: Tanger T.

description: I've had pretty average experiences here. Of course, that's probably because I've only come here before a Giant's game, which might be the problem. First off, their beer prices aren't that great, but I guess because they're right next to the stadium they can inflate their prices a bit. I've also come here for dinner and was satisfied, but not blown-away by their food (just based on the mixed green salad, chicken sandwich and chocolate banana bread pudding that I had). The service was OK, but I thought that the quality of the food did not match the prices. But hey, it's convenient before a game if you make reservations beforehand.
author: Natalie T.

description: I'd always liked this place for drinks before a baseball game, but now I've discovered something amazing - Momo's has a phenomenal Crab Louis salad. Who knew? A massive mound of crab, big tomato wedges, half an avocado, two hardboiled eggs, a light shallot vinaigrette (also the thousand island on the side, but blech). I couldn't even finish this massive plate of goodness. If you're a crab lover you've got to get over here and try it. Can't really vouch for the rest though. Also was surprised to learn though that they have a fantastic room for private group dining! Seats 10. :-)
author: Sarah R.

description: Went here for some food and drink before a Giant's game.  The drinks were on par, though a bit pricey.  The food however was pretty tasty.  We had a group of five, so were able to get a few apps between us.  We opted for the carpaccio, egg rolls, and another dish (escapes me). I liked the carpaccio, and the egg rolls were ok.  We all ordered a different dish, including the pot roast (me), seared scallops and the rib eye among others.  The pot roast was run-of-the-mill, a good solid fallback of a dish. The scallops however were really nice, and my colleague that went for the rib eye swore by it.  All-in-all a good experience.  Make sure you get a reservation if you're visiting before game time.
author: Lucas M.

description: I have eaten here and tried it again and again thinking I just didnt' have the right dish.  But there are only so many times you need to keep going to finally know that it is as good as it gets.  There was nothing terrible but it's location I think is to serve the AT&T ball park crowd.  I do think I need to try it again to make a discovery that I know is certain to not happen.
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description: I have been here a couple times. The crowd is what would happen if the marina was moved across from the ball park. The food is nothing great, mad overpriced. The waitress we had was an imbecile. I asked her if the food would be ready before 6:45, and here she is bringing it to me at 7:15, past game time. My buddies all tell me " I just ate at MoMo's it was a complete rip-off". If you want good food, good drank, and good peeps, peep the 21st Amendment , a couple blocks away...much better establishment...
author: Taj A.

description: A very, very, very boring meal.  I don't think the food matches the price.
author: Mrs. G.

description: Ridiculously overpriced. Went in once, starving, and wanted to get a burger... even a $15 one. The game had ended hours ago and the place was totally empty (and trashed). No such luck on getting a burger, because they only serve them on the patio during baseball season. But how about an insanely overpriced steak or $9 fried onions instead? It's like all the prices of AT&T Park, just without the baseball or, well, the park! Give me a break.
author: Aaron L.

description: Went there a few weeks ago and was disappointed.  Both of our dishes were really over cooked (I got the scallops) and the waiter messed up our appetizer order and didn't offer to fix it.  Waiter also seemed unable to remember the drink order.  Food was edible enough but given that there are better restaurants in the area, probably won't be back.
author: Tara C.

description: First, I must say thank you for introducing to me Mia's Zinfandel. It's my wine pick of the day.  However, that was all that was good on this visit  -- the calamari - usually good -- was overcooked. Shrimp were OK. Bartenders were nice. Just an overall mediocre experience - except for the Mia's.
author: elizabeth s.

description: I really love drinking on a patio under a heat lamp, just chatting with cool people... that place totally provides that... location and setting good. service was a little off and drinks were just okay. hell they're know for there martini's...not very good... i asked for a straight up martini with olives..i got a dirty one instead... or maybe could i have some vodka with my olive juice drink.... yeah. I've seen this place when its packed and I've definitely seen some hotties. I'd go back.
author: Ravi R.

description:
Went to Momo's last night for a Dine About Town dinner...We were utterly surprised. We had 7:30 reservations, but overanticipated how much traffic there would be, so we arrived around 7:10. The host was able to seat us by 7:20. The appetizers were of decent portions; I got the Caeser salad and he got the mussels. I would recommend the mussels over the Caeser. For the entree we both got the skirt steak which came out clean and hot. Surprisingly it was more on the medium rare-rare side, which i enjoyed. Then the dessert, I ordered the tiramisu, which was prettyy much the standard tiramisu, it was good. But the Chocolate banana bread pudding was OFF the charts!! I'm not normally one that likes bread pudding, so I skipped over it on the menu. But he ordered it, and o man, it was like biting into this warm, crunchy, sweet , gooey sensation, all in one bite. It reaches the top of our fave list for desserts. And I will now give bread puddings a second chance.

Overall, the experience was good, good atmosphere/environment. One thing though, the half booth half chair seats are little more cramped that I would have liked. Service was good, nothing to complain about there.
author: cat k.

description: Right across the street from AT&T park, you wouldn't think this place is more for the business casual folks. Had the chicken peanut spring rolls, which was pretty good! Definitely different taste than the usual spring rolls you would try elsewhere with the peanut taste. Can't really taste the chicken from it though. Then for entree, I had the Portobello Ravioli with bolognese sauce. I'm not much of a ravioli person with all the ricotta I'm used to tasting from other ravioli, but this one is really good! Can't taste any cheesyness other ravioli would give.
author: My C.

description: Hit this spot for lunch on a sunny afternoon and dug the patio seating (a rare find in this area) the burger was seriously large and tasty, great attentive high end service. I would definitely hit this spot again but can't really vouch for the food that they probably pride themselves on.
author: M L.

description: Ahh MoMo's. The Perfect start to a grand evening at the Ball park. Last Time I was there, I was watching Matt Cain shut it down in Game 2 of the world series. memorable! This is a good place to go on game day, they have good food and good drinks too and it tends to get pretty crowded. So get there early on game days, especially for the playoffs.
author: Rafael L.

description: Food was horrible.  Not one person in our group of 8 enjoyed their meal.  Even the coffee was bad.  How can you mess up coffee? It tasted weak and diluted.  Should have known better than to eat at a place that had a table for 8 last minute on a Saturday night.
author: Tinou B.

description:
I'm not sure why the reviews for Momo's are so bad. I have visited 3 times and was satisfied every time. The first time was at an awards banquet honoring the great Pat Kuleto and Charles Phan of Slanted Door fame. The appetizers were tasty and being offered to us what seemed like every 30 seconds throughout the hour or so we hung out by the front. When dinner was served, I had the pot roast, which was the most tender and juicy pot roast I ever had. I would definitely recommend Momo's to anyone looking to book a private party. 
My second visit was dinner with my wife. I had the Pot Roast again, and my wife ordered the BBQ platter, which was not particularly distinguished, but I remember the sausage standing out. I remember the dessert was good too. 
Third time, today, I had brunch with three family members. We started with the Bruscetta. Strong olive flavor on the bread, with prosciutto on top, and roasted vegetables on the side. Sooo good. I ordered the Flat bread with smoked salmon and cheesy chive scrambled eggs. Deliciously creamy eggs. The other three peeps in my party had the crab salad, Cobb salad, and chicken salad. All were very fresh, with lots of crispy greens and generous portion of the appropriate proteins. The crab in particular was very fresh, and large in quantity.
I will definitely go back to Momo's.
author: Johnny O.

description: Based on the fact that my mom's boss who is a great guy is partial owner in this restaurants makes me love it.  However, they have yummy food, refreshing cocktails, and sophisticated baseball crowd.  The ravioli is good, the sea bass is tasty, and they have a steak that melts on your tongue.  Their dining room is swanky but they definitely cater to the casual masses.
author: Angela D.

description: I've been here a couple of times food is decent but nothing impressive.  One thing that did ruin it for me was when my friend found hair in her salad.  That was the last time I've been there and its been a couple of years.
author: May A.

description:
entrance: host looked at us from head to toe and considered if she should even give us a menu. i came to sf with my family to try momos and we were casually dressed. i guess the hostess thought we didnt have enough money to eat here. we looked over the menu and decided to sit and eat. she didnt smile, welcome us or anything.

sitting down: the booth seats were sticky with food. 

food: it was prepared and served well so i give it ***** stars for the meal. it was pricey but good to eat. 

the bus boy always filled our drinks and made sure we had water. our server didnt take care of us though. she took our order and left quickly to tend to her other guests. we saw her twice after.

leaving: the same hostess didnt say goodbye. just watched us leave. 

train your hostess to not be judgemental or at least not make it obvious. geezzzz.
author: Steph C.

description: My boss decided to have a going-away lunch here, after seeing the reviews I went to this place not expecting much.  I walked away pleased believe it or not.  We ordered the flat bread with cambazola cheese, dried figs and pears for the appetizer.  Then I had the salad with chicken, candied walnuts and sliced pears.  My co-workers tried the chicken pot pie and the margherita pizza.  All got a thumbs up, we thought the prices were in line with other restaurants in the area.   I would go back for lunch.
author: Cindy B.

description: I have finally been inside this restaurant.  This place is impossible to get into during the ball games or most nights.  I finally got to go, because of a PR service my new work provides for its new employees.  The service was great, the food was OK (I've had better skirt steak), the fries were awesome, and the atmosphere was nice.
author: Nino M.

description: Incredible location for game days but nothing special otherwise. Food very average and service is far from stellar. Over priced like everything else in the neighborhood. Gets 3 stars because can be a lot of fun on game day.
author: Barrett D.

description: I went with a group of co-workers on a sunny Friday for lunch.  Lunch bunching is discouraged where I work, but we wanted to enjoy the great weather and dine a la fresco.  So, when the lunch took almost 2 hours, my co-workers and I got pretty stressed.  We had no intention of going missing for that long.  There seemed to be one waitress for the entire outside patio.  The food is okay, nothing special, burgers, salads, and some specials.  I ordered a shrimp and crab salad--on the pricey side for $24.  The pulled pork sandwich gets great reviews from my boss.  Mediocre food, poor service, nice outdoor dining.  I would go for their happy hour.  Drinks on the patio when you can flag a waitress.
author: Anne A.

description: There is no place better to go after a game.  While prices are just a tad lower then the ballpark's (7.50 down to 6) the young crowd flows in from the game making it the perfect atmosphere.  Never have I had a problem getting drinks or meeting people.  I even went after a day game once for food and we were sat right away and had excellent service.
