Whenever anyone asks me where to go after the game I point them here!
author: Michael N.

description: The Greek salad was quite tasty.  The service was good and the vegetarian options were minimal, but they were tasty.  Having eaten lunch here, I didn't really interact with many people, but it seemed like a decent spot.
author: Apollo L.

description:
not that good and overpriced.  big portions but what's the point if the food isn't tasty?  generally obnoxious crowd and you can't move when it's game day at pacbell/sbc/at&t park.  

skip it.  preserve some of your self respect.
author: Melissa Y.

description: This is a late review. Had dinner here with the family and office staff right before we watched Kooza. Nice place, waiters were very attentive and we got our orders quickly which was important because we had to catch a show. Food was great, I had the grilled New York pepper steak and it was cooked perfectly to my liking. I'm definitely coming back!
author: Mitch T.

description:
the value at this restaurant is definitely during dine about town season. otherwise, i would say it's a little pricey for the type of food that is served. don't get me wrong, though, the food is still good, but during the first weeks of january, you can get a three course meal for yourself for less than $35 which is what a shared appetizer and two main dishes will set you back during their regular hours. 

however, i did thoroughly enjoy my regular priced prawn linguine with pesto sauce. the prawns were huge and succulent and perfectly cooked (i am a self-proclaimed prawn connoisseur...i love their juicy little heads...and i absolutely HATE overcooked prawns) and the pesto was just garlicky enough to balance out the creaminess of the sauce. 

i still like this spot, even though i could probably get something at cheesecake factory that would satisfy me just the same.
author: Nini G.

description: Excellent food, great place to go for a drink and party before the game!!
author: Christopher S.

description:
I have been here twice and paid half-price both times due to online gift certificate purchases. Despite the discount I was sorely disappointed on both visits. Food is mediocre at best and totally overpriced. Service is hit and miss. This place wouldn't last a month in any other SF location. It only survives due to the Ball park tourist crowd...

steak - tough and chewy
salad - drowning in dressing
eggplant Parmesan - over-fried
Everything else - drowning in butter and/or cream and not in a good way
author: Monique D.

description:
This place was a joke.  Food was just a step above TGIFs.  Service, from in the bar to the restaurant, was nonexistent.  Bar staff did their best to ignore you.  Restaurant staff were slow to deliver food and even slower to engage with our party of 10. 

I had the blackened salmon, which was OK.  But the rice was gooey and the corn, well, tasted like it was right out of the can.

Valet parking at $20 was a little pricey, especially when I left at 11pm, the attendant was off work and I had to pick up my keys from the bar.

And the restrooms, well, judging from al the paper towels overflowing from the bin, looked like they had not been cleaned in a week.

All in all, I will never, ever, go back to this dump.
author: mingde y.

description: They serve food here?  I have only been here for drinks after a visit to the ballpark.  It isn't really my type of scene and if the ballpark ever closed up, this place would be gone the next day.  Location is everything for this place.
author: Pele N.

description: I went here for lunch and order two dishes.  I had the pull pork sirlon sandwich, served with fries, and i ordered the mac and cheese.  the mac and cheese was great although not figure friendly i bet.  haha.  the pork in the sandwich was tender and juicy.  The servers were friendly and fast at getting what you ask for.  It is however a bit overpriced for the lunch hour.  I guess that's due to it's great location.
author: Kim N.

description:
I've been to MoMo's in the past and decided to stop there for dinner last week.  There was no ball game and so the restaurant was not busy.  

The ambience is the same and is a nice venue.  The food was not good.  I order the beef filet carpaccio appetizer and it was drenched in olive oil.  So much so that I had to take a piece of bread and soak it up.  I left 80% of it on the plate and  mentioned this to the waiter whose only comment was he would mention it to the kitchen.  He never asked if I wanted something else of for them to redo the dish and it did show up on the bill.  In the best establishments, there is always some offer accomodation.    I find this totally unacceptable.  It was an $18 dish which was not consumable.

The waiter either was not on top of it or management has made a decision not to care.  I won't be visiting MoMo's for a long time and do not recommend it for dinner.  I've had lunch/brunch there which is much better.
author: Dora L.

description:
Been to Momos a coulpe times and the food is pretty good, but the place is EXPENSIVE.  SOMA has some of the most expensive places near the ball part and its ridic!  

I thought baseball was the working mans game, but when you have to pay $15 for a bottle of Cornona and a Sierra Nevada....thats a bit out of my league.

I'll stick to sneaking a flask into the park
author: Richard C.

description:
I would recommend going to Carl's Jr. over this place.  Basically, the food here is overpriced garbage and the service is horrible.  We decided to come here for a Birthday Dinner, which turned out to be a huge mistake.

MoMo's has an advertisement that boasts of the "juciest steak."  I might as well have chewed on a rubber band all night.  The steak was tough and tasteless.  Now, I like my steaks rare.  One would think that a rare steak would be tender.  However, my steak was rock-hard.  One of my friends ate no more than a quarter of his steak because it was too tough.

The service was also terrible.  The food preparation time seemed like it took over an hour.  At one point, the waitress brought us another table's order, which was evidence of how unorganized the restaurant was.

Finally, the birthday girl happened to leave one of her birthday presents at the restaurant.  We were one of the last tables to leave that evening.  When she called first thing the following morning, the restaurant acknowledged that they had the bag, but the gift was missing.  Did someone at the restaurant take the gift?  I'll leave that for you to decide.  I personally think this wouldn't be an issue at any respectable restaurant.  If MoMo's wants to charge the high prices to compete in the "fine dining" category, they need to prevent things like this from happening.

Overall, this restaurant is terrible.  If I could rate it below one star, I would.
author: Jeffrey C.

description:
Horrible place.  Nuf said.

UPDATE 10-15-06:

This happened to be the only place open on a Sunday at 11:30am around the area.  Now I know why this place gets horrible reviews:

- host acted as if they were not open
- waitress had a bad attitude
- cooks looked unhappy
- horrible Tuna sandwhich
- friend had the trout - more horrible than the tuna
- expensive

Stay away from this place!
author: James B.

description: If you are going to a game at AT&T Park, and all other places are booked, by all means, go to Momo's.  But if you have a choice, don't.  Food is overpriced for the quality.  Quantity is huge, but they (dare i say it) over season the food.  I LOVE really flavorful food, but not like that.  Otherwise.... some of the apps are OK.
author: M S.

description: Food is okay. Always packed around Giants games.
author: Mike C.

description: A fine place for post game celebration (or sulking).  I probably wouldn't go here without a bunch of my friends, but it's right across the street from Giant's stadium and there are always plenty of taxis to drive you home...That's about it for this place.
author: Nate V.

description:
I have to say this place has actually grown on me!  (And not like a fungus...)
The bar area is still a little weird, with too many barstools at the uncomfortable bar and not enough comfortable/private areas.  HOWEVER, the restaurant area is beautiful, big, and comfortable.  It is PERFECT for large groups and even good for couples.  The food has drastically improved from last year.  The entrees are all very tasty, particularly the pork chop and filet mignon.  Our favorite appetizers include the brie/apple one and the butter lettuce salad.  This is also one of the few places in the city that makes oysters rockefeller, albeit with bacon, but you can pick it out.
Also noteworthy is the very decent wine list.  REALLY good wines at VERY reasonable prices!  We just had a bottle of the Parelle 45 for $32!  Not bad in a S.F. restaurant.  
Overall, the restaurant is great with excellent, attentive service and tasty food, as long as it is in the off-season of baseball or on off-game days.  The Giants crowd changes EVERYTHING.  During the holiday season it is wonderful!
author: Plaid B.

description:
This is from several  experiences a few years ago - but YELP wasn't on my radar then, so better late than never.

Momo's was the site for  a Father's Day  lunch so unpleasant, it has become the stuff of legend!
Leave it to say,  that  I got to watch my family eat their meals, and only got my steak after they were done. All because my baked potato wasn't ready on time. 
We were billed for an appetizer we never received. Even after reminding the waiter we know longer wanted it - we just didn't want it on our bill. It was. 
And had the pleasure of refilling our water glasses, and those at 3 other nearby tables.

This was not an isolated experience. Returned for pre-game drinks because that was the rendevouz point set by the rest of my group. 
I'm sure I'd still be wiaiting for my beer that never arrived.

And in both cases management appears that they could care less.
I am amazed this hole is still open
author: Mark S.

description: Stopped in after game 5 of the NLCS with a reservation.  The service was good but the place was empty with the exception of lot's of drunk and very rowdy patrons.  We saw three very volatile situations develop within 20 minutes. The Cioppino was possibly the worst I have ever had.  My wife took a safe bet and ordered a personal size pizza. I am hoping we hit it on an off night? Not too sure we will visit again.
author: W S.

description: Giving it 3 stars for the location and outside seating...service was aweful, went here on a Sunday at 1pm for brunch, food was decent...better to go for drinks before or after a Giant's game.  We waited 5-10 minutes before our server talked to us (they were not even busy)--then waited close to 1/2 hour for our food--wonder how long you would have to wait when they are actually busy?
author: Rita M.

description: I haven't yet eaten at Momo's but have gone many times for pre/post Giant's game drinking and have always had a good time.  The patio is especially fun on a nice day.
author: Cameron M.

description:
drinks before a giants game? yes
good food? no
three stars based on location alone...
author: Patrick D.

description:
I went here after a ballgame. Glady I was not paying for this meal.

The food was BAD and the service wasn't much better.

This place is soooo overpriced. Never again!
author: Nicole R.

description: Me and a buddy went here after a Giants game. Bad call. Over priced beer served in plastic cups. The crowd and staff, as much as they might be good people, just were not that night. Fights broke out. Drunk sports fans being rude. Or, just drunk folks being rude. I guess that's why they have security. (Why would you want to NEED security?) Idoubt I'll ever go back, there's really no need to. I'm sure they won't miss my business. For an after the game beer, you're better off walking the Embarcadero and grabbing a pint at the Hi Dive.
author: Chris J.

description:
With an olive on their logo, I expected a special martini menu (not that I wanted martini).  But actually there was no significance with the logo.  

Menu did not impress me at all.  Some of the items sounded very similar to what I saw on the menu at Barone's in Pleasanton last week.  There must be several places serving Ahi tuna with wasabi mashed potato right now... nothing special.

My gumbo was missing something in flavor, but I could not figure out what it was.  I saw an appetizer dish returned to the kitchen from another table far from mine.  I really could not tell the situation, but the customers did not seem too happy about it.

The place was not busy, but the service was slow.  

Probably will not go back there again.
author: April H.

description: I haven't been to MoMo's for a while now but I always come here for dinner whenever I'm home in San Francisco. I always order the wasabi mashed potatoes with a halibut-steak and vegetables. I absolutely loooovvveee their wasabi-mashed potatoes (i think they call it horse-radish mashed potatoes now) but it is amazing!! The potatoes are creamy and you feel that sinus clearing with the horseradish in there. The desserts are something you can't pass up either. I've had the apple tarte tatin with vanilla bean ice creme and caramel sauce; it has a right amount of sweetness from the ice cream & caramel contrasting the slight tartness from the apple (green apples I believe.) I also enjoy the creme brulee, it is served slightly chilled but the sugar crust on top is crunchy and sweet. The only drinks I've had here is the lemon-drop martini, it has just the right amount of lemon citrus flavoring to vodka. I never feel unwelcomed here, the hostess is very friendly when you walk in and will seat you (it is usually not crowded inside so I always get a table without any reservations.) The waiter/waitresses are also polite and friendly.
author: Donna C.

description: Mo-mo's Blo-blows. Hard to believe a drink/appetizer experience can be so bad. It was bad, like out of a movie bad. With a total of 6 people at the bar, my date and I waited 10 minutes to place a drink order. I received a gin/tonic instead of a vodka tonic. I reported to the bartender that "I may have mis-ordered, but I meant to order a vodka tonic." Again a gin/tonic, only stronger. Warm aritchoke apps came out as cold as if they'd been pulled from the frig, and again, with 6 total people at the bar, we had empty drinks much of the time due to awol or a-hole bartender. This eventually led to a full-on hostile exchange when my date went to the ladies room, and was resolved by the manager getting involved, comping our apps, and admitting that they've had similar complaints about the bar staff, but this is not how they want to run things, please come back, etc. Appreciated the comp and the acknowledgement of the problem, but I actually prefer to have a good time with good service on a date, so I'll not be back ever. Great location next to the ballpark though.
author: Brett L.

description:
i've only been here twice for brunch, but it has been fantastic both times.  SERIOUSLY the best PANCAKES in the city.  i LOOOOVE them.  i do agree that it is on the pricey side for brunch (i had a bloody mary and it was like 10-12 bucks, i think), but every bite was worth it.  

my bf had a different egg dish each time we went and his food was great, too.  the biscuit was sooo tasty.  loved the eggs as well.

actually I live right by momo's and never went because the yelp reviews were so negative.  however, convenience eventually won out and i'm glad that i'm lazy, because i will return here for brunch again and again.

as a side note, their coffee is strange.  maybe it is really expensive and good coffee that i'm not accustomed to...but my mocha was bitter, even with extra sugar.  =(
author: courtney o.

description: One of the many spots I like to come and grab a brew, or two, or three, or ummmmmmm... well, you get the picture, before or after the Giants game, it's an awesome place after to drinks ESPECIALLY if we won. Great crowd, can get a little over packed, but I don't mind feeling like I"m in a sardine can once in a while. The food here, not bad, but meh.. not the best, I'm a fan of their burgers.
author: S A.

description: Don't give them your money and more importantly your time.  Sat down on the patio on Saturday, the place had 2 other customers.  The waitress ignored us for 15 - 20 minutes while chatting with her friends and co workers.  Eventually had to just get up and leave.  The entire experience was irritating.  I work nearby, this is fairly typical.  Not always is the service that bad on the patio, but it often is.  Tres Agave's, 21st, Oneill's, Paragon all better options.
author: matt s.

description: The food was great but the service sucked. We were there with nine people for a work lunch. We literally had to track down our waiter through the guy that kept refilling our water glasses. We'd ordered starters and finished them before the waiter even came back to take our lunch order. I'll give this place another try and will ask NOT to sit in his section.
author: Rachel A.

description: First time today and loved it so much I can not wait to go back. The half crab and shrimp salad was so yummy and a Pete's Punch hit the spot.
author: Marie L.

description: i've had good times here during on and off season.  it also helps to have a few friends working here.  their happy hour is great...where else can you get a small pizza for six bucks?  their outdoor area is perfect for pre-, post-, and during the game (so, any time really).
author: Marjie T.

description: i usually come here before a giants game. it's a great place to get fucked up and mingle with other fans. but there are some negatives. 1) it get WAY too packed. to a point where you cant really manuever. 2) drinks are kinda expensive, although cheaper than at the ballpark. 3) the food is mediocre, although the food they grill outside in the patio is better. but overall, the real reason you come here pre/post game is to drink and holler so it gets my vote
author: Andrew T.

description: im basing this review on giants day games....could care less bout the fancy smancy food/environment this place has....excellent pre game ritual hot spot...i dont really brag bout mohito drinks~but here theyre made perfect...great scene/atmosphere...if your sick of the bar seen & cougars inside the dark den...then check out the outdoor patio~its a party without the dj
author: elmer d.

description: After watching the Giant's kick the sorry Dodgers' asses today, we left AT&T Park on the hungry side (sorry folks, not paying 8 bucks for a beer or 10 bucks for garlic fries) so we decided to see what Momo's had to offer. I kind of had a feeling it was going to be pricey, but I also figured that maybe the food and service would be at least decent. No such luck. On the plus side, we were seated immediately, and a bread basket with delicious levain bread was delivered soon after. However, once we ordered only appetizers and drinks, it seemed the service declined rapidly. First I asked if we might have some more bread- our waitress muttered something that sounded like an ok. Finally the food arrives (Julie and I splitting a grilled artichoke stuffed with bread crumbs, asiago, and drizzled with a lemon butter sauce with a hint of white wine, and Jen and Christian going for the traditional caesar salad) and I again asked if we could please have some more bread. Again, she grunted some form of yes. We proceed to finish our sub par snack (the salad had browning and rotten romaine leaves, and the artichoke was in no way near cooked- both dishes were way overpriced) and a bus boy comes to fill our water. I ask him if we could please get some bread. He doesn't seem to understand me. So, we basically gave up at that point- and decided to leave as soon as possible, not wanting to deal with the rude and inattentive staff. Take home message: you're doing yourself a favor by not coming here. No matter how hungry you are, just don't do it. The service is awful, the food poorly cared for, and the prices astronomically high.
author: Kate A.

description: great for Giants after-game drinks. although i prefer Paragon over Momos, i'll come here on occasion. fun lively crowd but service gets bad when its really packed... naturally. i've never eaten here so not sure what thats like. also good for pre-game drinks too if you're trying to get drunk beforehand... this season, who would blame you.
author: Michelle I.

description: food over priced, drinks fair, service bad.
author: Fred H.

description: i used to go to momo's every now and then when i worked in mission bay...  they have a pretty good grilled salmon salad...  it's a pretty decent salad, and the size of the salmon is a pretty good portion...  price wise, it's a little pricey...  if my memory serves me correct, i think the salad was in the $20 price range...  this place does get pretty packed during giants games...  mainly because it's a pretty convenient place to grab a few drinks at their outdoor patio/bar area before heading into at&t for a baseball game...  h-100...
author: Herb F.

description: They re-write the tips after I sign the receipt. I feel very uncomfortable.
author: devon w.

description: I came here before a game with coworkers and I have to say if it wasn't paid for, i don't know if i could afford it. We had a few cocktails that were mixed just right. The appetizers were out of this world! I've never had raw oysters on a half shell and I'm glad that I tried them at MoMo's because now I'm a big fan. I am actually scared to try them at other restaurants because I don't think they will live up to MoMo's. The Wood Baked Garlic Shrimp with Asiago Toast  was something I have never had before. All the flavors seems to mix together very well. I just  wish this place was less crowded and more affordable. If so, i would definitly give it 5 stars.
author: Rhea A.

description: Went for a girlfriends bday party in the bar. This place is so DEAD without the bustling baseball across the way. The food wasn't bad. Calamari was delish, but the service by the bartender was TERRIBLE that night. Maybe it had something to do with the owner hanging out at the bar with all of his cronies ALL NIGHT LONG, so the bartender was trying to keep his job and had to brownnose a little. Wouldn't recommend this place for the service, but the drinks aren't bad.
author: Jennifer D.

description: bland, expensive... updated bennigan's.  happy hour? i'd go for that otherwise skip.
author: Lu R.

description: shitty slow service, lackluster food.I'd rather eat a weiner at the ballpark
author: Lauren V.

description: My husband and I came here on a sunny Friday afternoon around 2.30pm, on a game day (evening game).  The margaritas were soso, certainly not worth the 8 dollar price tag, and service was non-existent (the dirty glasses from the previous party on our table were never cleaned away).  I still give them 2 stars, just for the location: it's a great place to see all the pre-game action and people.
author: Marijke D.

description: This was actually one of my better DATs only because of the appetizer and desserts! After looking on the web site I was very curious to meet Boom Boom the hostess, but much to my dismay we met with someone else who was probably just as helpful as BB would have been. Service was great but the Garlic Shrimp with Asiago Toast was brilliant! About a dozen shrimps lacquered with melted butter stole the show for me. In between that and the dessert was the hanger steak, which for some reason was offered at a lot of other places for DAT. The steak, rare and wet, was good, however, the bread that they placed it on top totally after getting soggy seeped into the tastes of the onions which just didn't whet my appetite. The onions basically tasted like wet bread, and I like onions even if they give you bad breath when you eat the un-grilled version. Anyway for dessert I tried everyone's the coffee ice cream sundae had hardened chocolate syrup on it, which is how I like it: chewy chocolate syrup. The banana bread pudding was amazing and I don't even like bread pudding. Man, just looking over the menu again brings fond memories back into my taste buds. So delicious. Momo's was a solid DAT find and would not hesitate to recommend it nor revisit. -Matt
author: Matthew C.

description: yes, this place generally sucks. but i have to give them credit for serving us some seriously strong drinks last thursday. my company took us to the giants game, and my co-worker (newly a mom & missing her days of boozing) suggested we stop at momo's for a drink before the game. one bloody mary followed by three very strong ketel one and tonics had us stumbling across the street to eat a bratwurst. all of us being A's fans turned right back around to sit in the sun at momo's. you can't beat this place when everyone is in the game, you have a patio all to yourself and the bartenders will fill giant plastic cups more than half-way full of vodka. i think that hangover lasted a full day. but it was so worth it.
author: rachel p.

description: classy.  bar.  wonderful atmosphere, decent food but high prices for what you get.  addictive onion strings.  had smallest bottle of champagne i've ever seen in my life (187 ml), and it was worth it.
author: Catherine H.

description: I went only once, right before  a Giants game, so the location is convenient if you don't feel like pizza or ballpark food. Aside from that, it's pretty mediocre food and service.
author: Cary W.

description: It is honestly too bad that Momo's only gets two stars.  It is a nice place, the decor and atmosphere are well done but the service is god awful.  I have eaten here several times and I have had bad experiences every time.  The first time I was there for lunch and the waiter completely f***ed our order, managing getting half the order there then there was a 20 minute wait until the rest of the food arrived.  The most recent occasion the waiter talked in almost a whisper and I could barely hear him speak.  Our food arrived about an HOUR after we ordered it and the restaurant was about 20% full.  Nothing we ordered (chicken and ravioli ) should take any longer than 30 minutes.  The food was good though, but the main courses  are fairly pricey and most of them come ala carte.  They get on the appetizers with most of them nearing $20.   Yeah $16 for ok calamari is ridiculous.   They need to lower the price on apps and I am sure their check average will increase.    Game days are a different story, the deck is fun with a good crowd.  The beers are decently priced for the location and its always a fun place after weekend game days.  But if you want to drop an easy $100 on dinner for two, then go somewhere else.
author: Eli Z.

description: I've been here a handful of times and never walked away feeling it was anything special but mostly overpriced and way too crowded.  BUT it is close to work and you can be outside.  The frustrating thing is just all the damn people.  Am I getting old? Oh hell no but when I want a cocktail I don't want to wait in line for 20 minutes.
author: Misti L.

description: The onion soup is so delish. However the service is totally out to lunch and apparently out to happy hour.  Also, salad + 3 beets=$12 I feel less ripped off watching Runaway Bride.
author: f M.

description: Two stars in this case equal 1 star for food and five stars for service.  I could elaborate, but 1 star for food says enough I think.
author: Richard P.

description: Momo's will always be better known to me as a spot to grab a drink before/after a ballgame.  They let way too many people in though and grabbing that drink is becoming increasingly difficult.  I have eaten here a couple times (including last night) and while I feel the food is pricey, it is still very good.  The service was solid as well.
author: Glen E.

description: i live around the corner from this place so i have been her for both game and other days... very much overpriced for eh ok food.  gamedays it gets too crowded for may taste.  the outside area is very nice on a sunny day.. i just wish it wasn't so damn expensive.
author: sarah s.

description: Ended up at Momo's on a Friday night for dinner and I was pretty disappointed with the food. The pork chop was dry and the baby back ribs didn't fall off the bone. The only thing decent was the bread and the wine we selected. Won't be coming back here for food.
author: See M.

description: More like a business restaurant inside but has an outdoor seating area that is perfect on a nice day. Food is good, not extraordinary. American cuisine. The salad and ceviche were good and quite filling. Tables are close together so a bit loud.
author: carolina d.

description: The place to go if you're a yuppie going to a Giants game because it's the trendy place to be and you've got some extra money burning a hole in your pocket...there's better, cheaper places to eat in the area that you don't have to wait forever before gametime and risk missing the start of the game
author: Joe K.

description: Good location, great patio (with heaters!), decent food. Overpriced, but still a good place to go, especially if the weather is nice and you can get a table looking out over the marina and ball park.
author: Elle E.

description:
I'm writing this review not to critique the so-so food and the slow-slow service, but for the "SERVICE FEE" on my bill. 
Not that it cost $100 +++ for a light snack prior to taking in a game, but the "SERVICE FEE" that they add on to your bill.  Not the, you don't look like your going to tip "fee" that some restaurants secretly add to foreigners checks or to the parties of 8 or more "tip included" fee.  This added fee was a bit shocking to me...it was for the new 'sf health care law' that insist all restaurants provide health care to their employees, which I'm a big fan of.  I waited tables for years and had to pay my own.
So what MoMo's has done, is make the CUSTOMERS PAY for "THEIR" employees health insurance.  So now not only do I have to pay for mine, but if I want to go out and eat dinner at MoMo's, I have to pay for "THEIR" insurance as well???  Give me a break!  At least be sneaky about it.  Raise your food items another .50 cents to cover it.  I spoke to Lydia the manager, and she shrugged it off by saying "oh well".   Well...oh well is right...now others can read about it.
author: John M.

description: somehow this white-tablecloth restaurant, with a (generally) higher-end menu, exists on two ends of the spectrum. judging by the fleet of $50k+ vehicles parked outside, you'd assume they cater specifically to a certain type of demographic. but if it's a game day, this is where many of the "quality" bridge and tunnel individuals go to start their unadulterated consumption of alcohol before heading in to the stadium for $9 pints of watered-down beer. they congest the sidewalk, looking confused, arguing, yelling, and increasing nearby property values a few times a week during baseball season. if it happens to be in the three or so months which are not set aside for america's pasttime, this restaurant operates as a business-casual, reservations-recommended, valet-parking sort of dining experience. oddly enough, it sort of works for this place. you can join the mass of people who gather here weeknights for happy hour, (which so happens to be pretty nice on cool evenings when they put the portable heaters on the patio outside), have a fairly quiet nice meal tucked away at one of their tables on the floor, or have a nice workday lunch in the sun on the patio. they have an exposed kitchen which always seems nice to me as i like to see the goings-on of a restaurant anyway - except at tu lan, where i'd rather never see into the kitchen.
author: Jeremiah W.
